loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en: Fatama is the group leader of Fatama group. There are three members in this group. Each member wants to take a loan for expanding her business.  They are requesting a group of loan 42,000 Afghani. Fatama wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.  Khanm Belqes wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Fareuda wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. They are very thankful to kiva lenders who can support all poor people.

loans.use: To expand businesses: tailoring, carpet weaving, general store.

loans.name: Takku Liggey 7 Teffes Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Takku Liggey 7 Teffes regroupe des femmes habitant un quartier en bordure de mer dans la ville côtière de Mbour située à 70 km de Dakar la capitale Sénégalaise. Elles s’activent dans des activités telles que la vente de chaussures, de tissus, de la restauration et de la pêche. Les revenus tirés de leurs différentes activités leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Avec le prêt qu’ils sollicitent ils veulent renforcer leur activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey 7 Teffes Group brings together women who live by the sea in the coastal city of Mbour, located 70 km from the Senegalese capital Dakar. They work in activities like shoe sales, fabric sales, catering and selling fish. The incomes they generate from their different businesses allow them to support their children. They hope to strengthen their businesses with this loan.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen their businesses

loans.name: Luisa Alexandre

texts.pt:
Luisa Alexandre M. nasceu em namaacha uma vila no município de namaacha, e divorciada mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 9 aos 27 anos de idade os três mais novos e que vão à escola.

Apos a morte do seu pai Luisa teve que parar de estudar e dar espaço aos irmãos mais novos, um ano depôs com ajuda do seu tio consegue ingressar num curso de formação de professores onde conhece seu marido. E afeta para trabalhar numa das escolas do mesmo distrito como professora de português, seu marido abandona a e junta se com outra esposa Mas a sua vida econômica não lhe causou muitos problemas porque ele enviava mensalmente uma sexta básica que durava um mês dando assistência aos filhos, Luisa trabalha das 6h às 12h como professora no período da manha auferindo um valor de 2.977.00MT e no período da tarde como auxiliar do partido FRELIMO auferindo um valor de 3.010.00MT. Não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque alem dos seus filhos Luisa responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando por mês um valor de 500.00MT e encontra se a construir a sua casa fazendo manutenção das portas que por ventura já se encontram desgastadas devido às chuvas freqüentes que caíram há meses atrás.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Luisa na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva estes 15.000.00MT serão para cobrir a sua varanda e renovação das portas. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer manutenção de pintura.
texts.en:
Luisa Alexandre M. was born in Namaacha. She is divorced and has 5 children between the ages of 9 and 27. The three youngest are still in school. After her father's death, Luisa had to leave school and make room for younger siblings. A year later, with her uncle's help she was admitted to a teacher training program, where she met her husband. She works in the local schools as a Portuguese teacher. Her husband left her and remarried, but she didn't have economic difficulties because he sent her some money every month to help with the children. Luisa works from 6 a.m. to noon as a teacher, earning 2977 meticals a month, and in the afternoons as a an aide for the FRELIMO party, where she earns 3010 meticals a month. She is unable to save any money because in addition to her children, Luisa also takes care of her mother, sending her 500 meticals a month. She needs to make repairs on her house, since the doors were badly damaged by the constant rain that fell a few months back. This is Luisa's third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She will use the 15,000 meticals to pay for the veranda and repairing the doors. She is confident that she will pay off her loan early and request a new one so she can repaint the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is happily married with three children and she is 45 years old. She lives in Lagos. She sells provisions, necklaces, and she makes bags for sale. She has been in the business for the past ten years.

Mercy has been borrowing from LAPO for the past year and the loan has positively increased her business. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions, necklaces and bag materials to enable her to make more bags to sell. This, she says will enable her meet the growing demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, necklaces and bag materials

loans.name: Stephen Majani

texts.en:
Stephen O. is 31 years-old, married to Caroline Wiyala and both are blessed with one child. His business is located in Eldoret town and he has been in the tailoring business for the past nine years.

Stephen was introduced to KADET by a group member and with the loan he has applied for, he intends to buy more materials for his tailoring business. 

In future he intends to diversify to a bigger store for his tailoring business and have more money to design and sell more clothes in wholesale. He would also like to buy a plot and be able to educate his children at an institution of higher learning.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying more materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia P. is a direct seller of AVON, MSE and Natasha products. Due to lack of job opportunities, she and her husband ended up cultivating a small parcel of farm land which they inherited from their ancestors. They plant rice and vegetables.

Emilia and her family live happily in the peaceful community of Barangay Villa Coloma of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished her studies in college before she got married to Neftali P.. They are blessed with two children: Dann Nathaniel and Eunessly. Both of the children are now in elementary school. Emelia has great ambition for her children. She wants them to be successful in their studies and careers someday.

Despite the difficulties of life, Emilia and her husband are striving to earn a living and support the financial needs of their children. Emilia wants a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders that will be rolled into her direct selling business to make it grow. She aims to improve this business so that she can earn a higher income to ensure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: To improve a direct selling business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: W. Sarah is a business woman of thirty-nine years old, married with two children studying.  She operates a bar business and it is over five years in her business. She is using the loan in purchasing bar items such as beers, waragi, sodas, water, etc to expand on her business. Her future dream is to buy a plot of land

loans.use: For purchasing bar items such as beers, waragi, sodas, water, etc to expand on her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer muy alegre de 38 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa. Desde su infancia se dedica al cultivo de plátanos; tal actividad la heredó de sus padres, de quienes también aprendió las tareas para el cuidado y limpieza de sus plantaciones. Nelly usa el guano de ave de corral para sus tierras, pues es muy efectivo y le permite un crecimiento uniforme de todos sus platanales. Cada fin de mes, comercializa su producto desde su misma chacra vendiendo por kilo, prefiere hacerlo así porque puede contralar mejor el peso, ya que las veces que ha vendido por arrobas (12 en 12 kilos), con mucha facilidad la engañan. Nelly se siente muy feliz de ser agricultura y más aun que mediante sus cultivos se genera muy buenas ganancias para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal, porque aparte de los créditos puede tener sus ahorros. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de guano de isla (de los gallinazos) y en la preparación de la chacra donde hará su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nelly is a cheerful, 38-year-old woman who lives with her partner and father of her three children, who live at home. Since childhood she has grown bananas, an activity she inherited from her parents, from whom she also learned how to care for and clean the plantations. Nelly uses the droppings of birds from the farm for the earth, because it is very effective and results in the uniform growth of all her fields. At the end of each month, she sells the product by the kilo out of her farmhouse. She prefers to sell this way because she can control the weight more easily; when she has sold by arrobas (12 in 12 kilos), she has been tricked easily. Nelly is very happy with her work as a farmer and even happier that her crops generate very good earnings to support her household. This is her third loan with MFP and she is pleased to belong to a communal bank, because in addition to loans, she can also keep her savings there. The money that she seeks now she plans to invest in the purchase of island guano (from vultures) and in the preparation of the farm where she will sow her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Matenkay Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Matenkay group. They are small scale businesswomen in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each; this money will enable them improve their businesses. For instance, they will be able to add more goods into their stalls and thus make more sales and increased profits. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and children. 

The leader of this group is Ramatu C. (left). Ramatu was born in Matotoka village, about eight miles from Magburaka town. She is now thirty seven years old. She is married to a teacher and they have three children – one in secondary school and two in primary schools. Ramatu sells palm-oil and sometimes rice. She has been a businesswoman for six years now.

loans.use: investing in their businesses

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 41 years old and married with three children, one of whom is attending school.

She has a business selling a wide variety of fruits and vegetables in a market place in Kajiado, a small town near Nairobi. She has been in business for 15 years and says that her husband helps her when he is not working as a machine operator.

Rael successfully repaid a previous loan for 20000 KES. Her current loan is for 30000 KES and she will use the funds to expand her grocery business.

In the future Rael hopes to buy her own plot of land, build a rental property, start another business, and support her children in their education to a high level. She says that through loans from Faulu and her business they can together bring out the meaning of development.

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Galdina

texts.es:
La señora Galdina S. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo mucho en su negocio, pero por problemas de salud y no pudo seguir atendiéndolo y tuvo que encargarse de le una hija. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la barda alrededor de la casa en la planta alta, ya que se encarga de cuidar a sus nietos y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que genera su esposo el señor Eduardo Escalera de su trabaja en una compañía de trasporte en el departamento de chofer de camión de carga.
texts.en:
Mrs. Galdina S. is grateful for the first loan she received, which helped her business a lot. Unfortunately, she suffered some health problems and could not continue taking care of the business, which is now run by one her daughters. Today, Galdina is asking for a loan to build a railing around the top floor of her house. She takes care of her grandchildren, and she is afraid for their safety. She plans to repay the loan with part of the income her husband, Mr. Eduardo Escalera, earns working as a commercial truck driver employed in a transportation company.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a railing

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 44 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y amable. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Yon de 17, Fredy de15 y Luis de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Manejando su motocarro, Juan mantiene a sus hijos, sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad con ellos, puesto que tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Él es una persona muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios, lo cual ha hecho que las personas que lo conocen prefieran subir a su motocarro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros, ya que así hace más amenos sus largos viajes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. 
Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más motocarros, ya que sueña con tener una empresa de transportes.

Este es el tercer préstamo al que accede Juan con MFP, siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un nuevo motocarro para que su hijo trabaje con él, para ello está dispuesto a completar el costo con dinero de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
. Juan, 44, is a hard-working, pleasant man. He lives in his own house with his three sons: Yon, 17, Fredy, 15 and Luis, 10, who are the motivating force in his life. Juan is a mototaxi driver. This work supports his children. He knows that he has a big responsibility with them for he has to see to their tranquility. He is a cheerful person and always receives his passengers with a smile on his lips which makes him the preferred driver. What he most enjoys about his work is chatting with his passengers which makes the long journeys much more pleasant. He has been in this line of work for 3 years and considers the most difficult part of it is having to work until very late at night. With time, he hopes to buy more mototaxis since his dream is to have a transportation business. This is his third loan with MFP. He has always been punctual with his repayments because he does not want to cause any problems for his communal bank in which he is a well-liked and active member. With the 1000 new sol loan requested, he will buy a new mototaxi so that his son can operate it. To accomplish this, he is willing to pay the difference with his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy another vehicle.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma sells fresh food such as bread in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $54 a month from this activity. Part of her loan will be used to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel B. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Madel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily need products, such as bread for snacks, candies, shampoo, sugar and sachet coffee, in the local community. Madel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Madel joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Madel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bela

texts.en: Bela D., 36, lives in Semyonovka.  She has worked at a local school for five years as a  librarian.  Bela lives with her husband, son and daughter in a private house.  During the last 10 years she and her husband have also been busy as farmers.  They have some cows and a calf.  All of the profits from farming are spent to meet the family's needs.  Bela asks for 1.100.000 AMD loan to buy some sheep and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.use: Buy sheep and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhouk R. is a 35 year old, married woman. She currently lives with family members in the province of Kampong Chhnang. Chhouk R. was busy selling fish at the market when the photo was taken, so her husband is shown instead. 

To earn a living, Chhouk R. sells roasted fish that she buys in bulk from her wholesale suppliers. Typically she earns $8 per day. She also relies on the income from her husband’s watch sale trade. Chhouk R. is taking out her first loan to order more roasted fish from her suppliers. She will store the fish for a while and then resell it for income. 

Chhouk R. has five children; four are married and one is single.

loans.use: To buy more roasted fish for resale

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Carla pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 22 años, es soltera y todavía no tiene hijos. Carla estudia actualmente la carrera profesional de Derecho en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio de Abad del Cusco. La socia es una mujer joven, trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de bloquetas  de cemento. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a su empeño pone en su trabajo. Carla nos cuenta que este negocio pertenecía a su mama pero ahora su mama le dio la responsabilidad de administrar el negocio, Carla tiene 3 empleados que producen las bloquetas. Carla requiere el préstamo para comprar 150 bolsas de cemento.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the “Qory Orcco de la Asociación Arariwa” comunal bank. She is 22 years old, single with no children. She is a student at “Universidad Nacional San Antonio de Abad del Cusco.” She is a young hard working and enterprising women who has her own business selling cement blocks. She’s been doing this for one year and is doing well, thanks the emphasis she gives. Carla tells us that this business once belonged to her mother, but her mother has passed the responsibility onto her. She has three employees who produce the blocks. She needs this loan in order to buy 150 bags of cement. She is thankful for the opportunity given through this media and promises to make her payments on schedule. (The members of this communal bank meet every thirty days in the city of Pucyura, located in the Anta district in the Cusco department, 40 minutes from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Karina es soltera y tiene 22 años, Karina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, leche, azúcar.
Los sueños de Karina son comprar un carro y surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) communal bank. She is 22 years old and single and has a small general grocery store, which she runs the store daily with her mother’s help. She needs this loan for 1,200 PEN to invest in rice, noodles, milk, and sugar. Someday she would like to buy a car and offer greater variety in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He’s 24 years old and married, and he passed the primary level of education. He will use this loan to purchase two barber rotation chairs and new equipment like scissors, shaving machines and hair dryers. He will hire a new employee after taking this loan and thinks he can attract more clients. He expects that his income will increase.

loans.use: Purchasing barber rotation chair, hair dryer

loans.name: Butiti Twimukye, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Friendly and hardworking B. Grace is married and is the mother of six children. She has operated a bar business for three years, earning her a profit of 40,000 Ugandan shillings weekly. This bar is strategically located in Kibaati, Kyenjojo District, with Grace’s highly-esteemed customer care and hygiene pulling in a good number of customers.

With this loan, Grace hopes to purchase more drinks, that is: beers, soft drinks like sodas, and wines, in order to meet the increasing demand from her customers. This will fetch her more profit and motivate her to go for her dream of owning a well-established bar and also enable her to sustain her family’s needs.

Grace belongs to a group who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan because they want to access the future successfully.

loans.use: To purchase more beers, wine and sodas for her bar business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: “I sold two hogs last December for 14,000 pesos ”, Rosa happily shares about her business. She has been raising hogs for almost three years now. She is 56 years old and has seven children. She is now a widow and does her best to provide for her children. Sometimes she feels like quitting but she gets motivated by her children to continue living. She also thanks God for the strength she has. One of her goals is to improve her family’s living conditions. She recently applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI. She will use it to buy additional piglets and feed. This loan will help sustain Rosa’s business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia Estela R. D. O. D. 38 años D. edad, posee un bazar llamado “variedades Edison”, negocio en el cual comercializa productos varios como arreglos florales, ropa zapatos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, mosquiteros, y todo tipo D. productos para hacer obsequios en ocasiones especiales. Ella vive en casa propia en el municipio D. Ilopango, junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 8 y 10 años D. edad, lugar en el cual también se encuentra ubicado el bazar. Sonia tiene el deseo D. poder expander su negocio, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales le generan ganancias diarias, ya que por la variedad D. productos que venD. sus clientes tienen muchas opciones, ya sea para productos D. uso personal como para regalar. Es por esto que Sonia solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. utilidades, sobretodo en esta temporada en la cual se aproxima la celebración del día del padre y del día del maestro, fechas en las cuales sus ventas aumentas ya que muchas personas incluso hacen encargos D. productos específicos, es por esto que Sonia espera contar con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio y D. esta manera mejorar sus ventas y así solventar todos sus gastos personales y darle todo lo necesario junto a su esposo a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia Estela R. D. O., 38, has a bazaar called 'variedades Edison', a business where she sells floral arrangements, clothes, shoes, hair and body creams, mosquito netting, and all sorts of products for gifts for special occasions. She lives in her own house in the Ilopango municipality, together with her husband and 2 children (8 and 10), in the same region where her bazaar is located. Sonia desires to expand her business, as she now has many customers who proviD. her daily earnings, mainly because she gives her customers a great variety of options, as her products can be used for personal use as well as presents. It's for this reason that Sonia is seeking a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products, mainly because this is the time of father's and teacher's day, dates when her sales increase and many people order specific products. Sonia wants to have everything available to proviD. a better service to her customer and increase her sales, in this way meeting all her personal costs and giving her family everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
Ellos son Shalom (que significa paz o bienestar) un grupo conformado por 11 integrantes los cuales son personas con sueños y deseos de superarse para salir adelante. Todos radican el la Colonia San Miguel Xico 4ª sección Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Este grupo se formo gracias a que escucharon de fundación por parte de una conocida y se decidieron por pedir informes.

Guadalupe F. M. integrante del grupo Shalom. Tiene 40 años solamente término de estudiar la secundaria, es madre soltera, con dos hijos una de 20 y 2 años. Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de artículos escolares en una papelería desde hace seis años ya que desea darle un mejor futuro a su familia, le gustan las ventas y se le facilita la atención hacia la gente, para ella es muy satisfactorio decir que tiene su propio negocio, diariamente abre desde temprano y cierra ya por la tarde, hay días en los cuales las ventas no van bien pero aun así trata de salir adelante.             

Con este crédito quiere comprar más artículos como: libretas, colores, juegos geométricos, gomas, sacapuntas, lápices, para poder tener mas surtida la papelería. Los planes que ella tiene son: poder terminar de arreglar su casa y seguir dándoles estudio a sus hijos, llegar a tener su propio local y no seguir pagando renta.

Los demás integrantes de este grupo son:  
Aurora R. Hernández (Venta de zapatos y colchas por catalogo)                           
Javier P. C. (Venta de materiales para construcción)
Patricia C. C. (Venta de Colchas y Edredones por catalogo)                        
Sixto J. C. (Venta de articulos de temporada, bisuteria)    
Laura O. Páramo (Venta de Avon y Jafra)       
Mariana R. López (Venta de zapatos por catalogo)
David Ramírez M.  (Venta de discos y galletas)
Abigail Sánchez C.  (Venta de antojitos y tamales)
Josefina E. Ramírez (Venta de perfumes)
Silvina C. M.  (Venta por catalogo)

Ellos agradecen a Kiva el apoyo que se les brinda para poder tener un mejor futuro y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
They are Shalom (which means peace and well-being), a group made up of 11 members, all of whom are persons with dreams and desires to improve and succeed. They all live in the Valle de Chalco area of Colonia San Miguel, Mexico. This group was formed thanks to a mutual acquaintance who told them about FRAC, which they then decided to inquire about. Guadalupe, a member of the group Shalom, is 40 years old. She just finished high school and is a single mother with two children, 20 years old and 2 years old. Guadalupe has sold school supplies in a stationery shop for the past 6 years as she desires a better future for her family. She likes sales; it helps her attend to people. For her, it is very rewarding to have her own business. Everyday she opens early and closes late. There are days when the sales are not good, but even then she tries to come out ahead. With this loan she wants to buy more articles, such as notebooks, coloring instruments, geometric games, erasers, pencil sharpeners and pencils, to have more merchandise at the stationery shop. Her plans are to finish fixing her house, giving her children an education and to have her own place so she no longer has to pay rent. The other members of the group are: Aurora (Sale of shoes and bedspreads by catalog) Javier (Sale of construction materials) Patricia (Sale of bedspreads and comforters by catalog) Sixto (Sale of seasonal articles, imitation jewelry and other trinkets) Patricia (Sale of bedspreads and comforters by catalog) Laura (Sale of Avon and Jafra) Mariana (Sale of shoes by catalog) David (Sale of CDs and buscuits) Abigail (Sale of snacks and tamales) Josefina (Sale of perfumes) Silvina (Sale by catalog) They are grateful for the support Kiva has given them to have a better future and accomplish their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of catalogs, shoes, bedspreads and comforters, perfumery, lotions, biscuits, CDs.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Lucinda Maria

texts.es:
Lucinda de 52 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Ella hace manualidades con fomix y papelería como artesanías. 

Comenzó hace mucho tiempo como aprendizaje y lo convirtió en su primer medio de ingresos, poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido tener clientela y vender tanto que ahora su casa la convierte en local para sus manualidades. Una de sus hijas ahora le ayuda a vender las manualidades que hace. 

Hace dibujos, caricaturas, muñecas, artesanías etc. Pero para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo fomix, pegamento y la otra parte alquilar un local para su negocio. 
 
En el futuro ella quiere tener un almacén de manualidades y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucinda, 52, lives in El Guasmo, Guayaquil, an urban area whose inhabitants are mostly low-income. She makes handicrafts with Styrofoam and paper. She started out long ago as an apprentice but eventually turned it into her main source of income. She has gradually acquired regular customers through her efforts and now sells so much that she has turned her house into a store for her crafts. One of her daughters helps her sell the crafts she makes. She makes drawings, caricatures, dolls, crafts, etc. But, in order to be able to continue with her business, she wants to use the loan to buy Styrofoam and glue and use another part of it to rent a space for her store. In the future, she would like to have a large crafts store and continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For Styrofoam, glue and locale rent.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Tito C. le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de la casa, ya que no tiene seguridad de para que sus dos pequeños hijo salgan a jugar. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material, ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horarios adicionales de si empleo.
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo en una compañía como empleado. Desea que su familia tenga la seguridad cuando el no se encuentre en la casa.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Angélica De La Cruz esposa del señor Tito, ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita y quien nos atendió fue Doña Angélica.
texts.en:
Tito C.’s house lacks a fence in front of the house. Without it, there is no security for when his two small children go outside to play. He requests the loan to purchase the material. He takes it upon himself to do the project outside of normal working hours. He plans to pay the loan with the income he obtains from his job as a company employee. He wants his family to be safe when he is not at home. The person that appears in the photo is the wife of Tito, Angélica De La Cruz, since he was at work the day of the visit, and Angélica attended to us.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making the fence in front of the house

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 40 year old man from Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon. Mohamad lives with his wife and single kid. Mohamad works in construction; he is specialized in digging lands and roads. Mohamad has seven years of experience in this domain, he has a poclain and a bobcat machines to do such kind of work. This is Mohamad’s Fifth cycle with Al Majmoua, he requested a loan in order to buy new wheels to the bobcat and make the necessary maintenance to his machines. His clients are anyone possible, because there is a lot of request for this kind of work. Ali hopes to own a bulldozer in the future in order to increase & improve his family income and level.

loans.use: To buy new wheels to the bobcat and make the necessary maintenance to his machines

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 36 años, vive en compañía de su único hijo en casa de sus padres. Hace un año y medio que tiene un estudio fotográfico, ofreciendo el servicio de fotografía, así como de impresión de fotos digitales y análogas. Su establecimiento esta ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Tarma.  Desde entonces trabaja todos los días y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece a sus clientes ha logrado ganar más. Afirma que le gusta esta actividad, porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico además de que  siempre  le agrado tomar fotos y retocarlas. En adelante desea tener equipos más sofisticados para su estudio fotográfico. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una cámara digital con mayor resolución de imagen, de esa manera podrá mejorar la calidad de su servicio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and lives with her only son in her parent's house. For a year and a half she has had a photographic studio where she offers photographic services, and also prints digital and film photos. Her establishment is located in a central area of the city of Tarma. Since she works every day, and thanks to the good service she offers her customers, she has managed to increase her earnings. She states that she enjoys this activity, because it doesn't require a lot of physical effort, and also she likes to take photos and retouch them. In this future she wants to have more sophisticated equipment for her photographic studio. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she is pleased to have financial support, since she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she enjoys being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative people. She thanks those persons who will administer the loan that she requests, which will be very useful in helping her to make progress with her business. With the loan she requests, she will invest in the purchase of a digital camera with better resolution, so that in this way she will be able to offer better quality services.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Sreykea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreykea C. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Bunheng Phai, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for over thirteen years and have six children, five sons and one daughter. Four of them attend school and the other two are still too young. 

Sreykea runs a grocery store at her home. Her husband has been a fisherman for more than ten years. She is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase a motorcycle for her brother to drive to work. Also, she will use part of the loan to buy grocery items for resale in her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store and a motorcycle for her brother.

loans.name: Yasmin  Bolivia

texts.es: La Srta. Yasmin es cliente que vive en la ciudad de La Paz,  en la zona Villa nueva Potosí,  es soltera de ocupación comerciante cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el rubro , ella se dedica a la venta de café tiene su cafetería en una de las calles mas populosas de la ciudad de la Paz, le va muy bien cuenta con numerosa clientela,  y menciona que invertirá el dinero en la compra de café procesado, es muy joven y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a borrower that lives in the Villa Nueva Potosí area of the city of the La Paz. She is single and is a merchant with 4 years of experience in the trade. She works selling coffee and has her café on one of the most populated streets in La Paz. The business is going very well for her and she has a large client base.

She mentions that she will invest the loan money in the purchase of processed coffee. She is very young and hardworking, and is very appreciative of Emprender for the confidence provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of processed coffee

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence L. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Florence is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Florence owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Florence has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florence joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florence is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Florence from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child, who is not currently in school. Mercy has a business of a salon, which she has had for 1 year, and she also sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Mercy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetic lotions. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mercy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Mercy hopes to own a big cosmetics shop.

Mercy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic lotions.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Pascuala;   la socia tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la artesanía la socia realiza trabajos en lana de alpaca, y lana de ovino; la socia compra lanas y las tiñe con productos vegetales, ella luego de elaborar las madejas de lana hace el tejido tomando un extremo de las lanas a una punta que luego irá entrelazando poco a poco haciendo figuras geométricas y variando los tonos de lanas. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar lanas y poder realizar sus tejidos y elaborar mantas, frazadas y otros.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is part of the “Pacha Illairy” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the Ocongate district that pertains to the Quispicanchis province and the region of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Pascuala. She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage and has 3 children. The member makes a living as an artisan, making items out of alpaca and sheep wool. She buys the wool and she tints them with vegetable products. In order to make the wool into yarn she weaves it, taking the end of the wool into a point. She will then enlace them little by little, making geometric figures and varying the tones of the wool. The member needs the loan to buy wool and to be able to make woven items and different types of blankets. 

The member thanks you and value the loan granted to her and in this same vein she promises to pay the amount in full in the established installments.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy wool to be able to make woven products and blankets.

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika S&c Co-Operation Society - Kampala Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Frank M. says with hindsight that hard work and self-motivation have, for the last eight years, served him right in his spare parts business. He is quick to pay compliments to close friends, whom he says prevailed upon him to start this business. Prior to that, he was more inclined to farming. He still does farming but at a low-key level. 

Kiseka market in Kampala is where he operates and 500,000 shillings is what he totals as weekly profits. Frank is happily married with four kids and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more spare parts for resale. He belongs to the Byona Biyinzika Group - Kampala.

loans.use: The procurement of more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk B. has been trading in plastic goods since 2008. Realizing that the profit from this activity is very important for his family (where one of his parents is disabled), he does his best to maximize his profits by acquiring goods that are in high demand. Currently, customer demand is for a new, varied stock, for which he needs a loan.

loans.use: To purchase new stock

loans.name: Srosh

texts.en:
The woman in this photograph is Srosh S..  She is 29 years old and lives in Kompong Cham Province, a good location for farming. Srosh S. is a married woman who is devoted to her two young children.  Her children attend school and depend on her for care. 

Srosh S. has a  farm which she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband also helps her to grow crops. They are currently planting peanut and rice crops.  They estimate that the harvest will be within the next month, when the plants mature. Srosh S. also owns another farm, but she is not planting crops on it. Srosh S. hopes to use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ulbio Italo

texts.es:
Ulbito de 44 años, el tiene un taller de zapatería en donde elabora zapatos para venderlos y arreglarlos. Viviendo en una zona urbana en Orquídeas  trabajar en el negocio de una  haciendo zapatillas, zapatos para mantener a sus dos hijos, en la actualidad el trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo zapatos en su taller de zapatería. 

Para tener variar diseños de zapatos el necesita comprar con el préstamo materiales como suelas, cuero, pegamento. En el futuro quiere tener una empresa de distribución en la línea de zapatos con su propia marca.
texts.en:
Ulbito, age 44, has his own shoe shop.  He makes shoes to sell, and he does repairs.  He lives in an urban zone in Orquídes.  He works in his business making slippers and shoes in order to support his two children.  He starts making shoes in his shoe shop very early in the morning. 

In order to have various styles of shoes, he needs the loan to buy materials like soles, leather, and glue.  In the future he wants to have a business distributing a line of shoes that is his own brand.

loans.use: To buy soles and leather

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has three children.

Ali decided to open his own business so he chose to own a juice shop with all kinds of juices and soft drinks. He is becoming well known and has an excellent reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $1,800 to install shutters in his shop and increase his inventories. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install shutters for his shop and increase his inventories

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Rit H., age 49, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. She has had this business since 2000 and it has provided her with income to maintain her standard of living.

Her husband also helps her in the same business. She has been married for many years ago, but she hasn't had a child yet. Her husband helps her with raising pigs. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Rit H. will be using the loan to buy more small pigs to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy more small pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Sorie. He is single, and has one child aged three. In 2008, Sorie established a provisions and drinks business. He says "I don't have to depend on anybody for assistance" as he believes that his business is the only way for him to earn money to develop his family. Sorie opens his business throughout the week and spends about 11 hours working in his business every day. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy more provisions such as milk, sugar, sardines, margarine and drinks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Sorie plans to expand from a retail store to a wholesale store. He hope to give his child a sound education. Sorie thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his shop

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azucar De Sacllo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PAN D. AZUCAR D. SACLLO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito D. Calca, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Benita; ella tiene 49 años D. edad y es casado y tiene 8 hijos; La socia se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería ella cultiva lo que son papa, maíz, cebada entre otros, a la vez venD. leche D. vaca a los mercados que se encuentran en el valle sagrado como Urubamba, Calca y Ollantaytambo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante por su familia y más ahora que una D. sus hijas está estudiando en una Universidad privada la carrera D. enfermería, la socia está muy contenta ya que está apoyando a su hija que más lo necesita. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para los estudios universitarios D. su hija.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y a la venta D. chicha D. jora (hecho a base D. maíz), todas las socias solo se dedican a esta actividad.

La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The partners are part of the village bank "Pan D. Azucar D. Sacllo".  This bank is located in the district of Calca, which is part of the province of Calca and the department of Cusco. 

Benita is 49 years old, married and has 8 children.  She practices farming and raises cattle.  She grows potatoes, corn and barley, among other things, and also sells cow's milk to the markets in the Sacred Valley, for example Urubamba, Calca and Ollantaytambo.  She is a very happy and enterprising woman who really wants to help her family get ahead, and even more so now that one of her daughters is studying nursing at the private university.  She is very pleased that she is helping her daughter in the way that she needs. 

She is asking for a loan for her daughter's university studies.

The other members of the group participate in agriculture, raising livestock, and selling chicha D. jora (a corn-based drink).  All of the members do only these things.

Benita feels very happy about the loan and promises to meet the payments.

loans.use: to pay for university for her daughter

loans.name: Nestor Jr.

texts.en:
Nestor Jr. A. is from the village of Palabotan Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 28 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Nestor Jr. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Nestor Jr. has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nestor Jr. joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor Jr. is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nestor Jr. from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Palabotan Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, resiD. en Berlín departamento D. Usulután, es comerciante D. ropa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 8 y 14 años D. edad; el negocio es propio, está ubicado afuera del mercado municipal D. Berlín, su horario es D. 8:00am a 5:00pm, tiene 20 años D. experiencia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa: camisas, faldas, blusas, ropa D. niños y ropa interior. Con esta inversión fortalecerá el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes mejores opciones para vestir, considera que el negocio estará más estable y podrá aumentar su rentabilidad.
El objetivo D. Elena es contar con un negocio fuerte, con muchos clientes y recibir mejores ganancias, para ayudar a la superación D. su familia y sobre todo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena lives in Berlín, in Usulután department, with her husband and two children aged 8 and 14.  She owns her own clothes business which is located outsiD. Berlín town market.  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm and has 20 years experience.

Elena is currently requesting a loan to buy clothes: shirts, skirts, blouses, children's clothes and underwear.  With this investment, she will strengthen her business and offer her customers better clothing options.  She believes that her business will be more stable and she will be able to increase her profitability.

Elena's goal is to have a strong business with a lot of customers and to make better profits so that she can help her family to get ahead, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes: shirts, skirts, blouses, children's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Ana isabel que tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Enrique con el cual tiene tres hijos, ellos asisten a la primaria de la comunidad.

Doña ana nos platica que su esposo es topografo pero algunas veces lo que el gana no alcansa ya que cada dia ls cosas suben mas de precio, asi que dicidio iniciar  a trabajar en su propio negocio para aydarlo un poco con los gastos del hogar y los estudioa de sus pequeños hijos

ella nos dice que vende zapatos por catalogo para dama y caballero,  casa por casa, con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, primero lleva los catalagos con sus clientes para mostrar sus productos, levanta un pedido, lo encarga con sus proveedores, cuando llegan los zapatos los entrega a sus clientes y  recibe su pago por sus productos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Catalagos y zapatos para realizar su venta.
 Doña Ana quiere que con este credito hacer crecer su negocio para poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro poder pagarles una carrera. ella envia un saludo a las personas que hacen posibles estos prestamos y  a la fundacion por darle su confiansa.
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Oaxaca called San Miguel Soyaltepec.  This community has a very large lagoon that produces much fishing and work each year.  It is also known because the Cerro de Oro Hydroelectric Dam is located there. 

Ana Isabel, 33, lives here.  She finished 9th grade and is married to Enrique with whom she has three children who attend the local elementary school.
Ana tells us that her husband is a Topographer but what he earns is sometimes not enough because prices rise every day.  She, therefore, decided to start to work in a business of own to help him a little with household expenses and educational costs for their small children.

She tells us that she sells women's and men’s shoes by catalogue, door to door, among her friends and neighbors in the community.  She first takes the catalogues around to her customers to show the products, then takes orders which she delivers to her suppliers.  When the shoes arrive she delivers them to her customers and collects payment for them.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of catalogues and shoes to sell.  She wants to use the loan to enlarge her business in order to provide her children with a better quality of life and in the future pay for them to study a career.

Ana sends a greeting to the people who make these loans possible and to the Fundación for trusting her.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano es un joven trabajador de 27 años de edad el vive con su esposa y pequeño hijo en el distrito de Reque en Lambayeque. La zona donde vive Adriano cuenta con energía eléctrica más no con agua potable. El consumo de agua se hace mediante un pozo tubular.

Adriano se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura, él tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en este oficio que viene desarrollando en a misma zona donde vive actualmente. Adriano cultiva camote, fríjol y maíz por temporada. 

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que utilizará para la siembra de fríjol pues ya es temporada de este producto. 

Adriano ya ha tenido varios créditos con nuestra entidad y esto le ha permitido ir creciendo en su negocio. Ha cancelado puntualmente sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Adriano is a young, hardworking man who is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and their young son in the district of Reque in Lambayeque. The region where Adriano lives is equipped with electricity but there is no potable water. The water they use comes from a well.

Adriano has been dedicated to agriculture since he was very young. He has more than 10 years' experience in the business, which he has been developing in the same region where he lives. Adriano cultivates sweet potatoes, beans, and corn according to the season.

He requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles to plant beans. This product is currently in season.

Adriano has had various loans with our organization and this has helped him increase his business. He has repaid his loans on time.

loans.use: to start a bean plantation.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with three children. Julita has been working as a farmer in the Philippines for 10 years.

Julita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers to make her crop more productive and to pay for laborers who help her work on the rice farm. She hopes this loan will grow her operations. Currently, Julita earns PHP 30,000 each cropping in this field of work.

In the future, Julita hopes to make her crop more productive in order to generate more income and make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for laborers

loans.name: Miguel Ernesto

texts.es:
Miguel, es un agricultor, vive con su familia, su esposa y un hijo de dos años de edad, él trabaja sembrando frijol en un pequeño terreno, de este cultivo comercializa y consume también su familia. Miguel está iniciando las labores para la siembra de frijoles, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar semilla mejorada.
Este préstamo, significa mucho para él, pues es el único medio para llevar a cabo su trabajo, con el objetivo de tener un buen desarrollo en la plantación de frijol y generar al final una buena cosecha para comercializar.
Su sueño es algún día comprarse su propia casa, para vivir dignamente con su familia.
texts.en: Miguel works in agriculture.  He lives with his wife and their son who is two years old.  Miguel plants beans on a small plot of land.  He sells some of the crop and also helps to feed his family with it.   He is getting ready for the harvest and is requesting a loan to purchase better quality seeds.   The loan makes a significant difference to Miguel's success.  The new seeds will help him generate a good harvest to take to market.    Miguel's dream is to be able one day to buy his own house, and live with dignity with his family.

loans.use: To purchase better quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Rosa earns a living through farming. She helps her husband grow rice crops and sell their harvests at the market. 

Rosa has applied for a loan to fund their farm operations. She plans to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs with her loan. She will also pay for the labor of other farmers to help till their land.

In the future, Rosa hopes to have her children graduate from college and find appropriate jobs for themselves.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has five children. Haydar has owned a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
Haydar is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy two refrigerators, a generator and more foodstuff for his market. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators, a generator and more foodstuff for his market.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Maria Teresa y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 24 años edad, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la cosmetología”. 

Maria Teresa es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades saca adelante a su hijo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la educación de su hija. El sueño María Teresa es abrir un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital of La Convención province and an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main business activities here are coca, coffee, cacao and fruit production.

In the town of Quillabamba we visit the "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” community bank and meet María Teresa who tells us:

"I was born in the town of Quillabamba.  I am 24 years old and a single mother.  I have one child and live in the town in which I was born.  I work as a cosmetologist".

María Teresa is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who, in spite of life's adversities, manages to get her child ahead in life.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to pay for her daughter's education.  María Teresa's dream is to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a business selling goat meat, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge othe high cost of transportation in her business. Bibi dreams of purchasing a pick up van to transport the goat meat in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase young goats and fatten them for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase young goats and fatten them for resale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 51 years old, has earned a living through farming for 30 years. She plants different crops such as rice, corn and vegetables. She has also tried cooking and selling delicacies such as rice cakes to the people in her neighborhood and has put up a sari-sari (variety) store business to help augment her income.

Imelda is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to have a stable business to sustain her family, especially regarding her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 39-year-old farmer working in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Arlene does her best to keep her farm productive. She wants to be able to support her family financially.

Arlene has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 56 лет, замужем и воспитала 6 детей. Дамира  с супругом начали свой бизнес в животноводстве в 2001 году, вложив в качестве стартового капитала 8,000 сом (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Дамиры, приносящее около 12,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно, насчитывается 4 коровы, 18 овец и 3 лошади. По выходным дням, Дамира вместе с супругом выезжают на скотный рынок Кадыр-Ата, где перепродают откормленный скот. Также, Дамира имеет точку общественного питания на скотном рынке, где по воскресениям занимается продажей еды. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм. В будущем, Дамира мечтает купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Damira is 56 years old, married and raised six children.  Damira and her husband started their own animal husbandry business with a starting capital investment of 8,000 som (KGS) in 2001.  Today, Damira's business yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month and has 4 cows, 18 sheep and 3 horses.  On weekends, Damira and her husband go to the Kadyr-Ata livestock market, where they resell raised livestock.  She also has a retail outlet at the livestock market, where she sells food on Sundays.  In order to further develop her business, Damira requested a loan in the sum of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up.  In the future, she dreams of buying a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past year, she has operated a food vending business, cooking mahamri (dumplings) and fried potatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sacks of potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
La señora Gloria nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento D. Cusco, Actualmenrte, ella vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació. (En la fotografía la señora Gloria está levantando la mano). 

La señora Gloria es padre y madre para sus dos hijos (mateo D. 8 años y Carmen 5 años), ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante sus hijos, ella es profesora pero no ejerce su profesión por que la paga no es muy buena pero trabaja en una empresa privada D. transportes D. encomiendas. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio.   

La señora Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Emprendemos el Futuro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal como por ejemplo para la educación D. sus hijos, para alimentación y otras necesidades del hogar. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Emprendemos el Futuro” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. útiles escolares, venta D. ropa, venta D. comestibles y los demás trabajan como asistente administrativo, confección D. ropa y enseñando educación.  

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. (Las socias que aparece en la parte inferior D. la fotografía llegaron tarD. a la reunión.)
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Cusco, Cusco Department.  She currently lives in the city of her birth.  (In the photo, Gloria is raising her hand).  Gloria is both mother and father for her two children (Mateo, 8 and Carmen, 5).  She’s a hardworking mother who supports her children.  She’s a teacher but does not work in her profession because salaries are too low.  She works in a private package delivery firm.  She’s been in this business for two years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business.  Gloria is a member of the “Emprendemos el Futuro” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan for personal use; for example, for her children’s education, for food and for other household needs.

The “Emprendemos el Futuro” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco.  Its members are hardworking, enterprising people who are always looking for ways to get ahead and through their own efforts proviD. a better future for their children.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco and the economic activities of the other members are for example: sale of school supplies, clothing sales, food sales.  Others are employed as administrative assistants, seamstresses and teachers.

Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

(The members who appear at the bottom of the photo arrived late to the meeting).

loans.use: to pay for her children's schooling and to buy food and for other household needs.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en: Aleja is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Aleja has a shop that sells eggs, food seasonings and spices. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy more eggs, food seasonings and spices. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Aleja hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, food seasonings and spices.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55-years-old, married and has four children.

Salha has been the owner of a food market since 2000. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a  $1800 loan in order to build an outdoor ceiling, sliding door and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, sliding door and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Denia tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y es miembro del Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, es casada, tiene un hijo varon, y ella es una persona muy luchadora y tiene toda una vida residiendo en la Aldea San Nicolas. 

Denia inició vendiendo ropa de segunda mano para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que el costo de la canasta básica cada día es mas alto. Luego de un tiempo decidió darle un giro a su negocio y ahora solo se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas. Las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante y va visitando las casas de sus vecinos para enseñarles la mercaderia y si les gusta y no tienen dinero para pagarle inmediatamente se las deja al credito. Su horario para realizar las ventas es de lunes a viernes por las tardes y asi le queda tiempo para atender los quehaceres de su hogar pero los fines de semana sale desde muy temprano, aunque su mayor dificultad es cuando llueve no puede salir de su casa. 

El prestamo que solicita Denia lo necesita para comprar brazieres, blumeres, bikinis, boxers, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra seguir adelante con su negocio y eso le permitirá seguir obteniendo ganancias para ayudar a su esposo e hijo. Su meta es comprar unas vitrina para exhibir su producto en casa. Denia tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y ha sido muy puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Denia is 30 years old and works selling underwear. She is a member of the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" communal bank. She is married and has one son. Denia is a very hard working person, and has lived her whole life in the Aldea San Nicolas community.

She began selling second hand clothing to help her husband pay household expenses, since the cost of basic goods is higher each day. After a while she decided to give having her own business a go, and how works selling underwear for women, men, boys and girls. She makes her sales walking from place to place, visiting her neighbors' homes to show them her merchandise. If they like it but don't have money to pay right away, she will let them buy on credit. She works from Monday to Friday in the afternoons, which allows her time to do household chores. On the weekends she goes out very early, and her biggest challenge is that when it rains she can't leave her house.

The loan that Denia is requesting is to buy bras, panties, bikinis, and boxers, among other items. With the support of the loan she will be able to continue with her business, which will secure earnings to help her husband and son. Her goal is to buy a shelf to display her products in her home. She has had various loans with FAMA, and has always paid on time.

loans.use: to buy underwear for men and women.

loans.name: Mirta Judith

texts.es: La señora Mirta a sus 45 años de edad y madre de tres hijos de 27, 25 y 21 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de minutos a celular desde hace seis años en un parque en el municipio de Apartadó ubicado al occidente de Antioquia.  Ella trabaja sola de lunes a domingo desde las 8:00 am hasta las 10:00 pm.  Adicional a esta labor, la señora Mirta labora también vendiendo mercancía como ropa para toda la familia y accesorios. Para la temporada de diciembre que se aproxima la señora Mirta desea comprar más mercancía para surtirse y así poder generar mayores ingresos. A futuro la señora Mirta desea tener su propio Almacén y con este poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirta is 45 years old and the mother of three children (ages 27, 25, and 21). She has been selling mobile phone minutes for six years at a park in the town of Apartadó, which is located west of Antioquia. Mirta works alone Monday through Sunday from 8am to 10pm. In addition to this job, she also sells merchandise such as clothing for the entire family and accessories.

The month of December is approaching, so Sra. Mirta wants to buy merchandise so that she can restock her inventory and generate more income. In the future, she wants to have her own shop and be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and women's accessories.

loans.name: Festo

texts.en: Festo, a doctor by profession, decided to open up a clinic after he resigned from his job. He used the savings he had accumulated. The 28-year-old father of two is faced with a challenge of lack of appropriate equipment to use. His business dream is to have a modern clinic in the region. Festo intends to use the loan to buy lab equipment.

loans.use: to buy lab equipment

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a vegetable stall business from home selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. Mwanasha dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase kerosene for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene for sale.
