loans.name: Miselida

texts.es: Miselida, de 60 años, es una mujer buena, amable y sobre todo muy trabajadora, esta separada del que fue su conviviente por muchos años y con quien tuvo cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Solo su hija Diana de 25 años vive a su lado en su casa propia que pudo comprar con bastante esfuerzo. El trabajo de Miselida consiste en la venta de comida, desde muy temprano comienza cocinando sus ricos salchipollos (Plato hecho a base de pollo frito y papas fritas) y hamburguesas. Ella disfruta mucho de cocinar y lo hace con mucha habilidad, su comida es comprada por muchos clientes, los cuales acaban con los deliciosos platillos en unos segundos. Desde que comenzó a trabajar en esta actividad tuvo un proceso muy largo para poder consolidarse y poder creer como lo hizo hasta ahora, y lo logró y está muy contenta por eso. Para el futuro espera tener un restaurante, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad la comida que prepara, porque actualmente solo lo hace por la noches. Aunque tiene 8 años de experiencia en esta actividad, todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene. Con todo el esfuerzo que realiza espera poder salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Este será el crédito número 9 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y instrumentos de cocina para preparar sus diferentes platos con los que tiene muy contento a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Miselida, aged 60, is a good woman who is friendly and above all hard-working.  She is separated from the man who was her live-in partner for many years, and with whom she has four children who are fully grown and financially independent.  Only her daughter Diana, aged 25, lives alongside her in her own home, which she was able to buy with a significant amount of effort.

Miselida's work consists of selling food.  She starts cooking her delicious salchipollos (a dish made from fried chicken and french fries) and hamburgers very early in the morning.  She very much enjoys cooking and does it with much skill.  Her food is purchased by many customers, who end up with their delicious dishes within a few seconds.

Since she started working in this activity, it has been a very big process to get things up and running, and to believe in how things have worked up to now. She has achieved this, and is very happy about it.

In the future, she hopes to have a restaurant where she call sell her food throughout the day and with more ease, because currently she only sells at night-time.

While she has eight years of experience in this activity, she still finds it difficult to serve all her customers.  With all the effort that she puts in, she hopes to be able to move ahead and improve her life.

This will be her ninth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support to be able to continue growing her working capital.  In addition, she is convinced that she will continue to be a good member of the bank, and responsible as with the previously obtained loans.

With the 3,000 soles requested, she will purchase ingredients, supplies, and kitchen tools for preparing the different dishes which make her customers happy.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and non-perishable items for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a 45-year old mother of five children. She has been selling charcoal for the last 11 years with great success.  

This is her third loan of Kes 30,000 from KADET to finance her business.  She plans to use the funds to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resell to the residents of Kilifi.  She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business further.  

She hopes to have a successful business and thus live a happier and more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has four children. She produces "gari" (cassava grits) and "kenkey" (fermented corn dough) at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase cassava and  maize for the production of  her "gari" and "kenkey" for sale. With the new profits, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and  maize to for the production of  her "gari" and "kenkey".

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Veronica works hard to support her family.

Veronica has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. However, she also earns additional income from furniture making and reselling vegetables. 

Veronica has already successfully repaid her previous loans, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She will take a 26,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy sacks of charcoal for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a very organized mum who is focused on her goals, her family and her work. This lovely and exceptional lady is from Kitale, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. One thing you will notice when visiting Kitale is that the place is all green! Expansive maize plantations stretch as far as the eyes can see. Maize, vegetables, and dairy farming are the most dominant activities in the area. 

For five years, Consolata has been banking on dairy farming to provide for her two children. Her primary income source is milk, poultry, and crops. 

Consolata is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She is seeking a loan through Juhudi Kilimo because the microfinance institution has an exclusive focus on farmers. With the money, she will buy more poultry. This move not only increases her income, but also helps her to manage various risks that may befall dairy farming in the future. Consolata is aware that the Christmas season is coming and she wants to have her business well stocked to meet demand.

Consolata is the type of mother who places a greater premium on education than an average parent. She believes that if she does her part and lays a proper foundation for her children, through education, she will have afforded them a shot at being anything they want to be in the future.

Be kind to this mother who wants to create an impact!

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John's dream of becoming a successful entrepreneur is coming to fruition; he has just completed a construction project of twenty one rental units in Nairobi's Mukuru Kwa Njenga area. 
However, he has not installed toilets at the plot; a critical facility for his tenants; toilets owing to the lack of a sewerage system in the area.
As he says, the Fresh Life Toilets option serves as a great solution due to the safe waste management model. 
He is now seeking to install one Fresh Life Toilet at the plot.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flora would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en: Shukria D/O M. A. was born in Kabul. She is married with five children, and now lives in District 5 of Kabul City. Shukria is illiterate because her family didn't give her permission to study and arranged for her to marry at a young age. Her family is going through financial crisis, so she decided to help her husband by starting an Embroidery Business. With her first loan of $175, she will buy an embroidery machine and more fabrics in order to be able to produce more stock and expand her business. She has a contract with a shop in the market that buys the clothes she makes. This provides her with an income that helps her meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and fabrics

loans.name: Khaleddin

texts.en:
Khaleddin is 39 years old, an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is settled in the Fizuli region, Dilagar village, married, and has 2 children.
Khaleddin has his own grocery store, which he opened 5 years ago to support his family. He is now asking for a loan of US$950 to expand the area of his store.

loans.use: Expansion of the area of his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nouv

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Nouv has been married since 1976 and has 7 children: 2 sons and 5 daughters. Since 1979, she and her husband have been earning living growing rice and planting vegetables.

Mrs. M. has borrowed from MAXIMA already twice. Now she is asking for a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase cows for her farm.

loans.use: Purchase of cows for farming

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 65 years old and is married to Mr. Humberto García. They both have 3 grown up children who are also married and no longer live with them.

Mrs. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez owns a PULPERIA. She has over 30 years of experience in the business. Her clientele are children, men and women of all ages who prefer her store because of the diversity of products she carries.

Mrs. Méndez needs to buy:
Units Concept Cost(USDs)
1 Quintal Rice $38
1 Quintal Sugar $27
1 Quintal Flour $37
1 Bidon Oil $22
2 Boxes Soap $18
2 Docen Soap bars $10
2 Boxes Salsa Natura $8
1 Pack Clorine $10
1 Big bag Detergent $11
1 Big bag Toilet paper $7
3 Docen Tooth paste $24
2 Boxes Soups $20
2 Docen Salsa Lizano $18
1 Docen Numar Butter $10
1/2 Docen Chicken Broth $5
1 Box Tang $2
2 Docen Spaghetti $8
1 Box Kola Shale $16

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Sra. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 65 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Humberto García ambos tienen 3 hijos adultos y casados ya no viven con la pareja. La Sra. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez es propietaria de una pulpería, tiene más de 30 años de experiencia, sus clientes son niños, hombre y mujeres de todas las edades que la prefieren por vender diversidad de productos. La Sra. Méndez necesita comprar 1quintal de arroz el quintal cuesta $38.00 dólares, 1 quintal de azúcar el quintal cuesta $27.00 dólares, 1 quintal de harina el quintal cuesta $27.00 dólares, 1 bidón de aceite $22.00 dólares el bidón, 2 cajas de jabón de lavar $9.00 dólares cada caja, 2 docenas de jabón de baño $5.00 cada docena, 2 cajas de salsa natura $4.00 dólares cada caja, 1 paca de cloro $ 10.00 dólares cada paca, 1 bolsón de detergente $11.00 dólares el bolsón, 1 bolsón de papel higiénico $7.00 dólares el bolsón, 3 docena de pasta de diente $8.00 cada docena, 2 cajas de sopas $ 10.00 dólares cada caja,2 docena de salsa lizano $9.00 dólares cada docena, 1 docena de mantequilla numar $10.00 dólares la docena, 1/2 docena de consomé $5.00 dólares la media docena, 1 caja de tang $2.00 dólares la caja, 2 docenas de espagueti $4.00 dólares la docena, 1 caja de kola shale $ 16.00 dólares la caja.

loans.use: Purchasing of rice, sugar, flour, oil, soaps, tooth paste, detergents, soups, pasta, salsas, butter, chicken broth, toilet paper, clorine, etc.

loans.name: Matauina

texts.en:
Matauaina is one of the successful businesswomen at the Fugalei Market. She sells different varieties of food, and she is open six days of the week including Saturdays. She earns $800 WST ($320 USD) of profit a week and this money will be used for church donations, Family Weekly expenses and also for the children’s school things and fees. Her husband works seven days a week and he usually gets about $125 WST ($50 USD) per week.

This is her first loan, and she is grateful for the opportunity to have access to loan money which she was not able to have before. Now she is making sure that her income will be an alternative income so that she can repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her food stall businesss

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.fr:
Mr. Aboubakar Y. is 37 years old, married and the father of 5 children. He has been a butcher for 10 years at the big Adéta market. His main source of income is the profit from his sales, which barely allows him to provide for the needs of his family. With this loan he would like to buy 3 oxen for slaughter and resale. This will allow him to increase his sales and thus improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Aboubakar Y. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 05 enfants. Il est boucher depuis 10 ans dans le grand marché de Adeta. Sa principale source de revenu est les profits issus de ses ventes qui lui permettent de subvenir à peine aux besoins de sa famille. Il désire, par ce crédit acheter 03 bœufs, pour l’abattage et la revente. Tout ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes et par là améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 oxen for slaughter and retail sale of the meat

loans.name: Mahmadsharif.

texts.ru:
Mahmadsharif P. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 42 years old, is married, has 4 children and a high school education. Mahmadsharif plants wheat. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He has 3 years of experience in this area. Agriculture helps to provide local residents with wheat and flour and allows Mahmadsharif to support his family. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Пиров Махмадшариф Кучарович житель района Хуросон. 42 года ,женат, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством, посевом пшеницы.Кредит планирует использовать на покупку зерна и удобрений для посева.Опыт работы ав данном бизнесе 3 года.Развитие сельского хозяйства позволяет обеспечить население пшеницей и мукой , атак же обеспечить свою семью. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim T., 45, is a widow with four children who stays at home to looking after and cook for the children. One of her children is married and lives away from home. Two others are garment workers in Phnom Penh city with a salary $60 each a month. Her other child is a student.

To earn extra income, she needs a loan from Kiva to purchase cashew nuts in stock to resell for profit. Selling cashew nuts is a lucrative business.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts in stock.

loans.name: Freedom 2030-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace Ewdard. She is currently in the business of selling to the hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Grace is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 8 children ranging from age 18 to 30 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately 500 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Grace is joined in her small group by Elias U., Awadia S., Ajelina K., and Ludia S.. Elias U. has a business in selling breads and wants to expand the business. Awadia S. is currently operating a business in selling breads and wants a loan for building . Ajelina K. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Ludia S. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Sabé

texts.en:
Sabé N. lives in Kébémer, in the Louga region of Senegal. She is 31 years old and married with three children. Sabé has been a member of the Centre 2C Village Bank for three years.

Sabé is asking for this loan to take on a very big project. She will use this loan to purchase special tinted fabric called "Thioub," which is very popular in Senegal. She will also puchase a horse and carriage for transport.

This is a new and exciting endeavor for Sabé. She has an excellent repayment record for her previous loans. This loan is for a duration of six months and will be repaid by a single, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To buy special tinted fabric to sell and a horse for transportation.

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Võ Thị Tịnh, 40 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2001. She has six children and they are all school-aged. When she joined the fund, she made plans with her husband, Nguyễn Văn Đức, to borrow capital and put it towards raising female pigs. The family's animal rearing business was advantageous for them. They gained experience on raising pigs.

In the beginning, they only raised one deer and two female pigs. They have been able to expand their animal rearing business to include ducks. With three hundred egg-laying ducks, their income increased to an average of 300,000 per day. Their income was steady such that they repaid the loan completely without a hitch.

For this round of loans, they are seeking 18,000,000 VND to put more towards raising pigs and ducks. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Võ Thị Tịnh 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001, khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn chị đã mạnh giạn bàn bạc cùng với chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Đức, vay vốn của Quỹ về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn nái, việc chăn nuôi của gia đình anh chị diễn ra thuận lợi, kinh nghiệm về chăn nuôi lợn nái của anh chị được tích lũy, từ ban đầu chỉ nuôi 1 con nay gia đình anh chị đã có 2 con lợn nái và anh chị cũng đã mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi đầu tư vào nuôi vịt đẻ, với 300 con vịt đẻ thì thu nhập của gia đinh anh chị đã tăng lên bình quân mỗi ngày 300.000đ . Mức thu nhập đều đặn này viêc trả vốn vay gia đình chị hoàn toàn không gặp khó khăn, chị có 6 con và các cháu đang ở độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To raise pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Olson

texts.es:
Olson is 20 years old and has been working with his family in agriculture since he was a teenager. He works hard on his agricultural land, which he will inherit from his parents; this will help cover the costs of his university studies. Although he receives support from his parents there are times when the money is not enough due to the costs of various books and homework from the university. The request Olson makes is for the purchase of compost and fertilizers so that his production improves in quality and brings higher profits, which will cover the student costs. It is very difficult to work and study at the same time, but this does not matter to Olson because his biggest wish is to finish his schooling. Help this young student improve his agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olson es un joven de 20 años que desde adolescente trabajo con su familia en la agricultura, él trabaja con esmero en sus terrenos de cultivo, lo que heredé de sus padres, actividad que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de sus estudios universitarios. A pesar de recibir el apoyo de sus padres hay momentos que el dinero no le alcanza por los diversos libros y tareas de la universidad. El pedido que hace Olson es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para que su producción tenga una mejor calidad y esto le traiga mayores ganancias, las que solventarán los gastos estudiantiles, es muy difícil trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, pero a Olson no le importa porque lo que más desea es terminar su carrera. Ayuda a este joven estudiante con la mejora de sus productos agrícolas.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers for his cultivos.

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhagabati L., 42 years old, is a tailor in the town of  Kalanki in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 15 years ago.  Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi and others.
 
Before starting her own business, Mrs. L. took a 6-month training course in tailoring from Sunita tailor shop near her town when she was younger.

She plans to use her Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.  She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.  

Her husband's name is Sahadev L. and he is a tourist guide.  She has two daughters and one son.  Her two daughters just took the +2 education exam and her son is working and studying abroad.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Sok N. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She owns a small grocery in the local market which located in Phlov Veay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so Mrs. Sok N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

Her husband, Mr. Tep Sakhean, owns a rice mill which he can make income from. Mrs. Sok N. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Sok N. obtained a loan from AMK to build a new house for her household. She has succeeded in paying that loan back.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her inventory

loans.name: Jorge Martin

texts.es:
Jorge inició el negocio porqué pensó que era una actividad comercial muy importante ya que siempre existirán personas que tengan la necesidad de transportarse en taxi, como los empleados, alumnos, maestros etc. y de esta forma podía obtener un ingreso para sostener a su familia. Comenzó en Octubre de 1998 por lo que casi va a cumplir 20 años en esta actividad, aunque primero empezó como chofer de un microbús de ruta fija y posteriormente comprpo su propio vehículo para empezar a trabajar por su cuenta, aunque con el inconveniente de que tenía que rentar las placas, pero afortunadamente ya cuenta con su propia concesión y con un carro de modelo mas reciente. Por lo anterior, no se puedo quejar pues gracias a dios le ha ido muy bien y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que el mismo se fija su propio horario. El anterior crédito con KIVA le ayudó mucho a mejorar su unidad y hacerla mas segura ya que pude invertir el dinero en amortiguadores y afinación para un mejor rendimiento.

El necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para mejorar las condiciones de su unidad y obtener un mejor rendimiento y ahorro de combustible.
texts.en:
Jorge started his business because there are always people in need of transport, like employees, students, teachers, etc., and he thought it was a good commercial activity. By starting the business he was able to earn income to sustain his family. He began in October of 1988, and has nearly 20 years of experience in this business. He first started driving a minivan on a fixed route, and later bought his own vehicle in order to work for himself. This was inconvenient because he had to rent the license plates, but fortunately he now has his own franchise and a new model car. Thanks to God the business has done well and Jorge likes his work because he gets to set his own schedule. Jorge's previous loan with Kiva helped him upgrade his taxi to make it safer because he could invest money in shock absorbers and tuning for better performance. Jorge needs a loan of US$250, which he will use to improve the condition of his taxi so that it performs better and saves gas. He will repay the loan in 3 months.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance

loans.name: Tho's Group

texts.en:
K. Tho is 28 years old and the mother of two children. One child is in school, and the other is three years old. K. is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband Sambath Chea, helps her in the current business. Her business is going well, and she wants to expand it so she has asked for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetable to re-sell to her customers. 
K. is a group leader of four who all live in Tuol Thma Village in Kampong CH. Province.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetable to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers polygames à Banankabougou un des quartiers de la sous-préfecture de Ouelessebougou (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariage, de parenté et de voisinage. Elles exercent toutes le commerce d’articles divers.
Dans leur recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elles décidèrent de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec lequel  elles sont à leur premier prêt.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 500  kilogrammes de céréales, 300  kilogrammes de fruits et une importante quantité de produits de beauté. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place au marché de Ouelessebougou auprès de grossistes et vendent sur place essentiellement en détail et au comptant à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les interêt du prêt et investir le reste dans les  activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 3 children. They live in polygamous households in Banankabougou, a district of the sous-prefecture of Ouelessebougou (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know each other because of ties of marriage, kinship, and neighborhood. They all sell various items. In their search for complementary financial resources they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first loan.

With this loan they intend to buy 500 kg of cereals, 300 kg of fruits, and a lot of beauty products. They do their buying in the market of Ouelessebougou from wholesalers, and they re-sell right where they live, essentially retail and for cash, to a clientele made up mostly of women.

They hope to make an average monthly profit of 22,000 F CFA which they will use to make repayments on the loan, investing the remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals, fruit, condiments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Deng's Group

texts.en:
Deng C. is the leader of a group of five members. She is 23 years old, and makes a living selling fish in the local market. She buys the fish from the fishermen or wholesale supplier and then sells it. She currently earns an income of approximately of $2 a day. She has no children and is married to Choum Sarin, who is 28. He has a business of providing water to his neighbors. Deng C. hopes to enlarge both her and her husband's businesses. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to sell, as well as a pump line, so that her husband can pump more water for sale.

The other four members of the group are:
Chou T. is 55 years old and widowed. She sells fish and has applied for a loan as capital for her business.
Dom S. is 58 years old and widowed. She also sells fish in the market, and requested a loan to buy more fish to sell for additional income.
Sun S. is 57 years old and makes a living catching fish to sell. She seeks a loan to buy more fishing tools like nets.
Soan S. is 32 years old and is a fisher. She needs a loan to purchase additional fish tools.

All of the borrowers live in Chong Kneas Commune of Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale and a pump line

loans.name: Mohammad Wazir

texts.en:
Muhammad Wazir is 28 years old and lives in Kama of Nangarhar province. He is an educated a man with a great deal of experience in his business. He has been involved in agriculture for more than ten years, and he is a hard worker.

To expand his business and make a good income for his family, Wazir has applied for an individual loan of 50000(AF) for a term of 27 months. With the money, he will buy some seed and other necessary things for his land.

He is very happy with the loan process in Afghanistan, and hopes that all the workers who take out loans can make good businesses for themselves. He says it is a good opportunity for everyone. He would like to thank the lenders, as well as Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buy seeds and other necessary things for his land

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
The 10 group members of the Dios Verdadero (True God) Bank of Hope live in San Pedro D. Macoris in the southeastern Dominican Republic. Groups 1 and 2 from this bank are participating in this loan.

Juana T. is the Group 1 Coordinator  She has a 14-year old child and runs a small variety store in her house where she sells a variety of products, specializing in accessories. Juana will use this loan to buy new merchandise to sell so she has more variety to offer her clients. Her dream is to own a boutique some day. 

Most of the other group members are engaged in diverse retail activities, from selling undergarments to bread and fish. Some others have repair shops or cafeterias. They are all looking forward to expanding their businesses to keep providing their children and families with an improved quality of life.
 
On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy new merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu M. is married and the mother of seven children who are currently in school. She is a forty year old trader who trades in charcoal, bags of rice, and vegetable oil. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes, and she has been in this business for the past 6 years.

Through this business, she has supported two of her kids' completion of senior high school. Ramatu obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Bekwai in the Ashanti region where she lives, and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of charcoal, vegetable oil, and bags of rice to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes to receive GH¢800 to restock her inventory. Ramatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Ayi Adakyew’ which means ‘Do what you are doing now well because of Tomorrow’. Her husband is also a farmer who deals in food crops.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal, cooking oil, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr: A. latifa a appris la couture, elle a ouvert un atelier qu’elle a appelé « COUTURE INTELLECT », elle a eu la brillante idée d’y associer le commerce de pagnes ce qui a agrandi son chiffre d’affaire, elle utilise aussi ces pagnes pour confectionner des modèles d’habits qu’elle revend à ses clientes. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1990.elle est une vieille cliente de WAGES et à déjà obtenu 02 crédits, elle sollicite chez WAGES un troisième crédit avec lequel elle pourra augmenter son stock avec 10 pièces de pagnes. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè humbi au nord de Lomé.
texts.en:
A. Latifa learned to sew and opened a little workshop which she calls « COUTURE INTELLECT ». She had the brilliant idea of incorporating the sale of lengths of African print cloth ("pagnes") which increased her turnover. She also uses these "pagnes" to make clothing that she sells to her clients.

She began her business in 1990. She is a long-time client of WAGES and has already received two loans. She is asking for a third loan from WAGES, intending to add 10 lengths of "pagne" to her stock. She is married and the mother of 2 children; she lives with her family in the Agoè Humbi district in the north of Lomé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes"

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is married with two adult daughters. She sells cosmetic at the market. Her profit is 2,500 Ukranian Hryvnia per month.

Venera has been in this business for 12 years. Besides cosmetics she has got another group of goods that she sells - bed sheets. Her business is quite stable. Venera is a kind and honest person. She always wants the best for her clients. They respect her and come back.

Venera would like to borrow 6,000 Hryvnia to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase the sales and spend additional income fixing her apartment. Venera has a grand-daughter and likes to give her little gifts.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
K. Florence is a hardworking 31-year-old lady with three children. She has run a retail shop for over three years, located in Kibuli Kampala. This loan will be used to purchase more shop items such as bags of sugar, maize flour, salt, and soap, so that she can increase her profits.

Her future goals are to build rental houses and to educate her children at good schools.

loans.use: To purchase more items for sale in her shop, such as bags of sugar, maize flour, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Zainab Abdul Shakoor Group

texts.en:
Zainab baji is the group leader of this group of four ladies. They are all very hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses and help their husbands in their employment as well. Zainab baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband’s vegetable selling business.

Of the other ladies, Zareena baji wants a loan to buy fruits to sell, Naziran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes, and Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rafiqan Mairaj-Ud-Din Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city called Lahore, Pakistan where she has lived for the past eight years. Lahore is famous for its history and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband runs a Punjabi food selling business. He sells dahi bhalas and samosas, which are Punjabi foods. He has been in this business for the last three years. The high quality of his food earns him more customers. Rafiqan baji operates an embroidery business to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for the food selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy material (leather and nails) for her shoe making business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bushra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

The members mutually guarantee each others' loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for food selling business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto E. is a rice farmer from Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur, a poor community in Mindanao. His livelihood is farming rice and raising ducks. He is tilling a 1-hectare farm. He is the father of four children, and he works very hard to support his family’s daily needs. Now, he would like to improve the size of his harvest. He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and to fulfill other farming needs. The loan will really help him achieve better yields. 

CEVI helps small farmers sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Farming necessities

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (1328040953) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs to sell. V. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. V. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Artur Daniel

texts.pt:
Artur Daniel Z. nasceu em inhambane tem 43 anos de idade, e casado e pai de 3 filhos, a primeira de 18 anos, a segunda de 13 anos e o ultimo de 1 ano apenas. Os dois mais velhos é que vão à escola.
Artur quando interrompe os seus estudos na 10 classe devido a grande distancia que o separava de casa a escola onde estudava.
Para alem dos seus filhos Artur responsabiliza se pelos seus dois irmãos que estudam na cidade capital enviando lhes mensalmente um valor de 500.00MT.

 Saiu de inhambane para o município da vila de namaacha na fronteira com swazilandia com seu tio a procura de emprego. Apos sua chegada, começa a trabalhar como servente nos Registo civil do distrito de namaacha onde auferia 1.200.00MT, mas devido ao seu desempenho e força de vontade no trabalho, ele é promovido para categoria de assistente administrativo onde auferir salário no valor de 2.600.00MT trabalhando das 07h30minh as 15h30minh meios de semana e nos finais de semana caso haja casamento das 6h às 10h.

Não é primeira vez que contrai empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema, já teve um empréstimo num Banco Comercial (BIM millennium no valor de 21.000,00MT). Este é quarta vez que contrai empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema e no valor de 10.000,00MT que pretende comprar material de construção. Os primeiros créditos (5.500,00MT; 7.000,00MT e 10.000,00MT) foram também para a mesma actividade. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para ajudar a sua mulher a melhorar os seus negócios.
texts.en:
Artur Daniel Z. was born in Inhambane. He’s 43 years old. He’s married and has three children, an 18-year-old girl, a 13-year-old girl, and a 1-year-old boy. The two oldest are currently going to school. Artur had to drop school when he was 10 due to the large distance that separated his home from the school where he studied. Besides his daughters, Artur is responsible for his two brothers who study in the capital city, sending them around 500.00MT, every month. Artur left Inhambane with his uncle for the Vila de Namaacha municipality, next to the border with Swazilandia to find a job. Soon after he arrived, he found a job as a helper in the Civil Registry of the District of Namaacha, where they offered a salary of 1,200.00MT, but thanks to his hard work and good will towards the job, he was promoted to administrative assistant where they offered a salary of 2,600.00 MT working from 7:30am to 3:30pm on week days and from 6am to 10am on the weekends in case there was a wedding. This is not the first time he requests for a loan from Hluvuku-Adsema, and he also obtained a loan from Banco Comercial (BIM millennium, for 21,000.00MT). This is the fourth time he requests for a loan from Hluvuku-Adsema. He will use the 10,000.00MT, to use to purchase construction material. The first loans (5,500.00MT; 7,000.00MT and 10,000.00MT) we also used for this same activity. He is confident he won’t have any problems paying for this loan, and he also wants to request for a new loan to help his wife to improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie M. is a 30-year-old female entrepreneur from Tubuan, Silang, Cavite. Her husband is a local policeman. They have two school-aged children. Margie owns a general store which she started three years ago. She earns P4,000 per week and her business is continuously growing. She recently expanded the business by opening a computer shop and also distributes Avon products. Margie has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for five years now. She is now on her 12th loan with CCT and has recently applied for a new loan of P15,000. She will use the funds to purchase more items to sell at her general store. She will use her profits to refurbish her kitchen sink and cabinet. About CCT CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Alison Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela tiene una pensión familiar donde vende almuerzos y refresco, este negocio le ayuda para poder solventar los gastos de alimentación y educación 
Vive en la zona Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite, papa, y arreglos de la pensión)
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, por su historial es calificada como una clienta excelente, con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Pamela has a family boarding house where she sells lunches and soft drinks. This business helps her to be able to pay the food and education expenses. She lives in the Alto San Pedro region of the city of La Paz in her own home. The loan is to buy rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, and to make repairs to the boarding house. This is the fourth time that she has asked for a loan with Impro. Her history shows that she is qualified as an excellent client. With this loan she will have the opportunity to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is 33 years, married with 4 children aged between 7 and 1.

Esther has a shop for 10 years, she employs 1 people starting from 7h00 A.M to 7h00 P.M. Esther is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a for expanding her business through purchasing rice, sugar and palm oil and other goods for sale.

Through accessing this loan, Esther hopes to see the life of her family changing positively.

loans.use: purchasing more mechandises

loans.name: Mi Corason De Grand Bassin Group

texts.en:
“Mi Corason De Grand Bassin”, which is actually Spanish for “My Heart” of Grand Bassin”, is a loan group made up of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. The group has a wide range of businesses ranging from phone cards and repairs, to used clothing to peanut sales. Lazar R. is one of three representatives of the group. He is 23 years old, single, and has no children.

Lazar has been in business for some years and now sells phone cards for all of the major phone companies in the country. He has also created a relationship with another business that repairs phones and they have created a referral system for each other.

Lazar looks forward to being able to build his business in order to be better able to support his family. On behalf of Lazard, Mi Corason De Grand Bassin, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy in bulk more phone cards of various types

loans.name: Las Marichuis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marichuis está conformado por Estelvina H. A., María Mercado T. y María Auxiliadora A.. Ellas están empezando a trabajar en Adim y esperan seguir para mejorar sus negocios. 

La joven H. A. empezó ayudándole a su abuelita a hacer tortillas y luego se independizo y Mercado T. de 28 años tiene una historia similar ella le ayudaba a una vecina de la cual aprendió el oficio y luego formo su propia tortillería.

La señora A. de 43 años por iniciativas de su nuera empezó a vender sandalias de hule primero solo le ayudaba a ella pero actualmente comercializa independiente este producto.
texts.en:
The Marichuis group is made up of Estelvina H. A., María Mercado T. and María Auxiliadora A.. They are beginning to work with ADIM, and they hope to improve their businesses.

The young Ms. H. A. started out helping her grandmother to make tortillas, and later she started working independently. Ms. Mercado T., who is 28 years old, has a similar story. She helped a neighbor, who taught her, and later she started her own tortilla shop.

Mrs. A., who is 43 years old, started to sell rubber sandals with the help of her daughter in law. At first, she only helped out, but now she independently sells this product.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Claudia Estela

texts.es: Doña Claudia de 38 años de edad,  es madre soltera de dos hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad que cursan la primaria en el colegio del barrio, vive en Hialeah, y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su pequeña y humilde casa  la mistad de piedra y plycem lo cual espera en un futuro hacer toda de concreto  vende ropa, cosméticos desde hace diez años por encargo el cual vende al crédito y al contado. Hace dos años se fue trabajar a costa rica en las bananeras el cual cuando vino puso una venta surtida el cual le iba bien, pero los clientes comenzaron a pedirle crédito y ella le dio un boto de confianza y no le pagaron es por eso se vino a la quiebra con su pulpería y quito la venta y ahora con este sexto préstamo quiere invertir en ropa y cosméticos, perfume y otros que le ayude a recuperarse en capital como en la captación de clientes, y poder apoyar a sus hermosos hijos en su educación para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Claudia is 38 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 10 and 13, who attend the neighborhood primary school. She lives in Hialeah and with much effort has managed to construct her small humble house, half of stone and half of cement board. She hopes in the future to make it all concrete.

Claudia has for ten years sold clothes and cosmetics for credit and cash. Two years ago she went to Costa Rica to work in the banana plantations, selling off her merchandise. The sale went well at first, but the customers began to ask for credit and she trusted them too much. Often, they didn't pay her. This is why her general store reached the brink of bankruptcy and she had to stop selling.

Now, with this 6th loan she wishes to invest in clothes, cosmetics, perfume and other items which will help her recuperate capital, gain customers, and help her beautiful children in their education, so that they may have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHES, COSMETICS AND PERFUME TO SELL

loans.name: Maauga

texts.en:
Maauga O. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maauga owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Maauga has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maauga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maauga is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase land to raise additional crops. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Maauga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pequeña hija, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios.

El negocio de Isabel es la venta de ropa de segundo uso que llega de otros países, todas las semanas sale muy temprano llevando sus fardos de ropa hasta las distintas ferias de la región, es así que los días jueves y viernes vende en la ciudad de Puno y los días sábado y domingo, oferta su mercadería a los pobladores de la ciudad de Juliaca.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para elegir sus horarios, ya que también tiene que dedicarle tiempo a su querida hija. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la ropa que vende, ya que los fardos son muy pesados y se cansa muy rápido. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender su mercadería con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo al que accede Isabel con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y sabe que tiene que invertirlo en su negocio si quiere tener buenos resultados. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y activa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de dónde escoger.
texts.en:
Isabel, 41, is a very hard working and cheerful women. She lives in a rented house together with her little daughter, to whom she wants to provide a good education. Isabel's business is selling second hand clothing that arrive from other countries. Every week she leaves very early taking her bundles of clothes to different markets in the region. Thursdays and Fridays she sells them in Puno city and Saturdays and Sundays she offers her merchandise to the inhabitants of Juliaca city. The thing she likes most about her work is the freedom she has to choose her hours, as she also has to dedicate time to her beloved daughter. She has been doing this activity for 5 years and considers the most difficult thing to be transporting the clothing she sells, as the bundles are very heavy and she tires rapidly. In the future she hopes to have a shop where she can sell her merchandise with more peace. This is the second loan that Isabel has accessed with MFP. She is very happy with the loan opportunity and knows she will have to invest it in her business if she wants to have good results. She is a very cheerful and active associate of her communal bank. With the 1500 nuevos soles she will buy more clothes so she can offer her clients a better variety to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie G. is from the village of Barangay Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 39 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ronnie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest. In 2009, Ronnie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana T. is 44 years old and used to be married to a seafarer. She is a single parent of three children and one dependent, who usually help her in her shop. Nana sells drinks and liquor in her shop. She has been in business for about ten years now, and is very hardworking. Nana is seeking a loan to buy more stock for her shop so that she can care for her children.

loans.use: To buy drinks and liquor for her shop

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 46 years old and married, and he has 7 children. Emmanuel lives in Burera, a region of Ruhengeri in the Northern Province of Rwanda. Here, Emmanuel is a taxi driver, and this is his 10th successful year in this profession. Emmanuel starts his job at 5:00 AM and works until late in the evening hours every day except Sunday. 

After 10 years in driving a taxi, Emmanuel has an idea of selling the needed spare parts for a taxi so that he can make profits om addition to what he gets from driving. To achieve this, he is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to continue taking care of his family and building a secure future for them.

loans.use: Additional taxi spare parts

loans.name: Munyao

texts.en:
R. K. Munyao is 23 years old, single, and does not have any children yet. Her business is located in a very busy market in Thika, a region in Kenya known for pineapple production. R. has been selling fruits, such as oranges, pineapples and bananas, for the last two years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is fluctuating climate conditions leading to low production. However, she works very hard to keep her business successful.
R. is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruits to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to supply her fruits to different parts of the country. Her aspiration is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to expand her business

loans.name: Mavy Elena

texts.es: Mavy tiene 40 años es madre soltera tiene una hija de 15 años , vive en casa propia  tiene amplia experiencia en el rubro de ventas , pero hace 1 año puso su propio negocio de venta de dulces y otros, producto de su trabajo  tiene su casa propia y buena acumulacion de bienes  es padre y madre para su  hija, a Mavy le gusta mantener limpio y  presentable su negocio es por ello que tiene buena clientela, tiene experiencia crediticia  solicita dicho credito para invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda  se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Mavy, 40, is a single mother who has a 15 year-old daughter. She lives in her own home. She has extensive experience in sales, but a year ago she started her own business selling sweets and other items. As a result of her work she has her own home and has accumulated some possessions. She is both father and mother to her daughter. Mavy likes to maintain her business in a very clean and presentable condition. For this reason she has a good customer base. She has prior experience with credit. She requests this loan to invest in improving her home. She submits that she has the capacity and, more importantly, the willingness to make the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Adpat N°1 Group

texts.fr:
L’Association pour le Développement des Parcelles Assainies de Thiès (ADPAT) est un groupement mixte composé de personnes habitantes toutes dans un même quartier  les  Parcelles Assainies, un  très grand quartier à Thiès. Elle a été créée en 2003 sous l’influence d’un groupe de femmes  qui étaient en tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). Cependant, les membres sont animés d’un même objectif qui est de créer la solidarité et de développer leur cher quartier les Parcelles Assainies.   
  L’association est actuellement dirigée par Madame Diallé N., une  dame très engagée et qui connait bien la culture associative.  Elle est scindée auprès de U-IMCEC en 9 sous groupements avec un président et un trésorier pour chaque sous groupe afin de les faire profiter de ses services. 
Quant à l'ADPAT N°1, Madame Diallé N. la présidente de l’Association est à la tête de ce sous groupement.  Cette femme âgée de 52 ans est formatrice en langue nationale, le wolof, en entreprenariat et en  décentralisation depuis 1997. Pour ses temps libre, elle se consacre au commerce. Elle vend des tissus, chaussures, du crème …etc. Elle pratique le commerce, dit-elle, pour  régler ses besoins et augmenter ses revenus. D’ailleurs, avec sa part du crédit, elle compte renforcer son approvisionnement en chaussures, tissus pour un meilleur développement de son commerce. Cette femme mariée a 5 enfants et partage ce sous groupe avec :
-Madame Aminata G. qui vend des draps, tissus, produits cosmétiques et des effets pour femme dans son magasin sis en ville avec Thiès.
-Madame Aminata D. qui vend depuis 12 ans dans sa maison de l’arachide et de l’huile de palme.
-Madame Amy B., la vendeuse de poisson séchés et fumés au marché de Thiès
-et Madame Haychatou G. coiffeuse de métier qui gère depuis 1 an sa propre boutique dans le quartier.   
Elles demandent un financement de 500 000 FCFA qu’elle vont se partager à part égale.
texts.en:
The Association for the Development of les Parcelles Assainies of Thiès (ADPAT), is a coed group of people all living in the quarter of les Parcelles Assainies, a large district in Thiès. It was created in 2003 under the influence of a group of women who were part of a tontine (a system of rotating credit in which each member periodically contributes an agreed upon sum, and where each member is paid individually in turn). The members are inspired by the same objective, that is to develop solidarity and to improve their beloved quarter of les Parcelles Assainies. The association is currently managed by Diallé N., a very involved woman who knows group culture well. The association is split from U-IMCEC into nine subgroups with a president and a treasurer for each in order to help them benefit from its services. As for ADPAT N°1, Diallé N., the president of the association, is the head of the subgroup. This woman, 52 years old, has been an instructor in the national language, Wolof, in entrepreneurialism, and in decentralization since 1997. In her free time, she devotes herself to business. She sells fabric, shoes, creams, and more. She does business, she says, to meet her needs and to increase revenue. Moreover, with her portion of the loan, she will increase her stock of shoes and fabric to better develop her business. This married woman has five children and is in the group with: Aminata G., who sells linen, fabrics, cosmetics, and women’s clothing in her store located in Thiès. Aminata D., who for 12 years has sold peanuts and palm oil from her home. Amy B., merchant of dry fish and ciagarettes in the Thiès market. Haychatou G., hairdresser by trade, who has run her own boutique in the quarter for one year. They ask for a loan of 500,000 FCFA that they will split evenly.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcer leurs activités

loans.name: Silvia Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Marlene P. P., es comerciante se dedica a la venta de queso en el mercado central de Chinandega, es casada tiene un hijo en edad escolar.
	
La señora Silvia Marlene P. P., solicito el crédito para realizar compra de queso ya que en esta temporada las ventas le aumentan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Marlene P. P. is a merchant who sells cheese in the central market of Chinandega. She is married and has one son, who is of school age. Currently, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more cheese, since her sales increase during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
30-year-old Analie tills a rice field in Agusan Del Sur. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the needs of her family. Analie supports three children. She needs additional capital to run her rice farming business. She lacks fertilizers and seeds. 

Community Economic Ventures, Inc. gives her an opportunity to access a loan to purchase what she needs for the farm. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP. This will be helpful in buying supplies in order to produce a harvest in the future.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Diego Leonel

texts.es:
Diego esta en el negocio de compra y venta de Ganado.  El quiere usar su prestamo para la compra de vacas paridas.  El ha estado en este negocio por varios años y ha usado préstamos en el pasado para comprar más ganado y crecer el negocio.

Diego está casado, tiene 45 años de edad, y  tiene 2 hijos.  El vive en El Sauce y su meta es preparar a sus hijos que sean profesionales y que el negocio sea auto-sostenible.

En el pasado, un problema que ha afectado su negocio es el clima.
texts.en:
Diego is in the business of buying and selling livestock. He wants to use this loan to buy dairy cows. He has been in this business for a number of years, and he has used loans in the past to buy more livestock and to grow his business. Diego is married, 45 years old, and has 2 children. He lives in El Sauce and his goal is to prepare his children to become professionals, and to have his business become self-sustaining. In the past, one problem that has affected his business is the weather.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Greivin

texts.es: Greivin C. G., tiene la edad de 23 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Greivin tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Greivin C. G. us 23 years old and single. He wants the loan to buy some calves and for their feed. He wants to take care of the livestock adequately in order to get the greatest income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has. He wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Greivin has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Benita De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el barrio Las Colinas  de Somotillo la señora Benita de los Ángeles G. T. se desempeña como comerciante de verduras en el mercado municipal de somotillo atendiendo los clientes del casco urbano como los que nos visitan a diario de las comarcas aledañas
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercadería por mayor y variado y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias en su negocio.
Este es el primer crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que la beneficiaran para aumentar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera maximizar su ganancias en su negocio de venta de verduras.
texts.en:
In the Las Colinas de Somotillo neighborhood, Mrs. Benita de los Ángeles G. T. sells vegetables in the municipal market of Somotillo. She works with the customers from the urban area such as those that we see daily from the neighboring regions. She tells us that the loan will be used to buy merchandise wholesale and with a greater variety, and in this way she can increase her earnings from the business. This is the first loan that she is requesting and she tells us that it will help her build up her working capital and thus maximize the income from the business of selling vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale and in greater variety for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Daisy Bernido Group

texts.en:
Daisy A. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Daisy is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Daisy is married. To make a living, Daisy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Daisy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Clive Road Womens Group C-Jinja

texts.en: She is an example of a successful, hardworking woman, who has succeeded in living within her monthly profits of 500,000 shillings for the past nine years in Jinja. Nine years maintaining a successful business makes one a past master at making good decisions aimed at consolidating and reinforcing one's gains. Twenty-eight-year-old Monica M. started off small in her banana sales business, but her beginnings are something she now sees in perspective, given the progress she has made. She has her own stall in Jinja central market. Her clients are mostly the lowest common denominator, who stay around the central market area where she operates. Monica is married, with four children, of whom three are in school. With this loan, she wants to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 36 year old married woman from Lebanon. She has been working as a beautician for the past 13 years from her home. She offers all the beauty services to her customers such as make-up, pedicure manicure, tattoo, etc. Her income is very important for her family and to support her husband who is working out of Lebanon to earn the needed income for his family. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a tattoo machine instead of renting one. In the future, she would like to open a formal beauty salon for women. She is working to achieve even greater business success in the coming year.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a tattoo machine.

loans.name: Las Margaritas 1 Group

texts.es: Doña Gloria Modesta González es mama soltera, ha cursado el quinto grado primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales   siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica al comercio tienda de consumo diario, tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Las Margaritas 1, El grupo cuenta con Seis  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, Artesanía elaboración de Camisas  y blusas,  y crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de mercadería para su tienda de consumo diario y así incrementar el volumen de ventas, espera obtener mejores ganancias en la actividad que realiza cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria Modesta González is a single mother who has studied through the fifth grade of primary school and has three children she cares for. She has worked for 15 years running a store that provides items for everyday use. Counting on their enthusiasm and mutual help several neighbors have organized a group to apply for a loan. This solidarity group is called Las Margaritas 1. The group consists of six women who work in diverse fields, among which we can mention raising animals, handicraft production of shirts and blouses, and raising domestic animals. Gloria will use the loan to buy merchandise for her everyday items store and increase the volume of sales. Each one of them hopes to obtain increased earnings from her work.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives with her family in a two-room brick house in a city called Borewala, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its shrines. She is a seamstress and sews clothes by taking orders from her nearby areas. She has been doing this for many years and people know her in the region for her quality work.

Nasreen is married to F. E., who has a business selling spare parts. He operates a small shop in the nearby market where he sells spare parts for different vehicles to earn an income for his family. He has been doing this business for over seven years. He sells spare parts of every quality and of every price so every kind of customer can approach him easily to buy them.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts in large quantity which enable him to increase his clientele and generate a good profit. She hopes that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband’s business and result in her family being able to have better facilities in life.

In the photo, Nasreen is the lady who holds a book (it’s her Asasah passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy spare parts in large quantity for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING PERFUMES TO SELL

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie I. is from the village of Brgy. Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old and single. To make a living, Melanie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Melanie joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

She has operated her business of selling second-hand clothes and natural juices for over five years; neighbours and passersby are her major customers. Phylis faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During winter, the cold season, demand for heavy clothes is high compared to the hot summer season where demand is low for heavy clothes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes and cooler boxes for storing natural juices for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and cooler boxes for storing natural juices for resale

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Leoncia, D. 66 años, es una mujer que siempre a trabajado muy duro por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato D. 67 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. La actividad a la que se dedica Leoncia, es la venta D. ropa, en su puesto ubicado en el mercado “Gamarrita D. la ciudad D. San Francisco”, todos los días atienD. a muchos compradores, quienes sabiendo D. la buena calidad y lo novedoso D. las prendas que ella misma trae desD. la ciudad D. Lima, no dudan en comprarle grandes cantidades D. ropa. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que están D. moda en la capital, ya que así pueD. ganarse su confianza, lleva 48 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto D. ventas por largas horas, en espera D. clientes. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su puesto para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor comodidad. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal, donD. se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa D. la ciudad D. Lima, para implementar mejor su puesto D. ventas.
texts.en: Leoncia is 66 years old. She is a woman who has always worked very hard to get ahead in life. She lives in her own home with her husband Fortunato, who is 67. What she wants the most is to have a calm old age. The activity Leoncia does is selling clothes in her stall located in the “Gamarrita D. la ciudad D. San Francisco” market. Everyday she serves many buyers who know her good quality and the latest fashion of the clothing she brings from the city of Lima. They don't hesitate to buy large quantities of clothing. What she likes the most about her job is advising customers about the clothing that is in style in the capital. This way she earns their trust. She has been doing this for 48 years and she thinks that the hardest thing is staying at her stall for long hours, waiting for customers.  With time, she hopes to expand her stall to be able to offer customers more comfort. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is saving to be able to make her payments on time since she doesn't want to cause trouble for the members of her communal bank, where she feels very happy. With the thousand soles she has asked for, she will buy more clothes in the city of Lima, to better outfit her sales stall.

loans.use: To buy more clothes in the city of Lima to better supply her business.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
La señorita Carla es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus tíos los cuales viven en anticretico, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
