Carla trabaja realizando todo tipo de hilado de mantas, y también realiza edición de grabaciones para la universidad. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una computadora  y así realizar mejor su trabajo y  poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Carla is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her aunt and uncle's house.  They live in 'anticretico' (a special rental system offered in Bolivia) in Villa Nueva Potosí district, in the city of La Paz.

Carla works knitting blankets and also does video editing for the university.  This is how she makes income for her household.

The loan which she is requesting is for buying a computer so that she can carry out her work better and increase her income.

This is her first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies her favorably to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy a computer which will allow her to create her hand-made crafts in better conditions

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is a 30 year old mother who always strives hard for the betterment of the family. She is married to Nelson M. and they are blessed with six children, her eldest child is already 15 years old while the youngest is 5 years old. Her husband is very supportive but unfortunately, his income is unstable and that is why their eldest did not continue her studies in high school.

Last year she joined ASHI because she believed that only ASHI could help her to achieve her dreams. After short orientation/training, she got her first loan Php.5,000.00 and after 6 months she successfully paid the said amount. She has also shown worthiness and that is why she was granted with a loan of a bigger amount.

Presently, she buys and sells rice in their town. Their income from this business really helps her to cater for the needs of the family. But their income is always based on their capital that they investment, and according to her “the bigger the investment; the greater the income”, and that is why she is proposing Php.12,000.00 for her next loan so that she will have more capital.

Her greatest dream in life is that their children will finish their studies until college so that they will have good jobs, and she also aspires of building a concrete house someday through their income from the loans that they borrowed from ASHI and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy and sell rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina  Sánchez Vázquez, es casada con el señor Celerino Patricio Ramírez, en donde  tuvo cuatro hijos quienes ya están casados.

       Se dedica a su hogar, como también a la elaboración de panes  y solito el préstamo para comprar ingredientes con los que se elabora su actividad con esto lleva treinta y cinco años  en donde le ha ido muy bien  ya que con ellos saco adelante a su familia.

       Nos comenta  que con esta actividad  inicio desde hace  tiempo por su mamá quien fue que la enseño y desde que le quedo lo ha estado practicando  y le va bien.

       De lo que ha ganado durante todo  este tiempo que ha estado elaborando esta actividad  es comprar materiales para mejorar su casa y su cocina donde elabora sus panes.

       Su  sueño  es que logre comprar mas material para construir su cocina en donde hornea  los panes ya que hasta ahora lo tiene techado de tablas  y le afecta en tiempo de lluvia.
texts.en:
Fidelina Sánchez Vázquez is married to Celerino Patricio Ramírez.  They have four children who are all married.

Fidelina works looking after her home and making bread.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making her bread.  She has been in this business for thirty five years.  Her business has done very well and it has helped her to get her family ahead in life.

Fidelina comments that she started out in this business years ago.  It was her mom who taught her the business and since she left she has been running the business which does well.

Fidelina has used the money that she has made over the years to buy materials for improving her home and her kitchen where she bakes her bread.  Her dream is to buy more material to do building work in her kitchen where she bakes her bread since, up to this point, its ceiling has been made from planks and this affects her when it rains.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread such as flour, eggs, oil, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, none of whom who is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).

Asia has a business of selling roasted sweet potatoes and bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Asia sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Asia has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes, bunches of bananas, and maize. She also generates additional income through selling second hand shoes. The main business challenge(s) for Asia include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to deal in shoes only (import). Asia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes, maize and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Tuk's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five members, all residents of Siem Reap Province. The group is led by Tuk M., 42, a humble villager and the mother of two children, both single and under her care. To earn a living, Tuk M. sells a variety of sweets made from soybeans, pumpkin, gelatin, etc., to the people in the community. The family has another financial earner who is a porter in the local busy market and is also a taxi driver. Tuk M. is applying for a loan to add with her savings in order to buy a used motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service. 

The other four members are: 
Mrs. T., 31, a laborer seeking a loan to buy wood for repairing her house; 
Mrs. S., 37, a freshwater shell seller looking for a loan to buy poles for her house.
Mrs. O., 36, a room cleaner requesting a loan to renovate her house.
Mrs. R., a room cleaner requesting a loan to decorate her old house.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Chicas Azucar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS AZUCAR” es una grupo nuevo, iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho personas, un varón y siete mujeres.

La asociación comunal “CHICAS AZUCAR” organizó su mesa directiva como es norma;  está conformado por una presidenta, la señora Felipa , la tesorera la señora  Jhovana y la secretaria de actas la señora Justina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados: venta de muebles, venta de pollo, conductor de movilidad de servicio público, costura de mochilas, venta de comida.
En el caso de la señora Felipa, presidenta de la asociación comunal, su negocio es la venta de muebles que elabora su esposo.  Hace quince años, cuando comenzó con su primer crédito en Pro Mujer ella vendía condimentos, su primer crédito fue por Bs.200.-, a través de los años fue creciendo el negocio, y con las ganancias pudo cambiar de negocio y ahora trabaja en carpintería. El trabajo en carpintería fue idea de su esposo quién desde niño tenía ese objetivo.  

La señora Felipa, mujer trabajadora de 41 años de edad vive con sus cinco hijos y su esposo. Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación en salud, también le ha parecido buena la atención que recibió en el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Chicas Azucar” is a new group that is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. The group consists of eight members, one man and seven women.

The “Chicas Azucar” Communal Association has organized its Board of Directors in the following manner: • Sra. Felipa was elected President. • Sra. Jhovana was elected Treasurer. • Sra. Justina was elected Secretary of Records. The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses such as selling furniture, selling chicken, driving public service vehicles, sewing handbags, and selling food.

In the case of Sra. Felipa, the Communal Bank President, she sells furniture that her husband produces. When she joined Pro Mujer fifteen years ago, she used her first loan to sell condiments. She received 200 BOB and her business has grown over the years. With her earnings, Felipa was able to switch over to a new business and now engages in carpentry. The carpentry business was her husband’s idea since he had this goal since he was a boy.

Sra. Felipa is 41 years old and a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she enjoys the health classes. She also received good care when she visited the health clinic.

loans.use: Purchase pine wood

loans.name: Real Friends Group

texts.en:
Jeneba A. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Jeneba was born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Jeneba’s husband is retired and her three children attend primary school. Jeneba sells soft drinks, gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) and charcoal. She has been running this business for six years now. 

This is the first loan that Jeneba and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Jeneba will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business. 

(Also included at the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: Buys soft drinks, gara lappers (dyed clothes) and charcoal

loans.name: Brenilda

texts.es: Brenilda, de 50 años, es una madre de familia abnegada y muy jovial. Vive en casa de sus suegros, junto a su esposo y su hija Angie, de 20 años, por quien se desvela sus días. Brenilda, es una madre de familia de mil oficios, vende zapatos y  ropa según los  pedidos que le hacen sus clientes,  y durante los fines de semana prepara y vende cebiches (platillo típico de Lima) en la puerta de su casa, asimismo se dedica al lavado de prendas en su casa.  En donde  dice, “mantenerse muy entretenida ya que le permite captar buenas utilidades para el bienestar y la educación de su hija, por lo que su esposo  se siente contento por los aportes de Brenilda. Por esta temporada de verano esta muy dedicada al lavado de  frazadas, edredones, y demás prendas, ya que son muchos que envían por la temporada de invierno que se aproxima, pero sólo estruja las prendas y hace la entrega a sus clientes, desventaja que tiene ya que no cuenta con el tendal suficiente para toda la ropa que lava. En vista de ello, en adelante le gustaría ampliar la construcción de su casa y también instalar un restaurante. Pero, por el momento le urge comprarse otra lavadora, para abastecerse de la demanda que tiene. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a seguir pagando como lo venia haciendo. Y dice “que está contenta de trabajar con sus compañeras y compañeros de grupo”, por ser muy responsables. Con el crédito, piensa comprar otra lavadora, para dinamizar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Brenilda is a 50 year old self-sacrificing and cheerful mother. She lives in her in-laws’ house with her husband and their 20 year old daughter, Angie for whom she works hard.

Brenilda is a mother who does many jobs: She sells shoes and clothes to her customers, prepares ‘cebiches’ - traditional dishes of Lima - and sells them at her doorstep on weekends and also does laundry at her house. She enjoys all this work since it provides good profit that covers her daughter’s expenses and education and contributes to her husband’s contentment. 

During this time of the year – summer - she is mainly washing blankets, comforters and items like that since the demand is high in preparation for the winter months coming ahead. She does not have a big enough area for clotheslines in order to dry all of her laundry, so in the future, she would like to expand her house as well as open a restaurant, but for now it is important to buy one more washing machine to take care of the laundry given to her by her customers. 

This is the tenth loan with MFP and she is committed to repay it in a timely manner as has always done. She is very happy working with the other members in the group because they all are very responsible. She is planning to buy one more washing machine with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy one more washing machine.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Marina nació en la histórica ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad. Actualmente, Marina vive en misma ciudad donde nació, ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos de las cuales dos ya son independientes, ella trabaja en al PRONEI (Programa Nacional de Educación Inicial) en el área de nutrición donde se encarga de controlar la calidad de comida que sirven a los niños pero ella también se dedica en sus horas libres a enviar pasteles y tortas a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, el envió de los productos lo hace  en paquetes especiales para que no se estropeen las tortas y pasteles. Ya son 6 meses que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Marina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio pues ahora va utilizar el dinero pagar el costo del envio de tortas a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. 

Marina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Marina was born in the historic city of Cusco and is 41 years old.  She currently lives in the same city and is a very enterprising woman who has raised four children, two of whom are independent.  She works for PRONEI (National Program for Beginning Education) in the nutrition area and supervises the quality of meals served to the children.  

In her free time she sends pastries and cakes to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  She sends the products in special packaging so the cakes and pastries do not arrive damaged.  She has been in business for six months and it is going well.  

Marina needs a loan to increase her working capital.  She plans to use the loan to pay for shipping costs to send the cakes to Puerto Maldonado.

She is a responsible person and a member of the "Sumac Purisisun" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To pay for shipping costs

loans.name: Adofo Abelin

texts.es:
Adolfo Abelin es un joven muy responsable que quiere ofrecer a su madre una mejor calidad de vida. A pesar de los años que tiene es una persona madura por que ayuda a su mama con los gastos del hogar, en este momento  desea empezar una construcción en la planta alta para tener mayor comodidad. 
Adolfo trabaja por las tardes en un restaurante de comida donde prepara tacos al pastor y gringas en lugar muy conocido de la ciudad. Para terminar su proyecto y a ayudar a su madre el necesita comprar lo necesario para realizar la construcción.
texts.en:
Adolfo Abelin is a very responsible young man who wants to provide a better quality of life to his mother.  In spite of his age, he is a very mature person who helps his mother with the household expenses.  Currently he wants to start construction of a second floor in order to add more comfort to their life.
Adolfo works in a restaurant in the afternoons.  He makes tacos and gringas in a very well known place in the city.  To be able to finish his project and help his mother he needs to buy the necessary materials for the construction.

loans.use: to build a second story.

loans.name: Royer

texts.es:
Royer tiene 19 años de edad es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Esta familia reside en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura, en la parte rural de este y lamentablemente no cuenta con los servicios básicos.


El padre de Royer es agricultor y su madre tiene un negocio de bar picantería, que consiste en un pequeño restaurante donde venden comida marina, comida típica del norte del Perú. 


Por las tardes Royer se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su moto lineal, la cual es propia y en las mañanas trabaja en un fundo de banano orgánico como jornalero.


Royer es un nuevo cliente en Edpyme  Alternativa y solicita un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprarle llantas a su motocicleta y así poder repararla para seguir contribuyendo con los gastos básicos de su casa 
 

La familia de Royer es una familia muy emprendedora y a pesar de las dificultades que tienen, gozan de muy buenas referencias respecto a sus pagos.
texts.en:
Royer is 19 years old, single and lives in his parents’ house. His family lives in a rural area of Tambogrande, a district in Piuru. Unfortunately they do not have basic services.

Royer’s father is a farmer and his mother has a bar/picantería, a small restaurant serving coastal Peruvian foods, typical foods from the north of Perú.

In the afternoons, Royer transports passengers on his own motorcycle. In the mornings, he works on a large organic banana farm as a laborer. 

Royer is a new client with Edpyme Alternativa. He is requesting a loan for 1500 Nuevos Soles in order to purchase tires for his motorcycle. With that purchase, he can repair the motorcycle and continue helping with the basic expenses in his house.

Royer’s family is very enterprising and in spite of all of their difficulties, they have many good references for their payment history.

loans.use: repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Doña Eleazar esta muy contenta por el préstamo que esta obteniendo ya que le servirá de mucho para tener surtido su negocio de venta de jugos y licuados. Ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 6 meses y lo puso para tener otro ingreso extra, ella comprara naranjas, betabel, azúcar, leche, chocolate, fresas, manzana, zanahorias etc. También dice que se dedica a lavar y planchar ajeno desde hace 8 años ya que ella es madre soltera y tiene que sacar a sus pequeños hijos adelante con sus estudios. Doña Eleazar es una señora muy emprendedora y muy alegre dice que los días sábados y domingos vende cena fuera de su casa ella vende tacos dorados, quesadillas, enchiladas, pozole y aguas frescas comenta que con este negocio ella tiene 5 años y que lo puso por que sus vecinas la animaron por que cocina muy sabroso y eso la motivo a poner su negocio. La meta que tiene doña Eleazar es poner en su casa una cenaduría donde sus clientes se sientan a gusto y cómodos cuando vallan a comer a la cenaduría.
Los otros 9 integrantes se llaman Silvia, Irma, Leshlye, Griselda, Laura Angelica, Blanca, Argelia, Anayeli, Librado, ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en una papeleria, venta de antojitos mexicanos, zapato por catalogo,ropa para dama y niños,ropa interior, venta de elotes preparados, tienda de abarrotes y panaderia.
texts.en:
Eleazar is very happy with the loan that she is receiving as it will help her a lot in stocking her business selling juice and smoothies.  She has owned her business for approximately six months.  She set it up in order to make an extra income.  She will buy oranges, beets, sugar, milk, chocolate, strawberries, apples, carrots etc.  She says that she also washes and irons other people's clothes.  She has been doing this for eight years since she is a single mother and has to get her young children ahead in their studies.

Eleazar is a very entrepreneurial and cheerful lady.  She says that on Saturdays and Sundays she sells dinners outside her home.  She sells fried tacos, quesadillas, enchiladas, 'pozole' (meat and hominy stew) and 'aguas frescas' (fresh fruit drinks).  She says that she has been in this business for five years and that her neighbors encouraged her to set it up because her cooking is very tasty.  Eleazar's goal is to set up a restaurant in her home where her customers will feel at ease and comfortable when they come to eat.

The other nine members of this group are Silvia, Irma, Leshlye, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Blaca, Argelia, Anayeli and Librado.  They would like loans to invest in a stationery store, a business making Mexican snacks, catalog shoe sales, ladies' and children's clothes sales, underwear sales, cooked corn on the cob sales, a grocery store and a bakery.

loans.use: to sell juice, smoothies and meals

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She prepares and sells food to earn a living and has been in this business for twelve years.  She also sells cereals for extra income.  She is able to provide for her family with the income she gets from her businesses. She hopes to open a hotel in the future.  

Lucy has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy maize and beans for cooking.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella es comerciante de ropa nueva, desde hace tres años está en el negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal, y en ocasiones sale a vender de forma ambulante, este negocio lo administra por iniciativa propia, siendo su principal ocupación de la que recibe ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir para la temporada de Junio a Agosto, invirtiéndolo en blusas, faldas, ropa interior y para niños, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el inventario y las ventas.
El propósito de María es tener el negocio rentable, que le ayude a aumentar sus ganancias y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, realizándose como comerciante de éxito.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and their children. She has sold new clothing for three years. Her business is located in the town market, and on occasion she goes out to do traveling sales. María runs this business on her own, and it is her main occupation for earning income to cover household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothing for the June to August season, and she will invest in blouses, skirts, underwear and children's clothing. This investment will help her to improve her inventory and her sales.

María's goal is to have a profitable business that helps her to increase her earnings and meet her family's needs by becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothing: blouses, skirts, underwear and children's clothing.

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en:
Zeddy is 29 years old and has been in farming for 10 years.  Her farm employs two farmhands and produces milk which she sells to the local Kabianga Dairies and tea which goes to the local market.  She is married and has two children, aged 7 and 11, who are both in school.

Zeddy has requested a loan of 52,333 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says her business will help her repay the loan and provide the basic needs for her family. She wants to own quality dairy breeds in the future and purchase land to expand her farming activities.

Zeddy says lack of land to grow feed and knowledge of animal diseases still remain her major challenges.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 45, is married with six children and lives in a semi-permanent house in Kammwenge, Uganda. His dream is to have a permanent house and to educate his children.

Charles has been selling maize, as well as farming, for the past 20 years. He likes his business because he earns a living from it and hopes to expand it more, despite the challenge of limited funds to meet the increasing demand from his customers. Charles needs the loan facility to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Letty María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Puerto Real.

En este lugar conocimos a Letty, tiene 43 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su mamá.

Ella es propietaria de un edificio en el cual tiene departamentos para alquilar, nos cuenta que utiliza los créditos para invertirlos en arreglar dichos departamentos y darles más comodidad a sus inquilinos pero también esto le deja mejores ganancias a la vez. Con este crédito que esta por recibir ella va a arreglar algunas ventanas que están un poco deterioradas en dos departamentos que están desocupados, espera que con los arreglos que está haciendo arrendarlos muy pronto y a muy buen precio.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar 5 ventanas de vidrio que le hacen falta para dar mayor conformidad y seguridad a  sus inquilinos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son sumamente bajos en relación a los bancos tradicionales.
 
Sus metas son tener arrendados todos sus departamentos muy pronto.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Puerto Real” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantity of tamarind fruit that is produced during this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Letty. She is 43 years old, single, and lives with her mother. Letty is the owner of a building that has floors for rent. She has used the loans to invest in repairs of the various floors so that she can make them more comfortable for her tenants and generate more revenue. With the loan she will receive, Letty will replace a few windows that have deteriorated on two floors that are vacant. She hopes that making the repairs will allow her to rent them out quickly at a very good price.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of five glass windows so that her tenants will have greater comfort and security. Letty has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the interest rates are lower than traditional banks.

Her goals include making repairs to all of the floors in her building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase five windows.

loans.name: Twungurane Group

texts.fr:
Déogratias est un commerçant  âgé de 42 ans . Il habite à Kibimba  dans la province de Gitega. If fait le commerce  d’articles de bout ique comme dentifrices ,savons, cahiers,haricots, le riz ,l’huile de palme etc  depuis 18 ans. Il n’a pas été à l’école. Il est marié à Vestine qui est cultivatrice et ils n’ont pas encore eu d’enfant. 
Le crédit de Kiva de 30000 va lui permettre  d’acheter  beaucoup  de produits de boutiques (dentifrices, savons , cahiers, haricots, riz etc) à revendre pour realiser  de grands bénefices. 
Il est membre du groupe communautaire  “TWUNGURANE”
texts.en:
Déogratias is a 42-year-old merchant. He lives in Kibimba, in the province of Gitega. He has been selling convenience store items such as toothpaste, soap, notebooks, beans, rice, palm oil, etc. for 18 years. He is a member of the TWUNGURANE community group.

Déogratias never attended school. He is married to Vestine, a farmer, and they do not have any children yet. 

A loan of 30,000 BIF will help him to stock up on several items (toothpaste, soap, books, beans, rice, etc.) to sell and make substantial profits.

loans.use: to stock up on several convenience store items such as toothpaste, soap, notebooks, beans, rice, etc. for resale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a residence of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, a place where farming is the common source of income. She is 53 years old and married. She has six grown dependents who have helped her in farm work during leisure times or when they have no classes and jobs to attend to. Her spouse is a carpenter but is not permanent so they are both engaged in farming to lift up cash inflows for the family. The business began five years ago and is still doing well today. Every month, she gets PHP 6,000 total in income.

This year 2011, Elena became part of GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to compensate irrigation cost and fertilizers for plants' quick growth. By applying suitable fertilizers to the plants, she hopes to have a good harvest. The revenue thereof and from succeeding business cycles will be used to invest in gardening activity to produce high-yielding crops as additional income.

loans.use: To compensate irrigation cost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Doña Connie, es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Las Luchadoras,  es una  mujer   joven y muy trabajadora, con  21 años de edad,  madre de una niña de un año, con quien  convive junto con el padre de su hija hace ya algunos años;  sus oportunidades de estudiar han sido muy escasas y actualmente no ha podido terminar la  secundaria. Ella junto con 9 señoras  de la misma comunidad buscan superarse y  ven en el crédito una herramienta para lograrlo.
Esta es la primera solicitud de crédito de Banco Mujer Luchadoras y se enteraron de los servicios de Fundación Mujer, gracias a que la misma Connie fue parte de un grupo que luego de cancelar un préstamo se  desintegró, sin embargo eso no le impidió  liderar un nuevo  grupo  del  cual se siente muy satisfecha de las mujeres que lo conforman. 
La actividad principal que va a desarrollar Connie es la Avicultura, cría de gallinas ponedoras y venta de huevos, pero también  elabora todo tipo de manualidades y decoraciones para el hogar, como una actividad paralela para ayudar a generar más ingresos económicos a su hogar, el préstamo se va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, alimentos y vitaminas para dichos animales. La clienta tiene su negocio hace más de 3 años, y el principal obstáculo que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de dinero para invertir en sus actividades, hacer crecer sus negocios, y mejorar la calidad  sus productos. 
Por eso tiene sus metas y objetivos bien definidos, entre ellos están, seguir estudiando, tener un negocios más grande, y distribuir sus productos por toda la comunidad.  Estos son solo algunos de los sueños que se ha propuesto lograr con mucho trabajo y dedicación. 
En cuanto a impacto se espera que los ingresos generados por su microempresa ayuden a la sostenibilidad económica de sus familias y al mejoramiento de sus comunidades. Así como lograr el empoderamiento de las mujeres en el desarrollo de sus actividades micro empresariales.  Y destacar el rol de las mujeres microempresarias, en su comunidad y en todo el país. 
El crédito va hacer de gran ayuda para Connie y sus 9 compañeras del banco, que se dedican a actividades PECUARIAS, como porcicultura y avicultura.
texts.en:
Doña Connie is the president of “Banco Mujer Las Luchadoras” (The Fighters Women’s Bank). She is a hardworking young woman who is 21 years of age and the mother of a one-year-old daughter. Connie has been living with the father of her daughter for a few years. Her opportunities to study were limited, so she was not able to finish high school. She and nine other ladies from the same community are looking to succeed, so they are seeking a loan as a way of achieving this goal.

This is the first loan request submitted by “Banco Mujer Las Luchadoras” after learning about the services offered by Fundación Mujer, thanks to the efforts of Doña Connie. She was a member of another group that disbanded shortly after repaying its loan. However, this did not stop her from starting a new group and she is very pleased with the women who have joined her.

Connie’s main business activity is raising poultry, specifically hens so that she can sell the eggs. She also produces all types of handicrafts and household decorations as a side business to help generate additional household income. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of hens, feed, and vitamins for her animals. Connie has been in business for more than three years, but her main obstacle has been a lack of money to invest in her activities so that she can grow her business and improve the quality of her products. Her goals and objectives are well-defined. They include continuing her studies, having a larger business, and distributing her products throughout the community. These are just some of the dreams that she hopes to achieve through hard work and dedication.

In terms of impact, it is expected that the revenue generated from her microenterprise will help sustain her family financially and contribute toward the improvement of her community. Not only will this loan empower these women in the development of their microenterprises, it will also highlight the role of women entrepreneurs in their community and throughout the entire country.

This loan will be a great help to Connie and the nine other members of her bank, who engage in raising livestock such as pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to purchase hens, poultry feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy and her husband, Chanthorn, are rice and vegetable farmers. They have been married since 1993 and have two sons and one daughter in school. The family is living along National Road Number one, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthy hopes to continue her farming business because it’s their main source of income. That’s why she is applying for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm. 

In the photo, Chanthy is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain their rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband repair his truck, which he uses for providing a goods transport services. He is an expert driver and has been driving his truck for the past 20 years. With the loan, he will repair his truck and replace the tires.
  
Robina hopes that the fully repaired truck will allow her husband to drive more comfortably and improve his transportation business.
 
She herself is a housewife and performs her household duties very efficiently. She has given birth to four children. Three of the children are studying while the youngest one is yet of school-going age. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained  good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To repair her husband's truck

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fruit in her stall.

Susana has been in this business for 4 years. Susana earns more income from farming rice.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with four children who are aged 3 to 10 years old. Her husband works as a security guard. Rose sells foodstuffs in her store which she has run for seven years. She has a high volume of customers and would like a loan to buy more products to meet the high demand. With the profits she would like to put aside savings for her future and increase capital for her business. Rose would love to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and make more profits.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single mother with one school going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Lucy has operated a vegetable selling business for the past six months; she sells her products at the market and her potential clients are the people at the market area. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low sales in the dry season because of poor harvests. She aspires to expand her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more vegetables like onions for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to acquire funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables like onions for her business.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is from the village of La Victoria Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has three children. He is 32 years old. 
To earn a living, Jeremias owns and operates a business in the retail sector selling used shoes in the community. He discovered this kind of business through his friend. He found out that this line of business is in demand in the town. Without a doubt, he engaged in this line of business and has been in business for two years. 

He has a stall in the public mall of his town where in he regularly displays his products. He earns around 6,100 PHP a month from these activities. Anywhere you go in the Philippines there are second-hand clothes called "Okay-Okay" and this is the line of business he is engaged in.

In 2011, Jeremias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jeremias is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used shoes "okay-okay" to sell.  He will invest the funds to expand his business.

This loan will be the second loan taken out by  Jeremias from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase additional used shoes "okay-okay" to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly de 29 años de edad, convive con Luis, su pareja, con quién tiene un hijo de 5 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Ricricán, distrito de Palcamayo. Nelly es una mujer que se entrega incondicionalmente a su familia y trabajo. Todos los días realiza una rutina cansada pero recompensada cuando ve que su esfuerzo significa el progreso para su familia.
La agricultura, es su actividad económica. En sus terrenos de cultivo tiene sembrado papa, olluco y oca, productos que vende de inmediato, puesto que sus cosechas son solicitadas gracias a las bondades de los suelos de su zona. Así también se dedica al negocio de carne y lana de carnero, para ello cuenta con 5 ganados ovinos, los que sacrifica para su venta.
En cuanto a su rentabilidad, Nelly afirma: “Ambos me convienen, pero la siembra es lo que me gusta hacer, a pesar de ser muy duro”. Por la necesidad que le exigen sus actividades, piensa comprarse un carro, así facilitará el traslado de sus productos. “Todo con fe”, finaliza. Con su ayuda, Nelly podrá recibir su préstamo número 15 de MFP, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Esta contenta con su banco comunal, porque la mayoría de sus integrantes comparten las mismas visiones. Destinará todo el dinero del crédito en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Nelly, aged 29, lives with her partner Luis with whom she has a five-year-old son. They live in their own house in Anexo de Ricricán in the district of Palcamayo. Nelly is a woman who unconditionally devotes herself to her family and work. Every day she carries out her routine, which is tiring but rewarding when she sees that her effort makes her family progress.

Agriculture is her business. Her farmland is planted with potatoes, ollucos and ocas (the latter two being Andean tuber crops). She sells her products immediately, since her crop is in high demand because of the quality of the soil in her area. In addition, Nelly sells sheep meat and wool. For this purpose, she has five sheep which she slaughters for sale.

In terms of profitability, Nelly said that both activities are well-performing, but that she prefers her planting activity despite its hardship. She thinks that it may be necessary for her two businesses that she buys a cart for easier transportation of her products. "Everything in faith" is her motto. With the help of Kiva lenders Nelly will be granted her fifteenth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. She commits herself to pay her installments on schedule. She is happy with her communal bank because most of its members share the same vision. Nelly will use her loan entirely to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Bambino Group

texts.en:
Sainabu is a 29-year-old woman who is divorced and has one child aged eight. She has poultry and also flea market businesses, and has been running them for two years now. The main challenges she faces in her businesses are high competition from shops which are offering credit facility to clients. 

Her future expectations are to own her very own boutique and an enamelware shop as well. With the loan of $400 she has received from Microking Finance she is going to purchase 30 pairs of shoes and kids wear, 150 chicks and 10-50Kg of chicken feed. 

This will definitely improve her standard of living and make it possible to reinvest in the community.

loans.use: To buy 150 birds, 10-50Kg of chicken feed and flea market stock

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws). Betty has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Betty sells her products from home, retail. Betty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Betty include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big and also to own 2000 chicken and start selling wholesale. Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Madres Trabajaddoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Madres trabajadoras es de la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado por 17 mujeres. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que tienen como objetivo principal la ayuda a sus familias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que tienen sobre sus hombros toda la responsabilidad.
Una de esas mujeres luchadoras es Liz, quien nos cuenta que es modista, y que gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Ella se considera muy capaz de sobresalir con su trabajo y con la ayuda de sus compañeras del grupo.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos que necesita para su taller, ya que tiene varios pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en: The group Working Mothers is from the city of Asuncion and consists of 17 women.  They are hard working and fighting women who all have the same goal to help their families and improve their living conditions.  All of them are female heads of household who bear all the responsibility on their shoulders.  One of the fighting women is Liz, who is a dressmaker.  Thanks to this work, she is able to help with household expenses.  She considers herself very capable of excelling in her work with the help of her friends from the group.  She requests the loan to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, and other supplies she needs for her shop, as she has many orders and would like to be able to meet them.

loans.use: buy fabrics, threads, zippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Jean Didier

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans, marie et  père de 5 enfants dont trois sont encore sur le banc de l’école. Il ouvre une alimentation il y’a de cela 20 ans, quand il finit ses études universitaires, n’ayant pas trouve du travail, il ouvre une alimentation pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Il a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de prêts  et avec ce nouveau prêt, il va s’approvisionner de nouveau en renforçant le stock des denrées comme les sacs de lait en poudre, sacs de sucre, du riz, des bidons d’huile, cartons de conserves  et de la boisson importée comme des bouteilles de liqueur , whisky, des bières importées.
Sa stratégie est de vendre moins cher et avoir des produits des bonnes qualités, a l’avenir il tient a continuer dans le même sens, avoir une grande boutique pour continuer a prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Didier, age 51, is married and the father of five children, out of whom three still go to school. After finishing his university studies, twenty years ago, he opened a grocery store to provide for his family, since he couldn't find a job.

He already benefited from several loans, and he will use this one to resupply and bolster his stock of products, such as bags of powdered milk, bags of sugar, rice, cans of oil, boxes of canned food, and imported beverages such as liquor, whisky, and beers.

His strategy consists in selling at a lower price and carrying good quality products. In the future, he wants to continue in this direction, and have a large store to continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, sugar, rice, oil, canned food, liquor, whisky, and beers

loans.name: Olga Ines

texts.es: Olga Inés se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus tres hijos y su esposo. Desde hace algún tiempo se viene desempeñando en la actividad de venta de comidas y gracias a esto ha podido generar los ingresos necesarios para sostener los gastos de su hogar. Olga Inés no tuvo unos padres con una buena capacidad económica, por lo que tuvo que afrontar grandes adversidades en la vida, y no quiere que sus 3 hijos tengan que pasar por las mismas circunstancias. Es por esto que Olga Inés siempre trabaja con más esmero por sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos y brindarles la mejor educación posible. Gracias a que sus comidas tienen una muy buena reputación entre sus clientes, Olga Inés ha visto como su negocio ha venido incrementando sus ventas, por lo que requiere de la compra de más insumos para preparar más alimentos que les venda a sus clientes; sin embargo, Olga Inés no dispone en el momento del capital necesario para la compra de insumos que requiere, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de dichos insumos y su negocio siga incrementando sus ventas. Olga Inés aspira a que su negocio siga con la misma senda de crecimiento y que sus ingresos también se incrementen considerablemente, de modo que pueda mejorar su calidad de vida, la de su esposo y la de sus 3 hijos, a los que quiere brindarles la mejor educación posible.
texts.en: Olga Inés has been characterized as a person who is very hardworking and dedicated to her 3 children and her husband.  For some time now, she has been working selling food, and thanks to this activity she has been able to generate the income she needs to support the household expenses.  Olga Inés had parents with limited resources, and so she had to face a lot of adversity in her life.  She doesn't want her children to have the same experience.  For this reason, Olga Inés has always worked hard to provide for her children and give them the best education she can. She has a good reputation with her customers, thanks to the good food that she sells.  Olga Inés has seen her sales increase, and so she needs to buy more supplies to make the food that she sells to her customers.  However, Olga Inés does not have the capital available at this time to buy the supplies that she needs.  For this reason, she has applied for a loan that will allow her to purchase these supplies so that she can continue to increase her sales.  Olga Inés wants her business to continue on this growth path so that her income can increase considerably, and so that she can improve the quality of her life and that of her husband and their 3 children, as she wants to provide her child with the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make the food that she sells to her customers

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles traditionnelles à Madou diarrabougou, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SOURAKA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,75 hectares de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 260 000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi II group are married women averaging 33 years of age, wit three children. They live mainly in traditional families in Madoudiarrabougou, a village in the Kolikoro Region (the second Administrative district of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities at the beginning of the winter season. They grow millet and peanuts. They are on their fourth collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Souraka, the second one from the left standing, plans to purchase agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and small tools as well as pay the cost of labor to work about 1.5 hectares [about 4.3 acres] of millet and peanuts.

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the village of Fana to a customer base composed of both men and women. Souraka plans to achieve an average monthly income of 260,000 West African francs per agricultural campaign. This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband provide for everyday expenses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs  and small tools as well as pay the cost of labor to work about 1.5 ha of millet and peanuts.

loans.name: Benedito

texts.es: Benedito de 47 años, es un hombre emprendedor y soñador. Vive junto a su conviviente Silvia, quien es su socia en su actividad laboral. Tienen una  casa propia donde crían a sus 3 Hijos, quienes están en etapa escolar. El trabajo de Benedito consiste en labrar la tierra, fertilizarla para sembrar cítricos tales como limón, naranja, mandarina. Después de la siembra se dedica a regar y cuidar las  plantas de las distintas plagas que atacan esta especie. El lugar donde realiza esta actividad se encuentra  a un kilómetro de su vivienda. Se inició en esta actividad con ayuda de  su suegra y luego compró unas hectáreas de terrenos para realizar sus  propios cultivos. Cuando llega el tiempo de la cosecha, los obreros que contrata eventualmente se dedican a coger para luego seleccionar los cítricos para los distintos mercados. Comenta que es rentable su  trabajo ya que   en este tiempo  los cítricos tienen un buen precio en el mercado porque son muy solicitados por los clientes. Al iniciar  su labor tuvo  dificultades  para  comprar abono y fertilizantes que necesitaba porque no contaba con le capital necesario para adquirir estos productos esenciales. Pero obtuvo un pequeño  préstamo  y fue su impulso  para seguir adelante. Espera crecer en su negocio y obtener  más hectáreas de terreno para una mejor distribución de sus parcelas. Por tanto éste será su préstamo numero 20 con la institución MFP, tiene ganas de seguir siendo socio; seguir siendo puntual. Sabe que lo socios de su grupo son responsables  por que los conoce muchos años. Además agradece a la institución  por brindarle la oportunidad de contar con un capital para seguir en su ardua labor. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará abono, fertilizantes y pagara unos obreros porque falta  pocas semanas para la cosecha la cual es abundante.
texts.en:
Benedito is forty-seven years old and is a hard-working man and a dreamer.  He lives with his life partner Silvia, who is also his work partner.  They have their own home where they raise their three children, all of which are in school.  Benedito's work involves plowing the land and laying fertilizer in order to plant different citrus trees, like lemon, orange, and mandarin.  After planting the seeds, he works to water and care for the plants, protecting them from different pests that attack these specific plant types.  

The place where he works is a kilometer from his home.  He began this activity with the help of his mother-in-law.  He later bought some plots of land in order to grow his own crops.  When the harvest time arrives, the workers that he hires gather and select the citrus fruits for the different markets.  He says that his work is profitable; citrus fruits already have a good price at the market this season because they are in high demand.    

At first, he had trouble buying the manure and fertilizers he needed for his work because he did not have the necessary capital to purchase these essential products.  However, he obtained a small loan and this was his boost to continue moving forward.  He hopes to grow his business and to obtain more plots of land in order to better distribute his crops.  

This will be his twentieth loan with MFP.  He has hopes of continuing to be a member and to continue making his payments on time.  He knows that his group members are responsible, since he has known them for many years.  He is also thankful to the institution for offering him the opportunity to count on capital in order to continue his work.  

With the amount he is requesting (1000), he will buy manure, fertilizer, and will pay the laborers, since there are only a few weeks left before the abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anees

texts.en: Anees  is 38 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Anees  has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is 53 years old and is mother of four children of 13, 15, 17 and 20 years of age. Her husband is a labourer and earns minimum wage. Four years ago she decided, seeing the need of her 4 children, to help her husband and started a small business selling seafood, with the ultimate goal of earning extra income to cover all of their necessities. Her husband\'s earnings were not enough and now that their children find themselves in school, their expenses are more every day. With a great deal of effort and hard work, she has managed to expand her small restaurant, having always counted on the emotional support of her family.

She needs a loan of $475 to pruchase products andn utensils that she requires for the preparation of food and, in this manner, generate greater earning to further expand her business. Oralia has fought hard to build what she now has. Help her keep growing. She and her family will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es madre tiene 53 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos de 13, 15, 17 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es obrero y gana el salario mínimo. Hace cuatro años ella, al verse en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos y ayudar a su esposo, inició un pequeño negocio de venta de mariscos, con la finalidad de poder obtener ingresos extras que le permitieran cubrir todas las necesidades. Pues con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente, ya que sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y los gastos son cada día mayores. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado ampliar su negocio de comida, contando con el apoyo emocional de su familia.

Ella necesita de un crédito de $ 475 DLLS par poder comprar productos y utensilios que requiere para la elaboración de sus alimentos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para poder ampliara su negocio. Oralia ha luchado mucho par construir lo que hasta ahora tiene, ayúdala a seguir creciendo, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy more cereal food, milk, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his Bicycle business

loans.name: Bah Jeremiah

texts.en:
As a young and aspiring man, Jeremiah has been finding difficulties trying to raise  business capital. He is married and has one child. He had tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had problems of repayment due to high interest rates.
Pig farming is a very profitable business in his community when done on a large scale.
Motivated by his ambitions, Jeremiah joined GHAPE in March 2007. His choice for this trade is as a result of his childhood experience in pig rearing and further business development skills acquired during GHAPE Initial training. Given a loan of $100, he plans to buy 240kg of pig feed since he already has the pigs but faces difficulties feeding them. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Rearing of pigs

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. She would like a loan of $725 to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza is a mom who has worked very hard over the past years to make sure that her family is well taken care of. She was a stay-at-home mom for the past 7 years, but due to economic reasons since her husband was the only one working, she decided to start her own business to be able to provide for her family.

This is how she started her own business at the local market in the city of Managua. She started by selling a few things out of a mobile cart. She had little money, but due to her faith and dedication to help her family move ahead have made it easier for her in getting to where she is now.

CEPRODEL offered a friendly hand during the most difficult times Maritza had to face. Their financial support helped her rent a small space and purchase more material which means more merchandise and more profit. She has had 6 loans which all have been paid for.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza es madre de familia, razon que la ha llevado a luchar por el bienestar de su hijo, su esposo y el de ella misma. Hace mas de 7 años se dedicaba unicamente a los quehaceres del hogar, sin embargo ante la realidad economica que vivia (solo el esposo laboraba), ella tuvo que decidirse y montar su propio negocio para poder sustentar su nucleo familiar.

Es de esta manera como nace su negocio en el mercado mayoreo de la ciudad de managua apenas vendiendo pocas cosas en un carreton. Su capital era poco pero su fe y su dedicacion por satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la llevaron hasta donde esta el dia de hoy.

CEPRODEL fue una mano amiga en los momentos dificiles de Maritza, ya que le brindo el financiamiento necesario para adquisicion y mejoramiento de local asi como el incremento de materiales lo que se traduce en mas productos y mayores ventas. Su record ed de 6 creditos con una buena calificacion.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Ambrosina

texts.en:
Ambrosina is in her early thirties, and she and her husband have six children, four of whom are boys, all who attend school. Her husband is a farmer.

For quite some time, Ambrosina had planned to start selling men and women´s clothing but didn´t have access to any start-up capital. Fortunately, six months ago, she obtained a loan with which she managed to purchase some clothing from outside her neighborhood. As a good entrepreneur, she has managed to make her business successful and she repaid her loan on time.

Ambrosina hopes that with the profits she makes from her used clothes sales business, she can buy a washing machine for her family. She is now requesting a new loan to buy clothing in bulk in order to keep meeting her customers´ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Dolores is 30 years old, she is married, and has three small children ages five, three, and eight months old. Maria makes tortillas, sells cheese and cooked beans, and also has a small local store from which she sells basic grains. Her husband works construction, but only sporadically. Therefore, with Maria’s sales, she is able to pay for her home expenses. She is asking for the loan in order to buy large sacks of rice, sugar, and beans to add to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra Maria Dolores tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, con 3 hijos menores de edad, 5, 3 y 8 meses de edad. Doña Maria elabora tortillas, vende queso y frijoles cocidos y también tiene una Mini Pulpería en la cual vende Granos Básicos. Su esposo trabaja en construcción de manera esporádica, es por eso que Doña Maria lo apoya con sus ventas en los gastos del hogar. Requiere el préstamo para compara sacos de arrroz, azúcar y frijoles para inevrtir en su negocio

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Maarifa B Group

texts.en:
Azizi K., age 29, is married with one kid (age 2 years). He has a market stand which his family started 18 years ago. He works from 8am to 9pm making a monthly profit of about $44.

In the past, Azizi took out 2 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more fruits. He now hopes for a new loan to increase on the same business. He will share this loan with his subgroup members who have businesses dealing in selling bricks, tvs, fish and chacoal.

In the picture, Azizi is second from the left, weariing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to increase on business

loans.name: Abdurahimova

texts.ru:
N. Abdurahimova is 35. She is a good seamstress, but now she is on a maternity leave. N. Abdurahimova has 5 children with her youngest being only 2 years old. N. earns an income by raising a variety of farm animals. She now has 20 goats and 8 rams. Now, N. Abdurahimova asks for this loan to purchase 2 cows. N.’s oldest son helps her to run the farm. N.’s husband is in Russia working as a seasonal laborer.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахимова Насиба женщина в возросте 35 лет имеет средне- техническое образование.Хорошая портниха на дому, но сейчас она сидит в дикретном отпуске.Она имеет 5 детей , младшему ребенку 2 годика.В свободное время занимается откормом скота.Сейчас имеет 20 коз и 8 баранов .Но сейчас она хочет в кредит купить две коровы,одну из них буренку чтоб иметь свое молоко. Ей помогает старший сын по уходу за скотом .Муж на заработках в Российской Федерации.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Gulboy

texts.ru:
Gulboy K. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 61 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has use of land on which he raises cattle. He purchases young calves, sheep and goats, raises them and resells them on the market. His business helps the general development of cattle raising in the region and supplies local markets with fresh meat. Gulboy is currently planing to increase turnover and wishes to obtain a loan for this purpose. He plans to repay the loan within a 15 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Карахочаев Гулбой проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 61 год , женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, овец и коз, откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Его бизнес помогает развитию животноводческого сектора и обеспечивает рынки мясом. На данный момент Гулбой планирует увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет получать больший доход. Который необходим его семье.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene I. is 49 years old and married with 8 children. She sells drinks at wholesale; she learned the business in a year. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She started her business in 2004. She is requesting the loan of $875 to buy more drinks for sale. She says, “Thank you to Kiva and its lenders.”

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. lives in Ping P. Village in KamP. Speu Province, Cambodia. She is currently employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Somaly Kim, is a construction worker and pig breeder. Mr. Somaly Kim’s pig breeding business has improved, so he would like to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Sokha P. is requesting a loan to buy more pigs for her husband's business.

Mrs. Sokha P. is 25 years old and is the mother of a child who is too young to work or attend school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her husband's business.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk M. is a 33 year old mother of one who lives in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Suk, transports soil by motorbike to sell in different villages. Their family has just built a new house but they have not yet completed it because Mrs. Uk M. does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Uk M. has decided to ask for a loan to build a banister for their home. Previously, Mrs. Uk M. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for her field which she successfully paid off. Mrs. Uk M., her husband and their child are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a banister for house

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Gavhar I., 43, lives in Vahdat district. She and her husband have 5 children. Gavhar has an economics degree and a small business selling cooking oil. Her business is one of the main sources of income for her family. Gavhar would like to purchase more goods to sell and has applied for a 12-month loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Исломова Гавхар жительница райлна Вахдат.Возраст 43 года.ю зхамужем, имеет 5 детей.Образование высшее, по специальности экономист.Гавхар занимается куплей продажей растительного масла. Этот вид деятельености явялется одним из основных источников дохода ее семьи. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить товар.На что ей нужны деньги. Гавхар решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Джамиева Майсара проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Разведена и имеет троих детей. Занимается животноводством. Закупает молодых бычков , а после откормки продает.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 2 года, после того , как она развелась с мужем.Планирует купить породистого бычка для чего и планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей увеличить прибыльность дела и равивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Maisara J. lives in the Jaloluddini Rumi district. She is divorced and has three children. She raises animals; young bull calves are purchased, raised to market weight, and sold. She has been in this business for the two years since her divorce. She decided to buy a purebred bull calf, which she will do by taking out a 12 month loan. This will help develop the business and increase its profitability.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
El Sr. Joel habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah IV etapa, tiene 44 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y con dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, que estudian, don Joel trabaja en servicios de seguridad, las 24 hora de día y noche y el siguiente día tiene libre, pero aprovecha a trabajar en construcción ya que su salario es bajo, y con los trabajos extras se ayuda ya que su meta es terminar de construir su casa ya que es muy sencilla e insegura es de tabla y zing y  lo que mas desea es que su familia tenga una vivienda digna. Con la solicitud de préstamo que esta haciendo es para infraestructura quiere hacer las paredes de su casa , lo cual desea vivir un poco mejor y gozar de mejores condiciones para su familia. Lo cual necesita   comprar  materiales de construccion como piedra, arena, cemento, hierro el no gastaria en la mano de obra ya que tambien se desempeña en construccion, que va hacer de gran beneficio en los ahorros .
A largo plazo es poder tener su casa construida, cuidar de su familia, y dar estudios a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Joel lives in the Hialeah IV stage neighborhood of Managua. He is 44 years old and has two children ages nine and 12 both of who are in school. His wife is a homemaker and Joel works as a security guard. He works a 24 hour shift and has the following day off but takes advantage of his day off by working in construction because his salary is not very high. The extra work is helpful as his goal is to finish building his home. Joel is requesting this loan to improve the infrastructure of his home since it is currently made of wood and zinc. His wish is to live better and to enjoy a home that is worthy of his family. He will only use the loan to purchase construction materials such as rock, sand, cement and iron as he will provide the labor himself. His long term goals are to build his home, to take care of his family, and to provide for the education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and construction of the walls of his home.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: U. Solomon sells motor and electrical spare parts.  He started this business after his secondary school education.  He is 28 years old and married without children.  He needs the loan amount of N81,000 to purchase more motor and electrical spare parts to sell.  He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase motor and electrical spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognogontala est un regroupement composé de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 4 enfants et  37 ans qui vit dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au village Bougoula Hameau de la préfecture de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Unies par des relations de voisinage et d’alliance ces femmes mènent des activités génératrices de revenus  diverses et variées. En plus de leur activité principale qui est l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires, elles vont la vente, de poissons fumés, de tasses,  de baignoires , de vêtements  pour enfants etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clièntele qui ne cesse d’augmenter, ce groupe décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 4ème  prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce quatrième leur permettra d’acheter, 13 caisses de tomate, 10 sacs de noix de Néré, 2 sacs d’oignon, 2 sacs d’aubergine, 1 sac de gombo, 5 paquets de cubes maggie, 5 boîtes de concentré tomate, etc.
Généralement elles achètent leurs marchandises au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et les ventes sont effectuées soit au marché local, soit à domicile au comptant et à crédit à une clienèle composée des femmes du village.Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce 4ème prêt un bénéfice moyen de 15.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé appuiyer les activités, payer les intérêts du prêt et à participer aux dépenses de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
Kotognogontala is a group composed of six women, all married, averaging four children and 37 years of age. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Bougoula Hameau, Sikasso Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by ties of community and alliances, these women do various and varied work to earn an income. In addition to their main work, which is commerce in condiments, they sell smoked fish, cups, tubs, clothing for children, etc.

To satisfy their every-increasing customer base, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, with which they are on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. This four loan will enable them to buy: 13 boxes of tomatoes, 10 sacks of néré seeds, 2 sacks of onions, 2 of eggplant, 1 of okra, 5 packets of Maggie bouillon cubes, 5 cans of tomato paste, etc.

Generally, they buy their merchandise at the grand marketplace of the city of Sikasso. Sales are made either at the local marketplace or out of homes, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of village women.

Using this fourth loan, they each envision realizing an average profit of 15,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to support the businesses, to pay the loan interest, and to help cover the expenses of their respective families.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, smoked fish, cups, tubs, rice, and children's clothing

loans.name: Bilquis Manzoor Masih Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is a 48-year-old married lady and resides in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 18 years. Her husband's name is M. M. and he is a farmer. She has no children. She spends most of her time sewing clothes and making embroidered clothes. This activity gives her rewards in the form of money. She invests a part of her income in her husband’s land and a part to furnish her house. She is applying for a loan to buy an ox to till the land belonging to her husband.

Bilquis baji is the group leader for a few more women. Safia, Seema and Irshad baji each want a loan to buy buffaloes for their milk-selling business. Another lady called Irshad baji wants a loan to buy bricks to re-sell. Jabeen baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps, pipes) for her sanitary supply business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an ox to till their land

loans.name: Abdukadir

texts.en:
Abdukadir M. is 41 years old. He is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many others in his grocery store which he built 10 years ago. Currently Abdukadir has about US$ 1000 in inventory. His monthly net profit is about US$ 300.

Today Abdukadir is requesting a loan of 3200 Somoni for the term of 12 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children might progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his very best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr: Agé de 53 ans, Monsieur A. Yawovi est marié et père de 05 enfants à charge. Il  mène l’activité de stockage et de vente de céréales depuis 20 ans. C’est une activité très rentable dans la mesure où le maïs qui est le principal produit d’aliment de base devient une denrée rare en temps de soudure. Malgré l’importance des stockes de Monsieur A., il ne parvient pas à satisfaire à la forte demande de la population. Il veut augmenter son stock et dégager plus de bénéfices. Une fois les bénéfices réalisés, il pourra améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mr. Yawovi A., age 53, is married and the father of five. For twenty years, his work has involved storing and selling grain. This is a very profitable business to the extent that corn, which is the main staple, becomes a rare item during the off-season. Despite the importance of stocked supplies, he is unable to satisfy the strong demand of the population. He wants to increase his stock and to make more profit. Once the profits are realized, he will be able to improve his household’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storage and sale of corn

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace Y. is thirty eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three girls and three boys.. According to her, one of her children is learning a trade. The rest are attending senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai are into commercial activities. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Grace is a bread baker.
