She procures bags of flour, sugar, margarine, etc from shops in her community at retail prices. She would like a larger working capital so that she could travel and buy directly from wholesalers at more attractive price. Grace supplies the bread to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She has been baking bread for seven years and now wants a loan to expand her business. It is her dream to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour and ingredients to make bread to sell

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
la Sra. Martha E. G. tiene 37 años de edad, ella vive en Jicaro Galan, un lugar muy transitado por mucha gente ya que aqui es la division entre la carretera que conduce a la ciudad capital Tegucigalpa y tambien hacia el Pais de El Salvador, ella tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda economicamente ya que la unica fuente de ingresos que ella tiene es de la venta de frutas, ahora ella quiere comprar pescado y paletas, ya que en esta epoca de semana santa se vende mucho el pescado y como aqui es uno de los lugares mas calientes de Honduras la gente compra muchas paletas para refrescarse, los niños son buenos clientes con las paletas.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar dicho producto ya que es mas barato comprarlo en cantidades grandes, asi ella tendra mas ganancias, esta temporada dura como 4 meses.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha E. Galos is 37 years old. She lives in Jicaro Galan a place with heavy pedestrian traffic since it is the dividing point between the highway that goes to the capital Tegucigalpa and the country of El Salvador. She has two children and one of them helps her out economically since her only source of income is selling fruits. She wants to buy fish and popsicles, since fish is sold a lot during lent season and because this is one of the hottest places in Honduras, people buy a lot of popsicles to cool off. Kids are great customers that buy popsicles. She needs the loan in order to be able to buy said products since it is cheaper to buy it in larger quantities, which will allow her to have higher earnings. This season only lasts 4 months.

Translated from Spanish by SANDY JUAREZ, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fiish and popsicles

loans.name: Botsou

texts.fr: A. est un jeune homme célibataire très dynamique qui travaille dur pour pouvoir subvenir à ses charges. Il a appris le métier de la menuiserie en 1996 et travaillait chez quelqu’un. Pour pouvoir mieux gagner de l’argent, il a ouvert son propre atelier qu’il a appelé « ELEPHANT MEUBLE », il ne dispose pas encore de certains outils. C’est pour cela  qu’il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter une machine défonceuse, une machine scieuse et divers outils.
texts.en:
A. is a young man, unmarried, and very energetic. He works hard to be able to support himself. He learned the trade of carpentry in 1996 and used to work with somebody. To earn more money, he opened his own workshop, which he calls “ELEPHANT MEUBLE”. He still lacks certain tools. This is why he’s requesting his first loan with WAGES, so as to buy a router, a power saw, and various tools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a power saw and a router

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro López G. es un joven soltero que  obtuvo una casa de interés social pero el no se había cambiado por que el todavía vive con sus papas y para que la casa no se quedara sola  la presto a un primo para que la habitara al momento de quedar la casa sola no la dejo en muy buenas condiciones. Ahora Isidro quiere independizarse hacer su propio hogar pero para esto quiere arreglar los daños que se ocasionaron como  las paredes que se encuentran aboyadas y darle un pintadita para que el se siente que tiene una casa presentable.
texts.en:
Isidro López G. is a single young man who obtained a house of social interest, but he has not moved because he still lives with his parents and because the house wasn't left alone. He lent it to a cousin because when the house was left alone it wasn't left in good condition. Now Isidro wants to be independent to make his own home, but he needs to fix the damage, such as the walls that need painted. He will then feel like it is a prestable house.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arreglar daños en su vivienda

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Reyna es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Reyna tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, leña, cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo. El esposo de Reyna tiene una imprenta que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad en un local alquilado.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y arroz.
Reyna sueña con ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of Communal Bank Triunfo. She is married, 31 years old, and has 3 children. Reyna has a shop in her home where she sells general merchandise, vegetables, firewood and grains. She works there every day with occasional help from her husband. Her husband has a printing press in a rented locale in the center of town. Reyna needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will use to purchase sugar and rice. She dreams of growing her business and that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar and rice

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil A. is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents.

Jamil sells confectionery and other food items in the market and has been in this business already for eight years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

Since Jamil is very popular in the market selling fresh and tasty products, he tries to maintain a wide variety of goods. Today Jamil requests 2000 USD to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his market.

loans.name: Los Montones: Group 3

texts.en:
Martha S. R. (far left) is the coordinator for a group of five women seeking to take out a loan. She is a single mother of two children, ages 5 and 2. She manages a small business selling clothes, something she has a wealth of experience doing. 

This is the second time she has taken out a loan with Esperanza; her first loan was successfully used to expand her business to improve her family’s wellbeing. With this loan, she plans to purchase more clothes to further expand her business. Eventually, she hopes to open her own boutique.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (180370682) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To making a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Benkadi 2 De (Benkadi A  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe BENKADI  2 de l’association BENKADI A   est  constitué de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Ce prêt servira à  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 25 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés du village de Marka-Coungo et Fana  après les récoltes et à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant très généralement des grandes villes telles Bamako, Ségou. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI 2 of the association BENKADI A is composed of married women who average 44 years of age and 4 children.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, the community seat of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work.  Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts.  The group members are on their fifth loan with the institution.  All the past loans were repaid without difficulty. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment.  And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 25 hectares.  Part of their production is consumed at home.  The other part is sold to customers composed of men and women generally from big cities, such as Bamako and Ségou.  The goods are sold at the weekly markets of Marka-Coungo and Fana after the harvests.  The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jenniffer Wambui

texts.en: Jenniffer G. is 49 years old, and is married to Tiras Macharia. They have one child, Dorren, aged 26 years old. Jenniffer has managed her goods distribution business for six years and her other source of income is in the auto spares and hardware business which she manages on the side. Jenniffer has not borrowed from other micro-loan organizations before but she was introduced to KADET by existing clients. With the loan she has applied for, she plans to increase her stock of rice as the demand for rice is high. With the extra profits, Jenniffer plans to purchase a plot of land and build a stone house to cut the costs of renting. She also believes she is hardworking and focussed and she hopes to tap into new markets. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase her stock of rice and tomatoes

loans.name: Alison Roxana

texts.es:
Alison vive en la c/Buenos Aires de la zona Las Lomas en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
La señora vive junto a sus padres y se dedica a la elaboración de calzados a contrato y pedido, comercializa sus productos en la zona del Rosario.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is fifty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Margaret is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew and sells on a table by a roadside in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby towns.

Margaret has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to make rice and stew

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emiliano tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 5 hijos, en su casa propia. Él es campesino desde niño, desde entonces su cultivo preferido es la papa, porque genera mayores ingresos, por ello posó orgullosamente para la foto en su chacra de papa. Emiliano trabaja con el apoyo valioso de su esposa, sobre todo durante las cosechas, ya que para esas faenas se requiere de muchas manos para la recolección del producto. Sus labores agrícolas le gustan mucho, aunque sean de mucha inversión y de pesado trabajo físico, eso no le ha quitado la alegría ni las esperanzas de seguir sembrando papa, ya que las veces que la comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, logra solventar todos los gastos de su hogar. 
Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, siendo una persona muy puntual en sus cuotas, asimismo es muy colaborador en las actividades de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para su próxima siembra de papa, la cual será dentro de muy pocos días.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es: Mayra del Socorro O. de 38 años tiene una pequeña pulpería en la comarca rural pilas orientales. La pulpería esta surtida con granos básicos y gaseosa pero ella necesita comprar otros productos de consumo para el hogar como  champú, jabones, detergente….etc. además ella produce y vende hamacas de gran calidad.
texts.en:
Mayra del Socorro O. is 38 years old and has a small grocery store in the rural area of Pilas Orientales. Her grocery store is stocked with staple grains and sodas, but she needs to purchase other consumer products for the home such as shampoo, soaps, detergent, etc. In addition, she makes and sells good quality hammocks.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shampoo, soaps, detergent, and staple grains

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: La señora Carmen O. de 38 años de edad, vive en el barrio Domitila, madre soltera de una hija de 13 años de edad, el cual estudia en la escuela del barrio, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace seis años, al comienzo fue difícil el cual comenzó con poca ropa y andar vendiendo por la calle, cansada de caminar y sin vender nada, eso era bastante frustrante, pero poco a poco logro tener clientela que comenzó a dar al crédito para la quincena gente de su barrio, ahora trabaja con bastantes pedidos de las mujeres de zona franca y al crédito. También se ha afiliado con la Avon en donde compra el catalogo al gusto del cliente y también le dan crédito que se beneficia mucho ya que cuando recoge el dinero va a pagar. Con este financiamiento va a comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes y seguir adelante con su negocio. Con las ganancias quiere repellar las paredes su casa para que se mire bonita y poder dar  a su hija mejor comodidad que lo esta logrando con la mano ayuda de Afodenic el cual agrádese por la oportunidad dada con sus prestamos.
texts.en:
Carmen O. is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Domitila. She is a single mother of her 13 year old daughter, who studies in a school in the neighborhood. Carmen O. has been selling clothes for the past six years. In the beginning it was difficult because she began with few clothes to sell and sold them by walking through the streets. She was tired of walking and hadn't sold much; it was very frustrating. But little by little she began to have clients, who she extends credit to until payday (for two weeks). Now she has many orders from women in the free trade zone and those who she gives credit to. She is also affiliated with Avon, where she buys from the catalog to her clients' tastes. They also give a loan that she has already profited from. When she collects the money, she is going to pay it back. With this financing she is going to buy clothes, shoes, and cosmetics to offer her clients and continue in her business. With these profits she wants to plaster the walls of her house so it looks nicer and she can give her daughter greater comfort. She is accomplishing this with the helping hand of Afodenic. She is pleased to be given this opportunity with her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Legalo

texts.en:
Legalo P. is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Papa Sataua 1.  She is married and has 8 adult children.  Legalo grows and sells cocoa.  Legalo has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 510 Samoan tala (about $204 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Legalo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Legalo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 tala from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Legalo is now requesting her second loan from SPBD; she is asking for 1500 tala to buy harvesting equipment.  Legalo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng P., 39, is a widower with two school-aged children. He resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with his children. To make a living, he is engaged in a business selling boiled duck eggs and beer. Also, he operates his motorbike as a taxi every morning, earning an income of approximately US $33 per day. His income helps cover the family expenses, especially for the children’s education in the future. P. is seeking to improve his  standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase more eggs and beer to expand his current business and sell to his regular and new customers.

loans.use: To buy more duck eggs and beer to sell

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang S., 33, is married and lives with four children and her husband in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she provides transportation services for local farmers in her province.  She earns about $5 per day.  Her husband operates a truck and transports dirt, earning $8 daily. S. and her family members want to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to transport dirt for people in her village. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI.  In the future, she hopes to buy another car for her husband to expand his business.  She also wants her children to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy a trailer to  transport dirt.

loans.name: Tante

texts.en:
V. is married to Tante Nde Mathias and they have five children. She and her entire family are living in a house with three bedrooms. Being a very hard working woman, she has encountered some expenses in the family, such as the death of family members. 

She runs a poultry business and sells foodstuffs with the support of her children and her husband. She will invest the loan in buying groundnuts, palm oil, three-week-old chicks, and fowl feed. With previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with chickens for their social activities. 

This will be her third loan from GHAPE; she joined GHAPE in 2007. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location in mile 11 Bambui, the quality of her food, and her reasonable prices. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
The part of the profits from this loan will be used to pay the school fees of her children; the other part will be used to expand the business. V. does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization.

loans.use: To buy food for sale and chicks for raising and selling

loans.name: Jose Heliodoro

texts.es: Don José tiene la edad de 56 años, vive en el barrio 380,  junto a su esposa e hijo, su trabajo es albañil desde hace más de quince años, pues no es fácil ya que es un trabajo agotador, trabajando bajo sol, lo mas dificultoso es cuando terminan una obra y no hay trabajo, pasa hasta una semana para comenzar. Aunque otras veces tiene que viajar a los departamentos hacer trabajo allá. Poco a poco ha ido haciendo mejora a su pequeña casa, pero tiene la necesidad de poner las divisiones del baño y el inodoro ya que no están en las mejores condiciones de higiene,lo cual comprara: bloques, arena y cemento para hacer la division. No lo habia hecho  por que no cuenta con capital ya que lo que gana es para la alimentación y otros gastos. Es por eso con este financiamiento va  a levantar paredes del baño y inodoro y poner puerta. Y gozar de las mejoras que gracia a ala institución será posible.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives in the 380 neighborhood with his wife and son. He has been a bricklayer for over 15 years. This isn't easy work since it is exhausting physically and it's under the relentless sun. The most difficult part of it is not having work once a job is over; sometimes an entire week might go by before starting a new job. Sometimes he even has to travel to other departments to look for work there. Gradually, he has been improving his own small house but he needs to install walls between the bath and toilet because they don't have the best hygienic conditions now. He will buy concrete blocks, sand and cement to build the wall. He hadn't done so before because he lacked the capital to do so because his earnings are barely enough to pay for food and other expenses. Thanks to this help from the institution, he will be able to raise a wall between the bath and toilet and he will install a door and he will be able to enjoy the improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: T. Edwige est née le 24 Janvier 1953 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. C'est depuis 34 ans que Edwige s'est installée au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à PADONOU Désiré, un agent commercial en retraite, Edwige est mère de huit enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais seulement un enfant reste encore à sa charge. Le couple vit toujours ensemble à Zogbo avec le seul enfant qui leur reste à charge. Edwige a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Mais depuis une dizaine d'année, Edwige mène comme activité la vente de divers articles (pâtes alimentaires, savons, huile végétale, papier hygiénique, lait corporel, fournitures scolaires, etc.) et aussi des boissons de la SOBEBRA, à son domicile. Pour diversifier son activité et augmenter son revenu, Edwige vend également des habits tout cousus et des chaussures, de façon secondaire. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Edwige s'approvisionne. Edwige est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qu'elle avait bien remboursés. Edwige voudrait renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Edwige sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Edwige T. was born January 24, 1953 in Abomey, a historical city of Benin. 34 years ago she settled in the Zogbo neighbourhood of Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. Married to Désiré PADONOU, a retired commercial agent, Edwige is the mother of eight children, all either in school or having attended school. Only one child is still under her care. The couple lives together in Zogbo with their one remaining child. Edwige herself has attended school up to secondary level, but for the past ten years has set up shop in her home, selling various items such as: pasta, soap, vegetable oil, toilet paper, body milk, school items, etc.), and also SOBEBRA brand beer and soft drinks. To diversify her activity and increase her income, she also sells ready-to-wear clothes and shoes, as a side business. Edwige gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She is a long-standing client of ALIDé, having already been granted three previous loans, all fully reimbursed. She would like to strengthen her business and be more responsive to customers’ expectations. Therefore, she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pasta, vegetable oil, soap, soft drinks and beer, etc.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth L. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Jeaneth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeaneth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food, daily use products and drinks in the local community. Jeaneth has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeaneth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeaneth is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jeaneth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aida Estela

texts.es:
Aida Estela Sánchez C. tiene 39 años,  vive en  el barrio 7 de Abril, ubicado en el suroccidente  de Barranquilla y se dedica al comercio de mercancía variada, como ropa y platería;  negocio que inició a finales del año 1992, una vez decidió compartir su vida con su cónyuge y dedicarse al cuidado de su familia especialmente de sus hijos.   Siendo soltera había trabajado mucho tiempo  como empleada  y ahora con un hogar, decidió cambiar su vida para cumplir con su responsabilidad de esposa y madre y al mismo tiempo  apoyar el mejoramiento de  su familia. Comenzó  vendiendo  jean, suéter y accesorios de  platería, como en la actualidad  ocurre desde  hace 17 años,  lapso de tiempo en el que ha logrado consolidar su actividad comercial. Ella tiene  muchos clientes fijos y es muy reconocida en su sector por dar respuestas rápidas a sus pedidos; este es el propósito que planea al acceder a este crédito por valor de $1.000.000,   que invertirá en la compra de mercancías especialmente camisueter solicitados por sus clientes;   con esta inversión en su negocio aumentará  sus utilidades, pues significa un nuevo capital de trabajo del que puede disponer para comprar en efectivo. Desde que inició su negocio este es su segundo crédito, dice que asì  ha logrado ampliar sus inventarios  y capitalizarlo, ofreciendo  a sus clientes las mercancías que le encargan de manera oportuna.
Aida Sánchez tiene el gran sueño de  comprar una casa donde se encuentren cómodos  con sus familia,  para eso se mantiene siempre activa, porque está siempre dispuesta a responder a sus   clientes con  ropa y accesorios  de  buena calidad, para conservarlos e  incrementar su mercado a través de ellos mismos.
texts.en:
Aida Estela Sánchez C. is a 39-year-old woman who lives in the 7 de Abril neighborhood, located in the southwestern part of Barranquilla. She sells a variety of products, such as clothing and silver jewelry. She started this business towards the end of 1992, when she decided to share her life with her spouse and take care of her family, especially her children. When she was single, she had worked as a domestic servant for many years. Now that she has a family, she decided to change her life in order to fulfill her duties as a wife and mother, while at the same time support her family's amelioration. She started out by selling jeans, sweaters, and silver accessories. She has been in business for the last 17 years, during which time she has been able to strengthen her commercial activities. She has a fixed clientele and is well-known in her area for filling her orders quickly. For this reason, she is now requesting a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing merchandise, especially the polo shirts her customers have requested. By investing in her business, her profits will increase because this is working capital that she can use to pay cash for her merchandise. This is her second loan since she started the business, and she has been able to expand her inventory and make a profit, offering her customers the merchandise they order at an optimal time.

Aida Sánchez dreams of buying a house so that her family can live comfortably. For this reason, she is always active. She is always willing to provide her customers with high quality apparel and accessories so that she can keep their business and increase her transactions.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, particularly polo shirts

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Four of her children are studying in school in different classes. Her husband has a fruit selling business: he sells fruit from a cart in various locations.


Zubaida is a very kind lady. She takes care of her children, her family and her house. She has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan for the fourth time so that her husband can buy fruit and expand his business. They are expecting a good profit from this loan and it will be helpful in improving their living standard.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Rosa Rufina

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Rosa es casada, tiene 68 años y 6 hijos, Docente Cesante, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Rosa sueña con tener estabilidad económica y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgen Mary). She is 68 years old, married, and has six children. Rosa is a retired schoolteacher. She now has a store in her home where she sells beverages with the help of her husband.

Rosa needs a loan of 3000 PEN to invest in the purchase of beer and sodas. She dreams of having financial stability and helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & sodas

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma C. is from Barangay Quezon, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Alma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered. This loan will be Alma's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products offered

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina es V. desD. hace mas D. 20 años, con su marido había comenzado con la actividad D. venta D. comestibles en  un Copetín en su casa propia en el Centro D. la Ciudad D. San Lorenzo.
Como actualmente ya no pueD.  trabajar en la cocina la Sra. Marina se dedica al Alquiler D. los Salones  Comerciales que habían construidos con fruto del trabajo del entonces Copetín, en la actualidad cuentan con 3 Salones Comerciales.
El Crédito que esta Solicitando es para la Refacción D. unos D. los Salones  ya que este se esta desalquilado y se debe aprovechar antes D. volver alquilar D. manera que urgentemente se deben realizar los arreglos como  Revocar, Pintar D. Nuevo para el siguiente Locatario, por un lado y por el resto va a pagar su Impuesto Inmobiliario correspondiente al presente año.
AgraD. a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda.
texts.en:
Marina has been a widow for more than 20 years. She and her late husband started selling food and snacks from their home in central San Lorenzo. Marina is no longer able to work in the kitchen and now manages the rental of commercial space that was built with income from her first business. She currently has 3 rooms she rents out. The requested loan is to refurbish one of the rooms. It is currently vacant, and Marina wishes to take advantage of this to plaster and paint the room for the next tenant. She will also pay her property taxes with part of the loan. Marina is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint, bricks, cement, whitewash, etc.

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
La señora Casimira tiene 43 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad  de Inquilpata y pertenece al banco comunal “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”.  

Al entrevistar a la socia de banco comunal, ella nos manifestó. Yo cuento con un pequeño negocio de crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, cuyes y vacas, el negocio consiste en comprar animales críos en la feria de Inquilpalta y después los engorda y luego de varios meses los vende en la misma feria para lo cual a un inicio se hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa, el cual me brindo un apoyo de varios préstamos de dinero y así pude empezar a mejorar mi negocio.
 
Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo y así como también cuento con un capital y me va muy bien entonces requiero el crédito para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos y cuyes.
texts.en:
Casimira is 43, married with two children, and lives in the town of Inquilpata. She is a member of the community lending association called “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”. Casimira maintains a small business raising animals such as pigs, cows and "cujes" (a native rodent). She buys young animals at the Inquilpalta Fair, and fattens them for market over a period of several months. She then sells the adult animals at the same fair for profit. Casimira is constrained by having little operating capital, and for this reason became a member of the Asociación Arariwa, to access loans to build up her business. She has seen her animal raising activities prosper as a result of increased operating capital, which has allowed her to increase the number of animals for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased operating capital to buy additional farm animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corrugated roofing, wood, nails, cinder blocks, cement and manual labor

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn P. is from the village of Locos. She is 48 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling mainly dry goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $90 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional stock to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Canan

texts.en: Canan A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Canan is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn M. is from the village of Diaz, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 32 years old. Marilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es:
Daniel de 39 años,  el trabaja en su carro como taxista informal, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín” y caracterizada por su pobreza y sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó a trabajar en su carro para tener dinero para sus 4 hijos de 8, 6, 2 años y uno de 2 meses, trabaja haciendo expresos a sus amigos y recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil. Ha venido trabajando desde las 07h000am hasta las 00h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuestos para su carro, en el futuro quiere tener una cooperativa de taxis para asegurar la vida económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and works out of his car as an informal taxi driver. He lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil called Fortín, which is known for its poverty and the dirt roads.

Daniel began working out of his car so that he would have money to support his four children (ages 8, 6, 2, and 2 months). He works by acting as a personal courier for his friends and by traveling through the streets of Guayaquil. Daniel works every day from 7am to midnight.

With this loan, he wants to buy spare parts for his car. In the future, Daniel wants to have a taxi cooperative so that he can secure the finances of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts so that he can repair his car

loans.name: Dhoren

texts.en:
Dhoren F., 25, is married and has a six-year-old child. She is from the town of Banga in the province of South Cotabato on the island of Mindanao. Dhoren makes puto (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. She hopes that her business will grow.

Dhoren joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. Dhoren successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make puto to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed to make puto (rice cakes)

loans.name: New Jerusalem Group

texts.es: Josefina tiene 42 años, es casada, comerciante con nueve hijos, se dedica a la venta D. trastos en el Mercado D. Totonicapán, tiene veinticinco años D. contar con el negocio. Integrante y Presidenta del Banco Comunal, el cual es integrado por diez socias, quiene quierewn ampliar su capital D. trabajo para surtir sus productos. Se organizan con las vecinas a quienes conocen y confían, en el grupo se dedican a multiples actividades, que podemos mencionar, la Sastreria, Venta D. ropa típica, Panadería, etc. Lo que sueñan es incrementar el volume D. ventas y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. la familia D. cada integrante D. este grupo.
texts.en:
Josefina is 42 years old, she is married, and she has nine children. She is a vendor that sells kitchen ware in the market of Totonicapan. She has twenty five years experience in the business. She is a member and the leader of her community bank. The community bank is maD. up of ten members, each wishing to supplement their working capital and to add variety to the products they sell. They grouped together as neighbors that know each other and trust each other. The members of the group carry out various businesses, such as tailoring, sales of traditional clothing, bakery etc. Their dream is to increase their sales and to improve the living conditions for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa B. is from the village of Colupan Alto, Sinacaban. She is 63 years old. Elsa is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines (PHP) a month from it. In 2005, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Community Group 2-Kampala

texts.en:
Being undecided and lacking foresight in whatever you do in life is similar to a deer getting caught in the headlights -- your fate may hang in such an unpredictable balance that you may end up failing in whatever you do.

Being a product of a hardworking community, 37-year-old Hassan M. has steered clear of such a predicament. People in his community in Naluvule, Kampala, are well known sticklers fpr hard work and have always risen to the occasion when opportunities arise. 

It has been 12 years since this gentleman decided to start his retail shop. He sells a variety of general merchandise retail items that are in high favor with the people around his locality. He earns 180,000 shillings in weekly profit. Hassan also sells food. 

He was encouraged to enter this business by a close friend.  Previously he was inclined to hawking wares. With this loan, this married father of three says he is going to buy more retail items for sale. In the future, he says his profits will increase. Hassan belongs to Tulwanirewamu Community group.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items for sale

loans.name: Omar Xavier

texts.es:
Omar de 33 años, es vendedor de morocho (postre típico ecuatoriano elaborado con leches, grano morocho, vainilla). vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Aprendió la actividad en una empresa que elabora morocho. Trabajo por un tiempo hasta que se independizo y quiso tener su propio negocio de morocho. Hace el morocho todos los días en el patio de su casa con una paila, le ayudan dos personas a vender los vasos de morocho desde muy temprano hasta que se acaba lo que prepara para el día. Uno de los problemas es el transporte ya que vende el morocho en las calles Guayaquil. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ollas para elaborar con mas cuidado el morocho y leche. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y ser un distribuidor al por mayor del producto.
texts.en:
Omar is 33 years old and sells “morocho” (a traditional Ecuadorian treat made of milk, ground corn, and vanilla). He lives in a periurban area outside of Guayaquil called Duran, which is known for its deteriorating ecosystem.

Omar learned this trade at a business that makes “morocho”. He worked there for some time until he decided to become independent and start his own business. Omar makes the “morocho” every day in a large pot on the patio of his house. With the help of two assistants, he sells containers of “morocho” starting in the early morning hours until he runs out of what he has prepared for the day. One of his problems is transportation since he sells the “morocho” in the streets of Guayaquil.

With this loan, Omar will buy supplies for making “morocho” such as pots and milk. In the future, he wants to have his own shop and become a wholesale distributor of this product.

loans.use: Purchase pots & milk

loans.name: José De Los Santos

texts.es:
José de los Santos tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el caserío Caracucho del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural habitada por personas humildes que suelen dedicarse a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la apicultura, el posee algunas colmenas en un terreno aledaño al lugar en donde reside, el extrae durante varias temporadas la miel que producen las abejas y la comercializa mensualmente, el negocio es su principal fuente de sustento por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantenerse en el negocio.

José ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos como cera artificial y marcos de madera con los cuales piensa dar mantenimiento a su negocio. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como apicultor y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José de los Santos is 45 years old, married, and he lives with his wife and children in Caracucho village, Mórrope district, which is a rural area inhabited by humble folk who farm and raise livestock.  It's located just over an hour from the city Chiclayo.

José works as a beekeeper, and he has some hives in a field near his home.  At various times throughout the year, he extracts the honey the bees produce, and he offers it for sell on a monthly basis.  Because this business is his primary source of income, he does all he can to keep it going.

José has requested a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, which he plans to invest in beekeeping supplies such as artificial wax and wooden frames which will be used in his business.  His greatest wish is to continue to advance as a beekeeper and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a beekeeping business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth B. lives in the Kitawuluzi Lubaga Road neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. Ruth's retail business sells sweet bananas. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days a week. Ruth sells her products at the market. She generates additional income through selling piped water. Ruth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Ruth has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. The main business challenges for Ruth include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start to going to Masaka villages for sweet bananas. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Hortely Vigel

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 32ans, mariée, mère de 3enfants , a l'arrêt de ses études au lycée,pour aider sa famille a s'épanouir, elle se lance dans la boucherie en 2003.

Elle avait renforcé son stock en achetant des cartons de : viande, poulets, cuisses de poulets, Queue de bœuf , tripe, saucissons à l’ail, pieds de porcs.
Le remboursement du premier prêt s'est fait sans difficultés, les enseignements reçus ont beaucoup contribué à l'évolution de son activité ,ses revenus sont passés de 50.000f à 180.000f par jour.

Avec le deuxième prêt qu’elle aura pendant cette période des fêtes, elle va achetée  plus des cartons des cuisses de poulets et de viandes arrière.
La politique de gestion des crédits de notre institution à développé en elle un esprit d’épargne.
A l’avenir, elle veut ouvrir une boucherie – poissonnerie pour élargir son activité augmenter ses rendements de son activité afin de contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Young 32-year-old married woman, mother of 3. After finishing high school, she became a butcher in 2003 to help her family with their expenses.

Her stock consists of boxes of beef, chicken, chicken thighs, oxtail, tripe, garlic salami, pigs' feet. She repaid her previous loan with no problems. The information posted greatly contributed to an increase in business for her: her profits increased from 50,000 to 180,000 francs per day.

With her second loan that she'll receive during the festival season, she will buy more boxes of chicken thighs and beef hindquarters.
Our institutions policy of loan management has fostered a spirit of sharing in her.

In the future, she would like to open a butcher shop/fish shop to increase her business and profits, so she will be able to contribute to her childrens' education.

loans.use: Purchase of boxes of beef, sides of pork, tripe, oxtail

loans.name: Shahmar

texts.ru:
Shahmar Z. 24 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Shahmar jivet v Absheron regione  vmeste so svoimi  roditelyami. 
Shahmar uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet v etom biznesse , delayet okna i dveri. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya etim biznessom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyey raboti.
texts.en:
Shahmar Z. is 24 years old. He is not married and does not have children. Shahmar lives in the Absheron region together with parents.

Shahmar has been in this business for two years, he makes windows and doors. He learned this business from his father who also does the same. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy tools for his work.

loans.use: To buy tools for his work

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet  tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 4 años ella y su esposo trabajan como consultores proyectos de instalaciones de servicio de agua potable y alcantarillado de las diversas comunidades de su localidad. Incursiono en ésta actividad gracias a su cónyuge que es ingeniero de profesión, por lo que es una carta aval que garantiza que sus potenciales clientes requieran de sus servicios. Con el tiempo acondicionaron una oficina, lugar donde trabajan juntos y desde entonces ha visto grandes ventajas en sus ganancias que beneficia su economía; sin embargo desea mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeña oficina que ha implementado en su casa. Es su tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la ejecución de sus proyectos, asimismo desea incursionar en un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and she lives with her husband and their 2 children in a rented house. For the past four years, she and her husband have worked as potable water consultants and installation specialists for the various communities in their region. She started out in this business thanks to her husband who is an engineer by profession, which is an important endorsement and guarantee for potential clients needing their services. 

With time they established and office from where they can work together and since them they have seen a large improvement in their finances. They wish to make some improvements to their small home office. This is their third loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is happy to be in receipt of this financial support. She also enjoys her communal bank because she knows all of the members and they are very responsible team players.

She is grateful to all of those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. it will be a great support for the progress of their business. The loan that she requests will be invested in their projects and to start an additional business.

loans.use: To fund her projects.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es padre de familia tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus  hijos en el caserío Sector  Vallecito de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Rosario se dedica a la crianza de ovinos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Él desea comprar más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosario is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in a country house in Vallecito in the town of Tambogrande.  It is a farming district which is located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

Rosario raises sheep on the grounds where he lives.  Once they are grown he sells them to the general public and also to the merchants dealing in the area.   His wife sells food.  With the income they both make they are able to provide for their family.

He wants to buy more livestock and balanced diet feed so he can increase sales.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced diet feed

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
La señora María Adela A. de 57 años se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio su negocio cuando se tuvo que enfrentar al mundo sola con cuatro hijos al principio vendió sopa los fines de semana luego aprendió hacer baho con una vecina y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio de tal manera que de lunes a viernes vende tajadas con queso, tajas con carne y pollo.
A. tiene la meta de tener una fritanga completa  con una estufa grande.
Ella invertirá el crédito en el estudio de su hijo menor de 20 años quien estudia Ingles y unos medicamentos que necesita.
texts.en: María Adela A., 57 years old, has been selling food for 10 years.  She started her business when she had to face to world alone with four children.  At first she sold soup on the weekends, then she learned to make baho (a traditional Nicaraguan dish made of meat, green plantains and yuca cooked in banana leaves) with a neighbor.  She gradually grew the business so that from Monday through Friday she sells fried plantain slices with cheese, and plantains with beef and chicken. María has the goal of having a restaurant complete with a large stove that serves authentic Nicaraguan food.  She will invest her loan for her child, who is under 20 years old, to study English and also for some medicines they need.

loans.use: For her child's English studies.

loans.name: No Weapon Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you members of the “No Weapon” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders, to request a loan of SLL 3,700,000.00 for the entire group, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Tity B. is the leader of this group. Tity is married with 2 children who attend primary school. Tity sells body lotion, toothpaste, soap, Vaseline, etc. and has been doing this business for 9 years. With the help of this loan, Tity will invest in her business by buying stocks of good in large quantities, to add to her inventory at the store.  

(Also included on the left of the photo, is loan officer Edna B. C., handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: Buy body lotion, toothpaste, soap, Vaseline, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock of goods

loans.name: Guy Saturnin

texts.fr:
Agé de 41ans,  marié, père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie de 3 à 14ans est devenu vendeur du pétrole en et détails depuis 2004.

Il achète son pétrole dans les stations services, qu’il stock dans des futs de 120 litres.
Par jour il a des ventes qui sont comprises entre 30.000F à 50.000F.

Avec le prêt actuel, il va stocker plus de pétrole pour mieux contrôler ses revenus et bénéfices en achetant : 240litres de pétrole, 20bouteilles de 1litre vides, 2entonoirs de différents dimensions.
Dans son quartier, on l’appelle papa pétrole car il le seul fournisseur et compte devenir grossiste, pour cela il doit beaucoup vendre, faire plus de bénéfice afin que le camion citerne lui face des livraisons à domicile.
Il se bat pour le bien être de sa famille,/p>.
texts.en:
This is a 41-year-old, married man with four children ranging in age from 3 to 14. In 2004, he started selling petrol at retail. He buys his petrol from gas stations and stores it in 120L barrels. His daily sales reach 30,000 to 50,000F.

With this loan, he plans to increase his stocks of petrol to better monitor his income and profits. To that end, he will buy 240L of petrol, 20 empty 1L bottles, and 2 funnels in different sizes. 

In his neighborhood, they call him Papa Pétrole (“Daddy Petrol”) as he is the sole supplier. He plans to become a wholesaler and to do so, he must increase his profits. This will allow him to get petrol delivered by tank truck to his home. He strives to ensure his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy petrol wholesale, funnels, empty 1L bottles

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
Marina, 25 años D. edad, casada, 2 hijos. Integra como secretaria el grupo comunal: "San Miguel Arcangel".
Marina vive en el distrito D. Chupaca barrio Pincha en Huancayo, en donD. tiene una pequeña Juguerìa que atienD. D. lunes a domingo. En el futuro a Marina le gustarìa abrir una fuente D. soda en un lugar màs concurrido.
El prèstamo solicitado es para la compra D. utensilios para la juguerìa.
En la fotografìa Marina es la D. la foto pequeña que esta en la parte superior izquierda y no estuvo presente en la reuniòn por encontrarse atendiendo su juguerìa.
El socio Cristian P. no pudo llegar a la reuniòn por encontrarse trabajando: es taxista.
texts.en:
Marina is 25 years old, married, and has two children.  She is the secretary of the 'San Miguel Arcangel' (Saint Michael the Archangel) community bank.

Marina lives in Pincha neighborhood, in Huancayo, in Chupaca district.  She has a small juice bar where she works from Monday to Sunday.  In the future, she would like to open a soda fountain in a busier location.

In the picture, Marina is the woman in the small photo in the top left-hand corner.  She wasn't present at the meeting because she was working in her juice bar.

Cristian P. couldn't attend the meeting because he was working: he is a taxi driver.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her juice bar

loans.name: Flor De Pachawacan Group

texts.es: Irma T. A., tiene 26 años D. edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 4 hijos y 3 D. los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a oficios doméstico, y tambièn a la tejeduría, trabajo que viene realizando desD. hace 8 años, inició elaborando pequeños tejidos y ahora teje chamarras, cuenta con el apoyo D. su conyugue quien es comerciante. DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para invertirlo como capital D. trabajo, para la compra D. materia prima: Hilo y lana lo cual es un material muy importante para la elaboración D. chamarras. Las integrantes D. este grupo también se dedican a diferentes actividades productivas como: venta D. mercería, crianza D. animales, venta D. flores, y la elaboración D. candelas. Esperan ver su negocio mejor y mas granD..
texts.en:
Irma T. A. is 26 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  She has four children and three of them are in school.

Irma does house work and also knits.  She has been doing this for eight years.  She started out making small knitted items and now she knits jackets.  She has the support of her husband who is a salesman.  Irma decided to organize this group in order to request a loan which she could invest in her business as working capital, buying raw materials: thread and yarn.  These are very important materials for making her jackets.

The other members of this group work in a variety of businesses including: selling sewing supplies, raising animals, selling flowers and making candles.  They are all hoping to improve and grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy material for making jackets

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Fidel, reside  en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos de 28 y 26 años de edad, todos trabajan. Su negocio inicio por sus propios medios, sus hijos le ayudan, no tiene un horario fijo para atender las tareas, y poseen experiencia en la administración del negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar leche, ya que es el material principal para la elaboración de los productos, ayudándole a fortalecer  el negocio.
Su aspiración es montar un negocio grande, con mucha capacidad para atender a la clientela y ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel lives in Santa Elena, Usulután Department.  He sells dairy products.  He lives with his family: his wife and two children who are 28 and 26 years old.  Everyone works.

He started his business with his own resources.  His children help him and he does not have a fixed schedule to see to tasks.  They have experience administering the business.

He is asking for a loan to buy milk since it’s the main ingredient to make his products.  This will help him strengthen the business.  His goal is to establish a large business with lots of capacity for customer service and to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy milk to make dairy products.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a son. She worked at a factory but was later downsized and forced to find new ways of providing for her family. Presently, Yelena is a small-scale entrepreneur from Pershotravensk. Yelena sells lingerie in a local market called Yuzhnyi. She owns a nice enclosed vending facility in a busy part of the market. Yelena has been in this business for six years. Her monthly income is over 14,000 Grivnyas.   

Yelena is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify her assortment and purchase a variety of swimsuits for the upcoming vacation season in Ukraine. A nice selection of swimsuits at affordable prices and of good quality will boost her sales, bringing stable income to the family. Yelena is planning to add a display stand for this new type of merchandise. One of her future plans is to open a second vending location.

loans.use: to purchase assorted swimsuits for the upcoming summer season.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 23 years old. She is married and has one child who is two years old. She sells drinks and food. She has four years of experience and her business starts from 8 am to 9 pm every day per week. She currently employs three people to help her.

Marie Grace has requested a loans from Kiva lender in order to expand her business. The loan will be used towards buying more and new equipment for her pub such as: chairs, tableware, etc. With any profits, she will save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more, new equipment for her pub such as: chairs, tableware, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 24 años reside en el caserío de Llanco. Ahí formó su familia junto a Ana, su esposa desde hace 3 años. Ambos tienen una hija: Kiarali de 2 años de edad y juntos cuidan de ella en su casa propia. El trabajo de este gran hombre es variado; desde niño se dedicó a la agricultura, principal sustento para su familia, en la que lleva 9 años sembrando arveja y papa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es el respeto que recibe de entre los demás agricultores; ya que comenzó desde muy joven en el negocio. Además recibe el apoyo de su esposa, quien cría chanchos, vacas y toros, que enseba y vende a un buen precio; “somos un gran equipo”, afirma Luis con mucho orgullo. A la vez menciona que; los días viernes, sábado y domingo, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de verduras en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Pichanaki (selva central peruana). Desde entonces le va muy bien ya que no existen esos productos en el lugar. Para el futuro desea juntar dinero para poder construir una mejor casa y comprarse una moto para incursionar en el trasporte público. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Luis de recibir su apoyo, invertirá la mitad del dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa; asimismo desea comprar verduras para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Luis is 24 and lives in the town of Llanco. He has been married to Ana for 3 years, and they have one daughter, Kiarali, who is 2.  The family lives together in their own house. Luis is very hard-working; he has worked in agriculture since he was a child, and this is his household's principal source of income.  He has been growing peas and potatoes for the last 9 years.  Luis enjoys the solidarity among local farmers.  Ana helps Luis to raise pigs, cows and bulls, which fetch good market prices.  Luis proudly notes that “we make a great team.”  On weekends, Luis also sells produce in markets of Pichanaki (in the central Peruvian Amazon); sales are brisk in this very remote region.  Luis plans to make future housing improvements and to buy a motorcycle for transport.  He is a member of the communal lender “Los ángeles de Llanco” and this is his third credit with MFP, where he is very grateful for the lender's support and pleased to have financial access to grow his business. He is committed to prompt repayment, consistent with his prior track record. Luis plans to invest half the credit to buy crop seed, sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato fields; he will also buy other vegetables for his business.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds, fertilizer; and vegetables for his business

loans.name: Petrus

texts.en:
Petrus is a 54-year-old farmer.  He is married to Bendelina, who is 51 years old. They are blessed with seven children, four of them are working and three have graduated from senior high school but do not yet have jobs. 

Petrus owns a plot of land where he plants rice. He has been working as a farmer since he was young, as he was born into a farming family. Petrus is a keen farmer, he usually starts his activity early in the morning. After harvesting his rice crops, Petrus then utilizes the empty rice field to cultivate corn, kangkung (a leafy vegetable), tomatoes, chilies, mustard greens, etc. 

According to Petrus, latterly his harvest has not been good due to the lack of fertilizer.  This, of course, has an impact on his income. Therefore, he would like to seek capital to start a pig breeding business.  He plans to spend the loan on 2 piglets, fodder and a sack of fertilizer.  

Petrus has submitted a loan application to TLM to request a loan of IDR 10,000,000. He is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application for his business improvement.

loans.use: To purchase 2 piglets, fodder and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married with four children aged 5 to 15. She sells fish, a business she has been operating for the last ten years. She has managed to hire five employees. Beatrice intends to use her loan to increase her stock of fish. She hopes to expand her business and start selling fish all over the country. Beatrice describes herself as confident and social.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Elisabeth y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 30 años edad y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la venta de productos de belleza”. Ella va ser mama por primera vez  y tiene 9 meses de embarazo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos.
texts.en:
(Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convención Province and an important commercial hub of the Lares and La Convención Valleys.  The main activities are coca leaf, coffee, cocoa bean and fruit production.)

We visited the “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” (Brave Hearts of San Juan Moor) in the city of Quillabamba and met its member, Elisabeth, there.  She tells us:

“I was born in the city of Quillabamba.  I’m 30 years old and live in the same city where I was born.  My main activity is selling beauty products.” 

She is going to be a mother for the first time; she is nine months pregnant.  

On this opportunity she needs the loan to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Adina Esperanza

texts.es:
Adina, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, es casada, administra una tienda donD. ofrece artículos D. toda necesidad, este negocio se dio gracias a su propia iniciativa, lo instalo en su vivienda y lo atienD. personalmente a tiempo completo.
Ella, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. artículos D. primera necesidad como queso, crema, cuajada y más mercadería, esta compra le permite ampliar el negocio y ofrecer más mercadería a sus clientes. 
Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio para recibir mayores ingresos, además ganar experiencia con el comercio para mejorar su negocio cada vez más.
texts.en:
Adina lives with her husband and two children. She is married and  manages a shop where she sells all kinds of basic items. This business came about thanks to her own initiative. She installed it in her own living quarters and provides full-time customer service, herself. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase basic staples such as cheese, cream, curdled milk cheese and other merchandise. This purchase will allow her to expand the business and offer more merchandise to her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to expand the business in order to obtain more income, as well as to gain more experience in the enterprise so she may improve her business more and more.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, cream, curdled milk cheese, beans and rice for the business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda owns a small sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house in the village where she lives together with her family. She had been managing it for two years. Allowances for her three children rely on her daily profit from the store. As of now, items in the store are already sold out. She needs to replenish it as soon as possible to get the attention of her neighborhood who might need a sachet of shampoo or instant noodles. So she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy soap, shampoo, instant noodles, canned goods, breads and eggs to sell in her sari-sari store and keep making better sales.

Melinda wants to stock more grocery items in her store for continuous sales and profits. In this way, she could save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, instant noodles, canned goods, breads and eggs to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ambar Isayanet

texts.es:
Ámbar, vive con su esposo y un hijo, alquilan vivienda, y se dedica a la venta de pupusas y administra una pequeña tienda, la pupuseria tiene 3 meses de existir pero la tienda lleva 3 años, con estos negocio se mantiene y ayuda a su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ella invertirá un préstamo en la compra de mercadería, boquitas, gaseosas, aceite, arroz, frijoles, para la tienda y chicharrón, quesillo, para las pupusas, con esta mercadería podrá continuar en el negocio y apoyar a su familia, más que todo a su hijo quien debe estudiar y prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Ámbar lives with her husband and son in a rental house.  She has a business selling pupusas and also runs a small store.  Her pupuseria is three months old but she has had her store for three years.  Through these businesses, she supports herself and helps her husband cover their household expenses.

Ámbar will invest her loan in buying merchandise: snacks, soda, oil, rice and beans for her store and 'chicharrón' (pork rinds) and soft cheese for her pupusas.  This merchandise will enable her to continue working in her business and support her family.  More than anything, she wants her son to study and prepare himself for the future.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soda, oil, rice and beans for her business

loans.name: Ahmad
