texts.en: Ahmad is a 24-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop since 2009. His job consists of painting and repainting the cars. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase required tools and materials. He hopes that with the new equipment he will be able to meet his business needs and attract customers. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his shop and start repairing cars from the inside and the outside.

loans.use: to purchase required tools and materials

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, aged 43, is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Angelito, a driver, and is mother to their four children. The eldest is already working. Two are in college while the youngest is still in high school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually proviD. income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. AsiD. from this she also offers direct selling products to her customers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann hopes her business will grow more in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Arriza

texts.en:
Arriza is 40 years old, married, and has seven children.

Arriza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her store.

She has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for a year and also earns an income from fish vending (selling).

Arriza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Erlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos e todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.


É comerciante ha mais de 5 anos vende produtos diversos , e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).

Ja teve emprestimo noutros bancos (TCHUMA) e concluiu o pagamento sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos diversos ( sumos, arroz, oleo, peixe, batatas, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende comprar um carro para reforçar no escoamento do produto, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed 10th grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been in retail for over five years. She sells various kinds of goods and earns an income of about 7.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and finished repaying without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 20.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase various goods (juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.) in order to increase the amount of her merchandise.
She is committed to repaying according to the schedule. In the future she intends to purchase a car to bolster the sales of her merchandise. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.).

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 54-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Nena is peddling clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of clothing for selling.

Nena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing for selling.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Rómulo de 54 años es un hombre casado. Hace 30 años que comparte su vida con Ambrosia, con quien tiene  8 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de 16 años. Esta familia vive en el distrito de Palcamayo. Rómulo es un hombre emprendedor, inició con poco y gracias a su esfuerzo, dedicación ha salido adelante. 
Una de sus actividades es la agricultura. Cultiva papas en grandes cantidades. Ahora cuenta con una producción de 20 sacos para la cosecha de mayo, de la cual augura buenos ingresos. Así también se dedica a la venta de carne de carnero, todos los viernes viaja para Chanchamayo donde tiene un puesto de venta. Los jueves y domingos expende las carnes en el mercado de Tarma.  “Compro 15 animales por cada feria y viajo constantemente para la selva central, ahí el kilo de carne es más caro y solicitado. Estaré ganando 30 soles por ganado aproximadamente”, explica. Además, cuenta con un puesto de artesanías en el distrito de Palca donde ofrece: sábanas, pañolones, pañuelos, etc. Pero considera, que la venta de carne es la más rentable, por ello en sus planes futuros está abrir mas puestos de venta en la ciudad de San Ramón y otros 2 en Tarma. Sería el préstamo número 15 el que obtendrá de MFP y será puntual en el pago de las cuotas como lo fue en los ciclos anteriores. Comenta sentirse más que agradecido con el sistema de trabajo de su banco comunal.
De recibir el dinero, podrá comprar carneros flacos y pequeños, los que engordará para su negocio de carnes.
texts.en:
Rómulo, 54, is married and has lived with his wife Ambrosia for 30 years.  They have eight children but only the youngest, 16, still lives at home.  This family lives in the district of Palcamayo.  Rómulo is an entrepreneur who began with very little but thanks to his effort and dedication has been able to get ahead.

One of his activities is agriculture.  He grows large volumes of potatoes.  He now has 20 sacks in production for the harvest in May which will bring a good income.  He also sells lamb meat every Friday when he travels to Chanchamayo where he has a sales stall.  On Thursday and Sunday he sells meat at the market in Tarma.  "I buy 15 animals at each fair and I travel constantly in the central forest, where a kilo of meat is in higher demand and commands a higher price.  I will earn approximately 30 PEN per animal", he explains.  He also has an artisan craft stall in the district of Palca where he sells sheets, shawls, scarves, etc.  He believes selling meat is the most profitable business, so he wants to open more sales points in the city of San Ramón and another two in Tarma, sometime in the future.  This is his 15th loan through MFP, where he is committed to paying back the loan on time as he has with previous ones.  He is very grateful for his communal bank's working system.

He plans to use the loan to buy small, thin sheep so he can fatten them for his meat business.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 56 years old and has 10 children between ages 21 and 32. She is a widow. She sells foodstuffs and vegetables in a store she has run for the last 12 years. 

Athanasie would like a loan to buy different types of foodstuffs. She would love to run a very large store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret 48, is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale stall for vegetables in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI” iniciará su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Antonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: punto viva, venta de utensilios de limpieza, centro de llamadas, carnicería, tienda, venta de detergentes, venta de abarrotes.

La señora Antonia,  indica que es el tercer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su hija. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de conservas) que comprara de la Ceja, de las mayoristas  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y los intereses.
texts.en:
The comunal bank "SARTASIÑANI" is beginning its sixth cycle in the Pro Mujer program at the Collpani social center.  The group is comprised of nine members and its board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Antonia.  The members of the group run different businesses, among which are: cell phone sales, cleaning utensils sales, telephone calling service, butcher, store, detergent sales and grocery sales.  

Mrs. Antonia has participated in Pro Mujer for three years and joined the institution by invitation from her daughter.  Currently she runs a neighborhood store that she began several years ago, having learned the trade from her mother.

The loan she has requested is to increase her working capital to buy canned goods from wholesale dealers at La Ceja.  She will then sell them at her store.  This will allow her to generate more income to support her family.  She is married and has six children.

When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer, she says it is the savings and interest rate.

loans.use: To buy canned goods.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 24 years old.  He is married and the father of one daughter.  He earns a decent salary as a partner in a DJ business for weddings and other occasions.  In addition, he has raised sheep for the past four years, selling their products to help him increase his income and provide better living conditions for his family. 

Khaled wants to purchase more sheep and install a new sheepfold, or enclosure, and is requesting a loan from FATEN in the amount of $2,000 to cover the expenses.  When Khaled receives the loan, he will purchase more sheep and install the sheepfold.  He hopes this will increase his sales of sheep products and so increase his income, which will enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.  Khaled is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and install a sheepfold.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ablaye, un homme de 40 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants dont les deux sont scolarisés. Il s’active dans le commerce depuis 1994. Quand il avait du temps libre, il s’approchait de son père et l’aider dans la vente. Et c’est finalement après qu’il a pu faire son propre commerce et a acquis une boutique. Il travaille de 6h du matin à minuit.  Il vient pour la 4ème fois  solliciter un crédit de 600000F CFA afin de pouvoir acheter pour revendre des denrées alimentaires et des céréales (niébé, mil…).
 Ablaye vit toujours avec ses parents et c’est son père qui gère la dépense quotidienne. Lui ne participe que quand sa femme est là, par contre, il appuie ses sœurs qui sont dans la maison et qui n’ont pas de sources de revenus. Grâce au crédit, il peut  désormais mettre de l’argent de coté. Comme projet futur, il aimerait faire de l’import-export.

loans.use: acheter des denrées alimentaires et des céréales pour alimenter sa boutique et revendre

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Fazilat to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 44 years old, married woman doing business  with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: CHARLES K. lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam. He is 55 years old and married with four children. Charles is a retired civil servant. He owns a bar and guest house near a bus terminal with buses to the southern regions of Tanzania. His business is well situated. The guest house is usually filled with customers who spend a night before they get on the buses the next day. The house has a section used as a bar where guests can have different kinds of drinks. He built this guest house from retirement benefits accrued to him for the years he served as a civil servant. He employs six people in his business. He himself keeps the finances, while his wife takes care of daily operations. The business is the sole income generating unit for the family. He wants to improve the business by adding enough sitting chairs, tables, bedsheets, and curtains. He also wants to buy a storage tank for reserving water in case of irregular public water supply. To implement his plan, Charles is in need of $1000.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, bedsheets, and curtains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Simiton wants to buy beads, belts, bags and other materials, which act as base material where beads are attached.

loans.name: Barshad

texts.en:
Barshad is 52 and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Fizuli region He and his family are settled in Fizuli region, Akhmedbeyli village. Barshad opened his own general store 4 years ago to support his family. 
Now Barshad needs a loan of US$725 to buy scales and foodstuffs.

loans.use: Purchase of scales and foodstuffs

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin H. is a 24-year-old farmer. He is an internally displaced person from the Jabrail region, who fled to the Bilasuvar area in 1993 during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. Bilasuvar is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan, and Elchin lives there with his parents and grandmother.

He started helping his father in 2004, but later when his father fell ill, young Elchin took over the responsibility for tending their animals. Elchin`s family started their business buying one cow and a calf with money they borrowed from their friends and some money they had been able to save up.

Later, they borrowed US$ 700 from Aqroinvest CU and purchased one milk cow. Elchin repaid all his debts and his farm micro-business is going very well. But because of his father's illness, the money he gets from selling milk products is not enough to improve living conditions for their cattle. Winter is very close and Elchin has applied for a loan of US$ 1200 to build a small shed. He will build the shed himself, because this amount is enough only for purchasing building materials.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to construct a shed for his cattle

loans.name: Felícita Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a 50-year-old woman. At her age, she is very cheerful and her ways win even the hardest heart. This trait has enabled her to relate well to the people she encounters in her world as well as to her 52-year-old husband and two children. The children are currently working to forge a better future in a technical school in the city.

Thanks to the commitment she has to her work and to the daily dedication that she devotes to her store, her children are able to study without trouble. For a long time, she pledged herself to working hard to form a base standard of living. Nevertheless, her continual headaches cause her terrible pain, which is why she had to shut herself insiD. and stop working for a long period. This event caused a great decline in her home and her store; now she has decided to take up her work one more time, and she is very optimistic and the prospect of recovering the high acceptance she had with her customers. That's why she needs $450 to start up her and make her shop one of the best. With your contribution, Sabina will have the ability to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina es una señora D. 50 años a su edad es muy jovial y con su forma D. ser muy particular pueD. ganarse hasta a la persona más recia, esta característica le ha permitido tener muy buenas relaciones con las personas que se encuentran en su entorno y más que nada con su esposo D. 52 años y sus 2 hijos, los cuales ahora ocupan su tiempo para forjarse un futuro mejor en la escuela técnica D. su ciudad.

Gracias al compromiso que tiene con su trabajo y a la dedicación diaria que le otorga a su bodega sus hijos pueden estudiar sin ninguna dificultad, durante mucho tiempo se empeñó a consolidar en base a mucho esfuerzo un nivel D. vida adecuado para su familia.Sin embargo sus continuas dolencias cerebrales le ocasionaron un terrible derrame, motivo por el cual tuvo que internarse y dejar todas sus actividades por un largo período.Este acontecimiento ocasionó grandes declives en su hogar y bodega, hoy a decidido emprender su labor una vez más y se muestra optimista con el propósito D. recuperar la gran acogida que tuvo con sus clientes.Por esta razón requiere D. 450 dólares para iniciar la implementación D. su negocio y hacer D. su bodega una D. las mejores. Con su contribución Sabina tendrá aun más fuerzas para seguir trabajando

loans.use: To stock the store with must-have items

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida is single with two children, who are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. She started her business 7 years ago after having worked as a secretary in the general secretaria of the FSLN (Sandinista National Liberation Front, the political party currently in power in Nicaragua).

Brigida has been working with CEPRODEL for about 3 years and has a record of 13 loans. She has undoubtedly put forward a lot of effort for her children and her business. She began the business with $25 in capital selling clothing in the streets until she found a site (a plot of land in the open air) where she set up her business. She has continued to improve the site in order to offer a wider variety of clothing and better security to her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Brigida es soltera con dos hijos, razon por la que lucha dia a dia. Comienza su negocio hace 7 años despues de haber rabajado como secretaria en la Secretaría del FSLN.

Con CEPRODEL Brigida tiene de trabajar alrededor de 3 años con un record de 13 creditos. Indudablemente se ha esforzado mucho por sus hijos y por llevar hacia adelante su negocio. Ella comenzo con un capital de US$25.00 vendiendo ropa de manera ambulante hasta encontrar un local (terreno al aire libre) donde se posiciono. A la fecha ella ha ido acondicionando el local para asi ofrecer mas variedad de ropa con mayor seguridad para su clientela.

loans.use: Buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.en: Jumaboi K. lives in Mastchokh and he is married with seven children. Jumaboi K. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and his loan sums are permanently increased which shows his business's stability and development. He has a wide-side business including the meat and milk production and its work out. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and a cow for further meat and milk and sour milk goods production (its supply to the bazaars and the family is secure by the meat and milk-sour products). He plans to include in the assortment the following milk and sour products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr. K. requires a loan in 2000 STJ for a pedigree bull and a milk cow that will allow him to significantly increase the family's income and will permit him to plan further business and a wider assortment of goods.

loans.use: Jumaboi would like to purchase a pedigree bull and a milk cow.

loans.name: Carlixta

texts.en:
Carlixta is an arduous and hard-working woman who owns and operates a general store which she started eight years ago in Chácaro, in the community of Yamasá. She is a 46 year-old single mother of four children.

Carlixta sells a variety of products in her store, specializing in the selling of fuel and parts for motorcycles. She also retails motor oil, fuel additives and so forth. She operates that activity in a small rented local.

Carlixta is currently looking for funds in order to expand her business. Her expansion plan includes adding new products to her actual inventory and renting a more spacious locale to operate the business. Carlixta thinks her business’ achievement will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy goods to replenish a small motorcycles and accesories shop.

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Fumi O. is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. She hails from Okoko in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a photographer and also covers ceremonies (video coverage). She needs a loan of $450 to buy an additional video camera. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy an additional video camera for her business

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mrs. Meng K., 55, is a mother of ten children. She works growing a variety of vegetables and earns around $4 a day of income. Her husband is a teacher in the village with a salary of $45 a month. Three of her children are married and live away from home. One daughter works in a garment factory and another one sells groceries.

Mrs. Meng K. wants to use a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizers and petroleum and more grocery inventory for her daughter. (Mrs. Meng K., wearing the black shirt, is pictured with her neighbor and her husband sitting behind.)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and petroleum and more grocery inventory for her daughter.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 40 years old and is married with five children, ages 7 to 20. Rehema is a clothes and cosmetics seller. She began this business in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

In the past, Rehema has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetics items for her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.id:
Omar works as a scavenger. It is not a hygienic job since it deals with garbage. But he works really hard. He travels with his cart around Monang-Maning Denpasar everyday to collect and buy used items to be resold later. Used boxes, cans and newspapers are items he typically buy. After collecting goods all day, he returns to his rented house at Jl.Resimuka Barat to sort and weigh them. This time he is asking for loan for additional working capital..

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha yang digeluti sehari-hari oleh Omar adalah sebagai pemulung atau pengumpul barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan. Pekerjaan ini memang sangat tidak sehat, karena berhubungan dengan sampah. Tetapi dia sangat ulet dan bertahan dengan usahanya saat ini. Setiap hari dia berkeliling dengan gerobaknya di seputaran Monang-Maning Denpasar untuk mencari dan membeli barang bekas yang nantinya akan dijual lagi. Kardus, kaleng bekas dan koran adalah barang yang biasa dia beli. Setelah seharian mengumpulkan barang rongsokan, sore harinya dia kembali kerumah sewanya di Jl.Resimuka Barat untuk memilah dan menimbang barang-barang hasilnya selama sehari. Kali ini dia mengajukan pinjaman untuk dijadikan modal tambahan dalam menunjang usahanya.

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi H. is 31 years old. She has 2 children who are still going to school. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to take loans to invest in breeding animals and retailing. Besides breeding pigs, Mrs. H. also buys fruit from retailers and sell it at her house. She earns about 125 USD per month from selling fruit. Not only that, her family also earns some extra income from transporting construction materials by Mrs. H.'s husband's boat. For this loan cycle, Mrs. H. has discussed with her husband. She wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more fruit, expand her store and rebuild her farm. Mrs. H.'s family income is about 188 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Hà năm nay 31 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Năm 2003 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi, buôn bán. Ngoài việc chăn nuôi lợn, hàng ngày chị đi lấy hoa qủa từ các đại lý về bán lẻ tại nhà cho thu nhập 2.000.000/ tháng. Ngoài thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi buôn bán của chị, gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ việc chở vật liệu thuê bằng thuyền của chồng chị .Vòng vốn này chị đã bàn bạc với chồng và muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn mua hoa quả, mở rộng quy mô kinh doanh và sửa sang chuồng trại để chăn nuôi. Thu nhập của gia đình : 3.000.000/ tháng

loans.use: Feed Pigs

loans.name: Thi An

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi An is the owner of a general store. She is 45 years old and has been a member of the TYM Fund for 5 years. She has 6 children, 2 of whom are adults. Previously, her family's income came mainly from agriculture. After joining the Fund, she decided to invest in a general store. At first, she only had a small store with limited goods as she was new in the business. However, until now, she has expanded her store and added in a wide variety of goods to satisfy the local people's demand. Together with her family's income from agriculture, the income from the general store has improved her family's economy. This time, she would like to borrow 16,000,000VND (975USD) to invest in her general store. Her monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 190USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị An hiện là chủ cửa hàng tạp hoá. Chị An năm nay 45 tuổi và đã là thành viên của quỹ tình thương được 5 năm.Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó có 2 người con đã trưởng thành.Thu nhập của gia đình trước đây chủ yếu là do làm nông nghiệp. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để tăng thêm tthu nhập cho gia đình chị đã quyết định đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Lúc đầu do mới làm quen với công việc buôn bán chị chỉ buôn bán nhỏ với một số ít mặt hàng. Đến nay gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng với rất nhiều mặt hàng phục vụ nhu cầu rất đa dạng của người dân địa phương. Cùng với thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và nguồn thu ổn định từ cửa hàng tạp hoá kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 16.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàng tạp hoá Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in general store

loans.name: Douy

texts.en:
Douy L., age 39, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been growing cucumbers and selling them in the market since 1985. On average, she makes around $1 of profit each day. Her husband Duong Dam, age 43, earns a living as a rice farmer and is able to earn about $2 each day. This couple has four children together.

Mrs. Douy L. would like to loan from Kiva to raise ducks for extra profit.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: Mrs. Douy Lot would like to loan from Kiva to raise ducks for extra profit.

loans.name: Halil

texts.ru: Халил житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается торговлей. Продает овощи и фрукты. Имеет торговую точку на продуктовом рынке района. Занимается этим бизнесом уже пятьб лет. Планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и получить дополнительную прибыль для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Halil lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi district. He is married and has six children. He has a business selling fruits and vegetables from his stall in the district's produce market. He has been in this business for five years. He decided to obtain a loan to increase his variety of goods. This will help attract new customers and bring additional income to his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Mirko

texts.es: Mirko es un joven que gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres pudo concluir sus estudios superiores de pedagogía, pero las diversas circunstancias le permitieron ejercer su carrera, sin embargo no pierde  la esperanza de pronto ser un maestro ejemplar.  Mientras tanto, trabaja como agricultor en sus hectáreas de terreno, cultiva frutos cítricos y plátanos, por las tardes trabaja con su motocarro haciendo transporte de pasajeros, para así incrementar los ingresos en su hogar, y apoyar a sus padres, ya que es el último  hijos y el único que vive con ellos.  Ahora desea incrementar sus ingresos y pronto ejercer su carrera para tener mayores posibilidades de crecer personalmente como profesional  y ayudar a sus padres, el monto que  requiere  es de 600 soles, para incrementar su producción agrícola, espera que usted pueda ayudarlo a realizar sus deseos prontamente.
texts.en:
Mirko is a young man who thanks to the hard work of his parents was able to complete his higher-education, but various circumstances didn't allow him to carry out his carry. Nevertheless, he never lost hope of soon being an exemplary teacher. Meanwhile, he works as a farmer on his hectares of land, cultivating citrus fruit and bananas, and in the afternoons uses his automobile as a taxi to earn extra income for his household and support his parents. He is their youngest child and the only one who lives with them. Now he wishes to increase his income and soon start his career to expand the possibilities of growing as a professional and helping his family. At the moment, he's requesting 600 soles to increase his agricultural production. He hopes you will help him realize his dreams soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase agricultural production

loans.name: Deurng

texts.en: Deurng P. is 32 is married and is a mother of five children. Two of her children are construction workers, two are in school, and the youngest one is two years old. She and her husband, Pho Siev, live in the Tasoam Village in Takeo Province. Deurng is a farmer who earns a minimal revenue from her small plot of land. Even though Deurng and her husband have different businesses, their household is in poor condition and the house they live in is in bad condition. Deurng is asking for a loan to help build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Khursheed Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is a 33-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 16 years. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her kids are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Khursheed baji’s husband's name is N. A., and he has an animal selling business with experience of 15 years. He specifically sells goats and cows. Khursheed baji is a seamstress and has been stitching clothes for 15 years. She charges $2 per dress. She adopted this profession to support her husband to meet the household expenses. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more animals for her husband’s animal selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few women in her locality. Rubina baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zahooran baji and Hajran baji each want a loan to buy animals (goats) for their animal selling business. baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal selling business

loans.name: Pheoun

texts.en: Mr. Pheoun P. was born in 1954 and he now lives in Chrok Rumdeng village in Kampong Cham province. He is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then to re-sell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy more rice to keep in stock. His wife, Mrs. Hoeng Sara, is a housewife who cooks  delicious food for the family. Mr. Pheoun P. has two children who are attending the local school. His wife and a child appear with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
Faizullo A. applied first to MicroInvest in 2006 when his brother was able to improve his existing business thanks to a MicroInvest loan. Faizullo lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and he is married. Since his early years, Faizullo saw how his father took care of animals and helped him do this work. Faizullo attended higher education and worked as an economist in a car park. Four years ago, he decided to purchase a milk cow for his wife and since that moment he started the livestock business.

Today he has one milk cow and five sheep. The livestock business brings in general family income for Faizullo. His wife makes and sells milk products. Faizullo is asking KIVA for a business development loan of 3200 STJ for 10 months to buy a pedigreed bull that will permit him to increase the number of his livestock and thus the family income. He thanks KIVA for its support and invites all to come and see his farm.

loans.use: for purchasing a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 38 years old. She is a widow with three children and is saddled with the responsibility of taking care of her children alone. Rose has been in the business of selling provisions and clothes for the past 11 years. She now requires a loan for N100,000 to purchase more merchandise to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and clothes to sell

loans.name: Muzambil

texts.ru: Бизнес Музамбил продолжает развиваться. Получив свой первый займ с КИВА Музамбил довольно заметно развила свой бизнес. Ее муж (на фото) по прежнему продолжает помогать ей в ее торговле. Сейчас наступает сезон весенней одежды поэтому Музамбил решила подать заявку на очередной займ.
texts.en:
Muzambil's business keeps growing. When Muzambil received her first loan from Kiva she has noticeably developed her business. Her husband (on the photo) still helps her with her sales. Right now is the season for spring clothing and this is why Muzambil decided to apply for another loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a spring assortment of clothing

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca López tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Francisca es la venta de mercadería en general como calzado, ropa para damas, niños y caballeros y cosméticos además en su casa de habitación ofrece los productos de refrescos naturales y pan. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que Doña Juana no poseía ingresos y por medio de la venta de estos productos es que ha logrado salir adelante. Los propósitos de Doña Juana son de son de invertir cada día en su negocio. Es por eso que Doña Francisca recurre a Fundación León 2000 para solicitar un financiamiento que sea destinado a capital de trabajo y así comprar pinturas de labios, perfumes, cremas y frutas para la elaboración de los refrescos. Sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que tiene que dejarles a sus hijos un buen lugar donde vivir. La cantidad que solicita es de C$6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca López is 58 years old and single. Juana sells general merchandise like shoes, women’s and children’s clothes, and cosmetics. Also, she sells natural drinks and bread from her home. She has done this for the last 10 years. Juana did not have any income, and through the sale of these products she has been able to get ahead. Juana plans to invest in her business everyday. That is why Juana turns to Fundación León 2000 to ask for a loan for working capital. She will buy lipsticks, perfumes, and cream and fruit to make the drinks. Her desire is to improve her home. She feels that she needs to give her children a good place to live. She is asking for $300 (6000 NIO).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wassiatou

texts.fr:
T. Wassiatou est agée de 33 ans et est originaire de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Wassiatou est  mariée à OKPEICHA Ibrahim, vendeur également des produits de quincaillerie. Wassiatou vend des produits de quincaillerie tel que les boîtes de colles forte, des clous, des marteaux, des vernis au carrefour le berlier à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Wassiatou a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé et avec lesquels elle a pu hisser son commerce au niveau où il est aujourd'hui. Les moyens financiers de Wassiatou ne lui permettent pas de bien répondre à la demande de ses clients. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et pouvoir acheter les autres articles que lui demande ses clients, Wassiatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Wassiatou, age 33, traces her roots to Ouémé in southern Benin. She is married to OKPEICHA Ibrahim, who is also a seller of hardware like Wassiatou, who offers merchandise such as cans of strong adhesives, nails, hammers, and varnish at the Berlier crossroads in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has had three loans with Alidé that she has repaid. With those loans, she was able to raise her business to the level at which it is today. Her funds prevents her from responding well to the demands of her customers. To boost her working capital and to buy other goods her customers demand, Wassiatou is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hardware products and a barrel of varnish

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is a trader. She sells food items such as rice, etc. and vegetables on a tabletop and in a kiosk at her home. She procures bags of rice, vegetables and other ingredients from nearby wholesale shops.

Kate is 45-years old. She is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a farmer. All her children are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kate works to help her husband provide for the family.

Kate has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hoping to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and food items

loans.name: Anayatan Nawab Hussain Group

texts.en:
Rani baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Sajida baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Veeru begum baji wants a loan to buy mason’s tools.

Anayatan baji is the wife of N. H. who has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past ten years. She is the group leader of these ladies. She is a very responsible and a very hardworking lady. She is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband because his old cart has become rough and rotted, which is effecting his work.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of staple goods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia S. H. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Cecilia S. sells used clothing at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1995. Her husband is a trader. 

Cecilia S. uses her income to pay for school fees for the children, clothing, utility bills and other family expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more used clothing for resale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Cecilia S. plans to support her husband in saving towards a house they want to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de la Paz, trabaja en un imprenta, con este trabajo el mantiene a su familia pero no le alcanza para pagar los estudios de sus hijos motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo para poder pagarlo poco a poco y de esta manera pagar la educación de sus hijos.

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pagó muy bien, puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Guillermo lives in his own house with his wife and children on 4 de Mayo (4th of May) Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area of the city of La Paz. He works at a printer’s press, and with this work he supports his family, but he is not able to pay for the studies of his children. Motivated by this, he is asking for a loan to be able to pay little by little and in this way pay for the education of his children.

He is already a client of Impro and has paid reliably, and can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition for his children

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: magatte F. habite camberene et evolue dans le commerce de tissus depuis 1993.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis plus de sept ans.elle sollicite un pret de cent cinquante mille(150 000)pour accroitre le niveau de son activite et mieux la rentabiliser dans le but de soutenir son mari a entretenir leur famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Tuitamaga

texts.en:
Tuitamaga L.  lives in the town of Satufia Satupaitea.  She is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Tuitamaga owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Tuitamaga has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Tuitamaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuitamaga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to diversify her product offerings. Tuitamaga is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by her from SPBD. Tuitamaga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the Lord of Cachuy village bank. 
She is 75 years-old, married, and has eight children. She has a 53 year-old that got meningitis when he was a kid which impaired him so that he was not able to study. 
Jacinta is from Junin and arrived in Lima when she was 13 years ago and started to work during the day and went to school in the evenings until she got married and decided to take care of her eight children. Over the years her children matured and got married, but the household economy got worse. Twelve years ago she decided to work selling clothes and now she has her own stand where she sells clothes. 
FINCA Peru gave her the opportunity to develop and thanks to the loans she is able to buy a variety of clothes, which allows her to have more sales.   
Jacinta needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy clothes such as sweaters, jackets, and wool clothes because it is still cold in Lima. Her dream is that her business grows since she wants to continue to work.

loans.use: buy clothes such as sweaters, jackets, and wool clothes because it is still cold in Lima

loans.name: Suk

texts.en: Suk W., 49, pictured here with her granddaughter, is married and lives in the Takeo province with her three children. One of her children is married but still lives with her. Suk works as a farmer and is able to make US$1 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, as food prices have also been high. Her husband is a construction worker building houses and typically makes US$3 every day. She has seen an opportunity to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to raise ducks and chickens for eggs.

loans.use: To raise chickens for eggs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Evelyn is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from a variety store business and having a retail gasoline station as an additional investment. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
La señora  SANDRA MARGARITA C. A. tiene 30 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to  de secundaria,  refiere que no continuó estudios superiores porque se caso muy joven. tiene 4 hijo quienes  depende económicamente de ella porque se encuentran estudiando. La socia se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas en su casa y con su crédito de  300 nuevos soles compró cajas de gaseosas y cervezas  al por mayor para vender.
Con este crédito de  500.00 nuevos soles también lo utilizara para comprar cajas de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor para así obtener mayores ganancias.
SANDRA sueña con tener un bar/restaurante en su casa para poder obtener mayores ganancias y poder facilitarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Margarita C. A., 30, lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Communal Bank San Borja. She completed studies up to the 5th grade of secondary school but didn't continue to higher studies because she got married very young. She has four children who depend on her as they are studying. Sandra works selling soft drinks and beers from her house and with a previous loan of 300 new soles she bought boxes of soft drinks and beers to sell more.

With this loan of 500 new soles, she will also buy boxes of soft drinks and beers to obtain greater profits. Sandra dreams of having a bar/restaurant in her house to be able to make more income and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soft drinks and beers to sell more

loans.name: Faauiga

texts.en:
Faauiga S. is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is widowed and has 2 children. To make a living, Faauiga owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Faauiga has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Faauiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faauiga is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Faauiga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang S., 45, is married with five children. He resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with his wife (in photo) and children. To make a living, he and his wife are engaged in the agriculture sector of growing morning glories (a kind of vegetable), earning collectively an income of US $19 per day. This source of income from S. and his wife helps cover the family expenses especially for the children’s education in the future. The family is also assisted by one of the children who works as a chef at a restaurant. S. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport morning glories to sell at the markets.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer to transport morning glories for sale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena V. is from the village of Calamagui San Pablo, Isabela. She is 27 years old. Rowena is married and has two infant children. 

Rowena owns a business in which she raises pigs for sale. Rowena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa). She is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She owns a grocery stall where she sells drinks and groceries like sugar, noodles, bread, milk, butter, soaps, and detergent. She hopes to move from the level of a retailer to a wholesaler. She needs a loan amount of NGN 30,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Fenena

texts.en:
Fenena A.  is a 57-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Galecia, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish, vegetables and spices.

Fenena’s husband Roberto helps run the business. They have 6 adult age children.  Some of them work and help support the family.  Fenena and her husband Roberto want to save enough to provide for themselves when they are too old to continue working for their own living.

Fenena A. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994.  With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by selling fish, vegetables and spices. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 45,000.

Fenena is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to operate her fish, vegetables and spice business, and it had a positive impact on her business and the family.  Now she is borrowing her 13th loan, the amount of Php 50,000 to stock up on bigger volumes of fish, vegetable and spices to sell for higher profita.  Fenena is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
----------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Buy fish, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 47-year-old married man with 8 children, 5 of whom are still unemployed. He has been working as a painter since 1999. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. He works on a freelance basis upon client request due to his good business reputation. Today, Mostafa is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy new painting tools and supplies to satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.use: new painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta R. is from the village of Paridel, in Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector as a fish vendor. The main source of income for the business comes from peddling a variety of seafood products like fish, shrimp, crab and others in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Violeta’s 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Villa Jose Domingo Group

texts.es:
Todas ellas son vecinas del barrio donD. comparten en las reuniones las posibles actividades que desean realizar durante el año.
Se sienten animadas D. poder crecer dentro del grupo y mantener la responsabilidad entre sus compañeras.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Maria E. quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. dulces caseros, ella compra todos los ingredientes D. acuerdo a los pedidos D. los clientes y elabora sus dulce y lo entrega a sus clientes en envase D. vidrio que ella misma recicla.
 El crédito lo utilizo para la compra D. ingredientes D. los duces que ella prepara, agradece a la Fundación Y Kiva por la oportunidad que le brinda a muchas mujeres D. escasos recursos para trabajar otorgando los créditos ya D. esa forma facilita el acceso  a una actividad comercial.
texts.en:
They all live in the same neighbourhood where they share in their meetings the possible activities that they wish to do during the year. They feel motivated being able to grow within the group and maintain responsibility among their members. One of the members is Maria E. who makes and sells home-maD. sweets. She buys all the ingredients in accordance with the clients' orders and makes her sweets and delivers them to her clients in a glass container that she recycles herself. She will use the loan to purchase the ingredients for the sweets that she prepares. She is grateful to the "Fundación" and Kiva for the opportunity to work provided to many women with limited resources, granting loans in this way provides access to a commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make sweets, such as: sugar, fruit, milk, essences.

loans.name: Uaina

texts.en:
Uaina F. is 44 and married with 10 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Uaina has many years of experience in this business.  Uaina needs a loan of WST $1700 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Uaina joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Uaina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Llapanchis Tticarisunchis Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS” está representado por Julia que es la presidenta,  Olga  que es la secretaria, Zoraida que es la tesorera y Walter que es el fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el VI ciclo y está conformado por 13 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
 
Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios es por ejemplo; venta de comidas, venta pasamanería, venta de productos de belleza, venta de medicamentos, venta de ropa, venta brochetas, venta de panes y venta de verduras. Otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo de panadería, albañil, visitador médico y cajera.

Olga, tiene 32 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la distribución de ropa, ella nos cuenta que viaja la ciudad de la Paz del país de Bolivia de donde trae su mercadería. Ya son 5 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo casacas. Olga forma parte de la junta directiva del banco comunal desde el año 2008 y es la secretaria, ella fue elegida como una de las representes del banco comunal por su puntualidad y responsabilidad, 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la región sur del país.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Llapanchis Tticarisunchis” is led by Julia who serves as president, Olga who serves as secretary, Zoraida who serves as treasurer, and Walter who serves as auditor. The members meet every thirty days at the microfinance offices of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. The Communal Bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle and consists of 13 hardworking and enterprising individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and provide their children with a better future.

Some examples of the businesses the members are engaged in include selling food, decorations, beauty products, medicines, clothing, skewered meats, bread, and vegetables. Others work in service positions such as bakers, bricklayers, visiting health professionals, and cashiers.

Olga is 32 years old, married, has three children, and works as a clothing distributor. She tells us that she travels to the city of La Paz in Bolivia and brings back her merchandise. Olga has already been in this business for five years and has done very well as a result of her commitment to her work. She needs a loan to increase her business capital because she wants to buy merchandise, such as jackets. Olga has been a Communal Bank board member since 2008 and currently is the secretary. She was selected to be one of the Communal Bank representatives because of her punctuality and responsibility.

The members value and appreciate the loan that has been provided to them and promise to make their payments on time.

Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, historical center, landscapes, and history. It is a charming city located in the southern part of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Burabaeva Kenzhekan Group

texts.en:
B. Kenzhekan is the leader of the group. She is the resident of Balykchy.  Kenzhekan is 48 years old, she's married and has raised 2 daughters. Both of them are involved in education, the older one is a student of the 4-th year, the younger one studies at school, in the 11-th class. Her husband is engaged in agriculture and cattle breeding. Kenzhekan is engaged in increasing the livestock too, she sells about 3 sheep monthly, to cover family expenses. She also sells milk in order to make money. So she earns about 3000 soms (65.48$) per month. Money received from the loan, she'll spend to buy small cattle in order to increase its number. In future she wishes to repair the house and plans to save money to pay for her daughter's education in university.

T. Batina is 49, she's divorced and has 2 sons. The older one is 26, he works in the firm - "Aman Jol" located in Karakol. The other son is 18, he's a pupil of 11-th class. 10 years ago Batina began to work in Bishkek on Alamedin market, where she sold fruits and vegetables. The initial amount of her business activity was 1000 soms (21.82$). And now her income is 6000 soms (130.95$) per month. As a result she built a house for her older son and bought a car. Batina wants to get a loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables, and so to resell it further.

S. Dinara is the treasurer of the group. She's 37 years old and she's married. There are 4 children in their family: 3 sons and a daughter. A daughter and an older son studies at school, others are preschool age. Dinara works a teacher of chemistry and biology at school. Her husband is a constructor, when he's free he looks after the children and helps Dinara with housework. They need a loan to buy 30 chickens and seeds of potatoes for sowing. In future Dinara wants to repair the house, increase the livestock and educate her children.

K. Sabyrbek is 55, he's married and has a son. His son is 18, and he's a pupil of the 11-th class. Sabyrbek has his private store where he sells convenience goods. He started his business activity 15 years ago, with the initial amount of 10000 soms (218.24$). So now he earns 6000 soms (130.95$) per month. He needs a loan to purchase goods in order increase the turnover and the range of goods.  In future Sabyrbek wants his son to enter the university.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy small cattle

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène F. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL  depuis le 14 juillet 2003 et a eu 15 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter  2 dizaines de moutons et de l’aliment pour bétail afin d’engraisser les sujets et les revendre au bout de 4 ou 5 mois au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa	 zone. Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de la vie de la famille par la nourriture et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
Mbène F. is a 44-year old woman, married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in Ndondol since July 14, 2003 and has had 15 good loan experiences. She raises sheep, and with her new loan she wants to purchase two dozen of sheep and animal food in order to fatten up and resell the sheep four-five months later at one of the weekly markets in her region. Her goal is to contribute to improving the life conditions of her family, especially food and clothing for her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheep for her livestock business

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es:
Francisco esta casado con la Sra. Amanda Gutierrez, tiene 7 hijos, los 4 mayores ya estan casados y tienen su propia familia, solo viven con el Francisco Jose de 17 años, Hector de 16 y Ramon de 11 años. El profesor Francisco  trabaja para el MINED en el Instituto Nacional de Chontales desde hace 25 años como maestro de secundaria.  

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 8vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo el porche de su casa, y de esta manera ver mas bonita su casita, cabe señalar que gracias a los creditos obtenidos ha ido mejorando su casa, pero hasta esta vez espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder ver su casa con las condiciones basicas para su familia y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean hombres de provecho.
texts.en:
Francisco is married to Amanda Gutierrez and has 7 children, the 4 eldest of which are already married and have their own families. Only Francisco Jose, aged 17, Hector, aged 16, and Ramon, aged 11, live with him. Francisco has been employed by the MNED at the Instituto Nacional de Chontales as a secondary school teacher for 25 years. He would like to request a loan to improve his home by building a porch, which will give the house a nicer appearance. Thanks to the loans obtained so far he has been able to make his house better, and this time he hopes to benefit from a Kiva loan. His dreams are to get his home to the basic standard required by his family and to see his sons finish their studies and become hard-working men.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Porch construction

loans.name: Romalyn

texts.en:
Romalyn A. is from the village of  Talon Gingoog city. She is 40 years old. Romalyn is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Romalyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the buying and selling of coco pulp (copras)  in the local community. Romalyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Romalyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Romalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Floreda

texts.en:
Floreda D. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Floreda is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Floreda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from a tailoring business but she is now selling both food & daily use products in the local community as her new business venture. Floreda is just starting this business. She chose to lower the amount of loan from 18,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because she finds it easy to pay back.

In 2007, Floreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Floreda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Floreda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Munansi Development, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Second-hand clothes are in high demand from many people in Uganda. N. Florence, a hardworking, dependable and lively 42-year-old woman, was not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity which presented itself in her home area of Kibaati, Mubende. She made a decision to capitalize on it and, with the money she had saved doing her other businesses, she bought her first bales of second-hand clothes.
With these she established her business. Although the business has had its fair share of ups and downs, Florence has emerged as a resilient lady who has refused to buckle under pressure. With this kind of spirit, she has made enormous headway as seen in the 180,000 UGX she makes monthly through selling in monthly and weekly markets in the area. Florence is a lady who likes to take a long view and she has drawn up a plan to expand her second-hand clothes business into a big franchise. With this loan, Florence is optimistic that she will be empowered financially to see her dream come true and be able to educate all four of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of using clothing for resale

loans.name: Ainura

texts.en: Ainura M. is a resident of Tup, a small town in the Isykul region. She is 45 and married. She has two daughters and a son. The son studies at school and the daughters live in Bishkek. The first daughter is a teacher at a university and the second works in a pharmacy. In 1994, because of the high unemployment rate, Ainura and her husband began to sell potatoes to make money. Now they have their own container and sell flour there. Ainura also began to sell garlic. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase 500 kg of garlic in order to resell it at a higher price in the winter. In the future, she plans to start building a house, purchase a minibus and save some money to contribute to her daughter’s wedding. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.
