M. vende ropa usada ambulante en el municipio de san Rafael va a utilizar el financiamiento para comprar mas ropa variada y asi tener que ofrecerles a sus clientes, ella pasaba todo el dia haciendo los quehaceres de su casa porque la mama trabaja entonces pasaba aburrida y le dijo a la mama que le ayudara para poder ella tener su negocio y asi distraerse un poco vendiendo su mercadería, ella espera tener más ingreso ahora con este nuevo crédito por que así va a tener que ofrecerles a su clientela, Suleyva es casada no tiene hijo vive en la casa de su mama por que aun no han podido construir su casa, ya es el segundo crédito con nosotros y le han ayuda mucho.espera cada día trabajar más duro y que estos crédito le van a seguir ayudando para asi un dia cumplir sus sueños de poder tener su propia casa su esposo trabaja en la cementera como obrero
texts.en:
Senora Suleyva M. M. sells used clothing as a street vendor in the municipality of San Rafael. She will use this financing to buy additional pieces of clothing to offer to her clients. She used to spend all day doing the chores at her house because her mother works, then she got bored and her mother told her that she would help her to have her own business, so she could entertain herself selling her merchandise. With this new loan she hopes to have a greater income by offering a greater selection to her clientele. Suleyva is married without children. She lives in her mother's home because she has not yet been able to build her own house. This is the second loan through us, the loans are very helpful to her. Every day she hopes to work harder, and that these loans help her to get ahead so that one day she may fulfill her dream of having her own home. Her husband is a worker in the cement plant.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
This is not the first loan that Rula has borrowed from FATEN. Our borrower is a housewife and the mother of 4 children. Her husband owns a shop in Beit Sahour, a small town in the Beth Lehem district, where he sells plastic items such as chairs, plates, cups, and small plastic cupboards. He also works in a small shop across from his own for a small salary.

The shop that Rula and her husband own, beside the salary he receives, comprise the family's entire income. Therefore, she applied for a loan to purchase more plastic items to sell in their small shop.

Rula says that she and her husband expect to improve their financial situation if the shop works as they are planning. This is not her first loan from FATEN and Rula is known for her commitment to repay on time.

In the picture, Rula is standing in her shop.

loans.use: To buy plastic items to sell

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda S. is from the village of Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 63 years old. Luzvisminda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Luzvisminda operates a piggery. Luzvisminda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Luzvisminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzvisminda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional sacks of feed for her piggery. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Luzvisminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Martha Jacoba

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Jacoba E. Martínez  vende piñatas por encargo y en su casa y vende repostería y bisutería ambulante y en las escuelas.

Ella Va a utilizar el crédito para comprar papel para hacer  piñatas, productos de repostería y comprar productos de bisutería.
Ella vive sola con su marido y el le ayuda a movilizarse en un triciclo que es donde caminan vendiendo para llevar el pan diario de la comida.

La Sra. Martha ha tenido 15 créditos con la Institución y todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma y dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, por la confianza que le han otorgado y la ayuda que siempre ha tenido por parte de nosotros para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Martha Jacoba E. Martínez sells piñatas to order out of her home, and also sells pastries and costume jewelry as a street vendor and in schools. Martha is going to use this loan to purchase paper for making piñatas, products for making pastries, and products for making costume jewelry. She lives with her husband, who helps her to get around on a tricycle—that is how they go to sell her products so that they can support themselves. Martha has had 15 loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL, and she has paid all of them properly and on time. She says that she is very grateful to CEPRODEL for giving her confidence and for the help that she and her husband have always received, which has allowed them to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling piñatas, pastries, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Vaomau

texts.en:
Vaomau L. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Vaomau has 2 years of experience in this business.  Vaomau needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 180 talas or US $75 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Vaomau joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vaomau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El comite 6 DE ENERO se encuentra en pleno desarrollo  dentro del tercer ciclio, cada integrante se encuentra realizando una actvidad independiente ademas de las actividades en común que las mismas realizan como comite, y de esta manera trabajan en forma solidaria y se ayudan mutuamente.
Una de la integrantes es la Sra.Rucci R. con 38 años de edad , es  modista trabaja en la costura con una prima, esta por montar su propio taller de costura en su casa.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos, mediante la adquisición de telas de temporada otoño-invierno como para confección de camperas, blusas, pantalones, remeras mangas largas y todo tipo de abrigo que sea de buena calidad y facil comercialización. Además quiere adquirir más máquinas para el taller, así como todo tipo de accesorios que mejoren la calidad de sus productos.
Además, una vez el taller en su casa ya no tendría gastos de alquiler de local y viáticos.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de telas y accesorios para confeccion de ropas.
texts.en:
The 6 de Enero committee is a well-developed group, and in their third loan cycle. Each member is working independently besides the activities done together as a committee. In this way they work as a group and all help each other out. One of the members is Mrs. Rucci R., 38. She is a dressmaker and works in this field with her cousin. They are ready to open their own dressmaking shop in her house. She wishes to increase her earnings by buying fall-winter seasonal fabrics to make: jackets, blouses, pants, long-sleeved t-shirts, and all types of coats that are of good quality and easy to put together. They also want to add more sewing machines to the workshop, as well as different types of accessories to improve the quality of their products. And also once the workshop is in her house, she will have no more rent and traveling expenses. The loan that she is asking for is to buy fabric and accessories to make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fall/winter fabric to mkae jackets, blouses, pants

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto D., 58 years old, is a rice farmer. He started his business in 2002 and owns the 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm that he tills. He works so hard to be able to help his family.

Norberto joined CEVI’s micro-credit program in 2006. He would like to obtain a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to buy additional farm supplies to increase his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Saida Del Carmen

texts.es: Saida Del Carmen tiene 31años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que dio inicio pues no tenia los recursos suficientes para mantener a sus 2 hijos, es así que ella busca el medio de mejorar sus ingresos, pues necesitaba proporcionarles comida. Ella ha sido una mujer responsable y luchadora. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de ropa variada. Su deseo es tener su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Saida Del Carmen is 31 years old. She sells general merchandise. She started over six years ago. She did not have sufficient resources to support her two children. That is why she looked for a way to improve her earnings. She needed to feed the children. She has been a responsible and tenacious woman. The loan is to buy a variety of clothing. Her wish is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristales Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Cristales” esta representado por la señora Marlene y conformado por 11 miembros 1 varón y 10 mujeres, todos son muy trabajadores y unidos y van cursando juntos ya un tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad y honestidad en sus pagos. La señora Marlene se dedica a al venta D. pollo crudo en un frial instalado en sus domicilio, ella tiene mucha clientela que le demanda mas producto es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para poder obtener mayor cantidad D. pollo para su venta; La señora Marlene es madre D. dos hijos, ella es casada y vive en su propia casa pero su domicilio es viejo y requiere D. muchos arreglos por lo que ella se encuentra en este momento ahorrando para poder refaccionar su domicilio. El resto D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, venta D. ropa, venta D. empanadas, otras venden comida, servicio D. rock-ola y la atención en pensiones D. comida. Los socios afirman que existe mucha competencia en el M. pero las socias cuentan con clientes que confían en sus productos y que demandan sus servicios. El crédito será destinado a la compra D. insumos, mercadería y la adquisición D. herramientas y materiales para agrandar sus negocios generando mejores ganancias para el mejoramiento D. la calidad D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cristales” (Crystals) is represented by Sra. Marlene and consists of eleven members, one man and ten women. All of them are hardworking and close-knit. Together they are starting their third loan cycle and have demonstrated promptness and honesty with their payments.

Sra. Marlene sells raw chickens from a food store she operates out of her home. She has many customers who demand her product. For this reason, she needs a loan to obtain a large quantity of chickens to sell. Sra. Marlene is the mother of two children. She is married and lives in her own house, but her home is old and in need of many repairs. At the moment, she is saving money so that she can repair her home.

The other members sell cosmetics, clothing, turnovers, and other types of food. Others proviD. jukebox services and manage a boarding house. The members claim that much competition exists in the marketplace, but they have customers who rely on their products and demand their services. This loan will be used to buy supplies, merchandise, equipment, and materials to expand their businesses and generate more revenue so that they can improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: 03.04.07 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thanh Luong T. (15) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Thanh is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 07.Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.04.07.Hoang Hoa).

Thanh is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thanh owns & operates a business a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Luong T. Tuyen (25) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  N. T. Hoan (13) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thanh Luong T. (15) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa.  Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07.Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.04.07.Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 4,500,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Luong T. Tuyen (25) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Hoan (13) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en: Charlyn T. is from the village of Madalag, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old and is married with six children, four of them in school. Charlyn owns and operates a general store, selling daily food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Charlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Cavidu

texts.ru:
Cavidu 22 qoda . On ne jinat i jivet v qorode Baku. On ne uchitsya v univere on reshil prodoljit professiyu dedushki kotoriy s detsva uchil emu remeslennichestvo.

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZn chtobi kupit novyu aparaturu tak kak eta aparatura emu ostalas ot dedushki i ona uje staraya.on xechesh noviy aparat chtobi uludshit biznes .
texts.en:
Cavidu is 22 years old. He is not married and lives in the city of Baku. He is not going to the university and decided to take his grandfather's profession which he taught him when Cavidu was very young. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy new equipment because his equipment was his grandfather's and is very old. He wants to buy this new machinery to improve his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth Nyambura

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been in the motorcycle transportation business for over five years.  She normally employs people who operate the motorcycle on her behalf and bring in the cash at the end of the day.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan.  She plans to buy a new set of tires for her motorcycle and service the motorcycle.

Elizabeth hopes to buy a taxi in the future which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a new set of tires for her motorcycle and service the motorcycle.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María Mercedes O. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive en el sector Las Caleras en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió,   es la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador. Cuenca es una ciudad encantadora por sus iglesias, su parque histórico, su cultura y su gente.
 
La Señora. María Mercedes tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años de edad, su hijo mayor es casado y vive independientemente, su hijo de 20 años se dedica a trabajar y estudia en la universidad, su hija de 18 años trabaja y estudia a distancia en la universidad, su esposo es empleado privado.

Doña María se dedica a la preparación de viandas (loncheras), lleva 3 años en este negocio, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 9 a.m. a 4 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de animales domésticos como: cuys, conejos, pollos, los pollos son tanto para su negocio como para su consumo.

Lleva 10 años trabajando en su bankito, nos comenta que los créditos le benefician mucho en su negocio, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus viandas (loncheras), su gran sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
María Mercedes O. is a member of the Las Caleras Communal Bank. She lives in the Las Caleras area of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate, and it is know for being the third most important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is a charming city because of its churches, its historical park, and its people. María Mercedes is 42 years old and married. She has three children, ages 22, 20, and 18. Her oldest child is married and lives independently. Her 20 year old son works and attends the university. Her 18 year old daughter works and studies through distance learning in the university. Her husband is a private employee. María devotes herself to preparing food (lunches). She has been in this business for three years. Her work schedule is Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. She also raises domestic animals like guinea pigs, rabbits, and chickens. The chickens are as much for her business as for personal consumption. She has been working with her communal bank for ten years. She tells us the loans have been a big help to her business. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy food to make the lunches. Her big dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, rice, potatoes, oil, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout H. was born in 1959 and has established a small family in the best part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She stays at home taking care of daily duties. The family is supported by Hout’s husband who owns a motorcycle that he uses to provide a taxi service. They also receive help from her daughter who is employed in Malaysia.

Hout’s husband’s motorcycle is old and often breaks down, resulting in a decline in income. Hout hopes to resolve this problem by obtaining a loan for her husband to replace his broken taxi.

loans.use: To replace her husband's broken motorcycle

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Mrs. Bernadita A. is 45 years of age, married to Epenito, a driver, and is blessed with five children, two of whom are now adults while the other three are still in school. She is from the barangay of Pisaan within Bonifacio municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental region on the island of Mindanao. Bernadita raises pigs for butchering. She also receives support from her husband as a driver. She’s been in this business for almost a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Bernadita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP program, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. Bernadita successfully repaid a loan amount of 7,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan, her third from PMPC, of 14,000 PHP to be used for additional capital to buy and sell pigs for butchering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family, in particular to meet their basic needs, to save for the future, for loan repayments and for her children’s education, insurance and possible expansion of her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her butchering business

loans.name: Nafisatu

texts.en: Nafisatu A. is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school. She sells porridge in Abura. She helps her husband provide for the basic needs of the family. She will use this loan to buy more ingredients to prepare her porridge for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to buy land.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare her porridge for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella T. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. Four of her children are currently in school. Stella has a business in agriculture (flowers), which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and quality stem flowers. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Stella hopes to become an expert in flowers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and quality stem flowers.

loans.name: Nely Mercedes

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y con 02 hijos, tiene estudios de educación secundaria.

Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de productos de la Región.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar papas, chuños, verduras y golosinas para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes con primeras necesidades.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones y lo que gana en el ahorro.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, in Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 30 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children.  She has a secondary school education.

Nely has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles.  She used that money to increase her capital for her business selling regional products.

She is requesting a new loan for 600 nuevos soles to buy potatoes, potato flour, vegetables and candies for her business.

Her dream is to have a grocery store selling basic foodstuffs.

What she likes most about her community bank are the training sessions and what she earns by saving.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, potato flour, vegetables and candies for her business

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida belongs to Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and is known for its culture and fashion. She lives there in the area named Yadgar with her family in a two-room brick house. 

She is a very supportive lady and supports her family financially by making artificial flowers. She receives orders from different gift shops and flower shops of the market and provides them finished goods on time to earn an income. These artificial flowers are used for the decoration of homes and particularly in weddings. 

Her husband, M. A., is a private entrepreneur and sells animal food as a business. He has a shop in the market and sells from there a good quantity of food every day and earns a good income. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband for his business. With the loan, he will buy more animal food to sell through his shop and improve his business.
 
Zahida is hopeful that with the help of a loan investment, her husband will be able to get maximum results from his business.

loans.use: To buy animal food for an animal-food business

loans.name: Marina Dolores

texts.es:
Marina Dolores A. A. tiene 32 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Marina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mas terrenos para que los hijos sigan cultivando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Marina Dolores A. A., 32, is married living with her husband and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has four children.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It belongs to the Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional jobs.  It has 17 members.

Marina is a corn, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  She buys her supplies in Chillanes and sells her products in the Chillanes market and in her home settlement.

She is asking for the loan to buy corn, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to have more farmland so that her children can cultivate.

She enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Romana J., in her early thirties, is married and has two children. Romana has been runing a business selling milk from her one cow for the past year, and she also owns a pool table which she charges customers to use. Operating the business daily from 07:00 am to 10:00 pm earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Romana's second loan from Tujjenge Tanzania. She used her first loan, since fully repaid, to bring her cow back down to Dar es Salaam. With her second loan, she intends to build a shed in which to house her cow. Romana's dream is to provide good education for her children.

Romana will share this loan with her loan group Pamba, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Romana is in front holding a baby.

loans.use: To build a shed for her cow.

loans.name: Marbella

texts.es:
La señora Marbella Rodríguez U., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es casada  con el señor Edin Morales Gutiérrez, en   el cual procreo cuatro hijos una mujer y tres varones y son: Marbella de dieciocho años, el segundo es  Luis Antonio de trece  años, el otro es Amilsi de siete y el más pequeño es Edin de dos años y medio.

       Se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes con el cual acaba de iniciar hace unos meses,  comenta que le va bien, pues de ahí obtiene para  sus  ingresos de su  hogar y tambien para la educación de sus hijos que estudian.

       En esta actividad inicio por si sola ya que en el barrio donde ella vive las tiendas están retiradas y se les dificulta ir a comprar sus cosas hasta el centro y mejor decidió poner su propia tienda  donde sus vecinos tambien le con suman.

       Con la ganancia que va obteniendo, de su venta lo invierte comprando más mercancía, así surtir  de nuevo su tienda y obtenga mejores ventas  e ingresos en su hogar, pues cuado menos tenga para sostenerse con su familia que para ella es muy importante.

      Su  sueño más grande es lograr que su negocio  aumente  y de ello trabajar para  obtener  dinero del cual pueda ahorrar y apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando y con  eso tenga para terminar una profesión.
texts.en:
Señora Marbella Rodríguez U. lives in Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to señor Edin Morales Gutiérrez with whom she has four children, one girl and three boys: Marbella (18), Luis Antonio (13), Amilsi (7), and the youngest Edin (2½). Marbella runs a grocery store which she opened just a few months ago. She says that all is going well, and she is earning money to pay for household expenses and her children’s education.

In the neighbourhood where Marbella lives, the only shops are a distance away so she has to go into the town centre to do her shopping. For this reason she decided it was a good idea to open her own store where her neighbours can also do their shopping.

With the loan she plans to buy more stock for her store so that she can sell more, earn more, and provide for her family--something that is very important to her. Marbella’s greatest dream is to see the store do well so that she can save money and support her children while they are students. Then they will be able to get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, beans, oil, cookies

loans.name: Gladis Aidee

texts.es:
Doña Gladis, tiene 53 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres donde vive sola, ya que sus hijos han formado sus propios hogares, ella vende productos lácteos este negocio nació por iniciativa propia, por la necesidad y para mantenerse ocupada, este negocio no tiene horario fijo por que los clientes en toda hora llegan a buscar estos productos.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de leche para preparar la venta, esto contribuirá para que continúe en el negocio y ofrezca a los clientes productos frescos y de calidad.
Su visión de comerciante es mantenerse siempre activa en el negocio produciendo cada vez más y recibir ingresos para ir poco a poco mejorando su condición económica.
texts.en:
Gladis, 53, lives alone in Concepción Batres because her children have all formed their own households.  She sells dairy products, a business she started on her own initiative because she needed to stay occupied.  The business does not have a fixed schedule because customers come by at all hours seeking these products.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy milk to sell.  This will contribute to her staying in business offering customers fresh, quality products.

Her vision as a merchant is to always stay active in business producing more each time earning income to gradually improve her economic condition.

loans.use: To buy milk.

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es:
Jean Carlos tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Él cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, él suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo de cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Jean Carlos desea implementar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos is 20 years old, single, living with his family in the Tambogrande farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for lemon and mango production, belonging to Piura province and located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has a small, home-based grocery store where he stocks daily use items and groceries for his neighbors.  He tends to customers with dedication and charisma so he has a well-established base of regular customers who prefer to buy in his store.  Income from this activity is used to support the family’s economy.

Jean Carlos would like to stock more products in his store so that sales will grow and he can meet current demand.  Because of this he has asked for a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help him reach this objective

loans.use: To stock his store with more products.

loans.name: América Del Carmen

texts.es: América del Carmen M. D. O. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Santa Ana, una D. las ciudades más importantes del país. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual vive junto a su madre y una hila, con quienes se dedican a trabajar para sostener su hogar. América posee un negocio D. comida a la vista, el cual se encuentra a las afueras D. su hogar y en donD. comercializa sus alimentos con personas que trabajan a los alrededores, así mismo posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual es atendida por su madre y su hija. D. esta manera las tres trabajan en conjunto para poder salir adelante. Es por esto que América solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con más productos para comercializar y elaborar los alimentos.
texts.en: América del Carmen M. D. O. is 48 years old and lives in the Santa Ana department which is one of the most important cities of the country. She is a very hardworking woman and lives with her mother and daughter who also work to help maintain their home. América sells food located on the outer section of her home. She sells food  to people who work close by and her mother and daughter are in charge of selling perishable goods. All three work together to make a living. América is requesting a loan to buy more materials to sell and prepare food.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell and prepare food.

loans.name: Bertha Calderón Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bertha Calderón está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla G. de 38 años quien vende frijoles, hielo y gaseosa desde hace 2 años. Ella con crédito además de comprar productos desea invertir en sandalias.
Las otra integrantes del grupo son Mariela de los Ángeles A. Pérez quien tiene una pequeña venta de chiveria y gaseosa y Martha Lorena T. vende frijoles cocidos, leña y productos arabella.
texts.en: The Bertha Calderon group is made up of 3 hard-working, enterprising women, one of whom is Karla G. who is 38 years old and has sold beans, ice, and soft drinks for the past 2 years.  She would like to use the loan to buy other products to sell like sandals.  The other group members are Mariela de los Angeles A. Perez who runs a small general store selling food and soft drinks and Martha Lorena T. who sells beans, firewood and beauty products.

loans.use: Purchase sandals to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La señora Justina trabaja como empleada en un cine y también realiza ventas de cosméticos y lavado de ropa, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos de repostería para su venta, pues muchos clientes le han pedido este tipo de producto (como paletas,moldes, cremas para decorar, etc.). Con los ingresos que obtiene  mantiene a su familia. Vive en casa  de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciada y tiene tres hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Justina is an employee working in a movie theater; she also engages in selling cosmetics and in offering laundry services. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase baking products to sell, since many clients have asked for this kind of product (such as spatulas, molds, decorative icing, etc.) She is able to provide for her family thanks to her earnings. She lives in her parents’ house in Tacagua, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is divorced and she has three children. This is her first cycle with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy baking products for resale

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
L. A.C. “PROSPERIDAD” iniciará su decimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal D. Cascada.  Está compuesta por once integrantes y tiene como presidenta a L. señora Roset.   Los negocios D. las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.

L. señora Roset, presidenta D. L. asociación comunal, indica que participa en Pro Mujer hace tres años y se integro a L. institución  por invitación D. lo promotores.

En L. actualidad L. señora Roset elabora trenzado D. mantas gracias a L. enseñanza D. su mamá, por eso viene trabajando en este rubro hace 6 años. El crédito que sacará ahora es para  L. compra D. teL. para mantas, las que adquirirá D. L. feria 16 D. julio. Posteriormente, las venderá en un puesto fijo que tiene en es mercado.

Esta forma D. trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, porque elL. vive en concubinato y tiene una niña.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta D. Pro Mujer, elL. responD. que le gusta L. capacitación.
texts.en:
The “PROSPERIDAD” communal bank will start its 10th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It has 11 members and its President is Roset.  The businesses of the members are different.  Among them we find: commerce, production and services.

Roset, group President, states that she’s participated in Pro Mujer for three years and became part of the institution through an invitation from the advisors.

Currently Roset is weaving blankets thanks to skills learned from her mother.  She’s been in this line of work for 6 years.  The loan she’s taking out now will be used to buy fabric for blankets that she’ll get at the 16 D. Julio market.  Later, she’ll sell them at a fixed stand she has at the market.

This work method allows her to generate income to support her family because she has a spouse and a daughter.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old and married to Efren B.. They have five adult children.

Elizabeth owns and operates a “sari-sari” (variety) store. She has been engaged in her business for 30 years since she married her husband. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In December 2005, Elizabeth joined Paglaum MPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Elizabeth is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell and to buy housing materials for her house improvement. This will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: used to buy more products to sell and to buy materials to improve her house

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en:
Iuliana is 20 years of age and married. She has no children. Iuliana owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Iuliana needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2011, Iuliana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Iuliana's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel es casado, su esposa trabaja como afanadora, sus hijos estudian y que se preparen es su mayor prioridad. Sus planes mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda poco a poco. Trabaja como operador de maquinas desde hace un tiempo. Agradece a la financiera por el préstamo ya que requiere cambiar el techo de la casa antes de los tiempos de lluvia. Comprara materiales como laminas de zinc, perlines, golosa, bloques, cemento, arena y piedrines entre otros materiales ya que sus planes es cambiar el techo y levantarlo un poco más. Obtener mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Miguel is married. His wife works and his children study. Miguel's main priority is that his children get an education. He plans to improve the infrastructure of his house little by little. Miguel has worked as a machine operator for a long time. He is grateful for the loan because he needs to get a new roof before the rainy season. He will buy materials like sheets of zinc, beams, bolts, blocks, cement, sand and bricks. His plan is to change his roof and raise it a little higher. His goal is to have a more secure house.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new roof

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for the last 10 years and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces maize, vegetables, and milk, which are all sold locally. She earns additional income from her grocery shop in the same location. She is 43 years old and married with 7 children who all attend school.

Jane has requested her fourth loan from Juhudi Kilimo, for 61,200 KES.  She will use this loan to buy and insure a dairy cow and purchase additional stock of chickens. The proceeds from these projects will help in the education of her children. 

Her primary challenges in the farming business have been diseases and the low and fluctuating market prices of her products. She hopes to practice commercial farming in the future by having at least 4 dairy cows and dairy goats and at least 2000 chickens.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and purchase additional stock of chickens.

loans.name: G.s. El Buen Corazon Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario El Buen Corazón está conformado por Noelia, José Alberto y Lesbia.  Noelia tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 2 años que tiene esta actividad, que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado obtener. Es una mujer muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan con las diferentes prendas. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior entre otras.
texts.en: "El Buen Corazón" (The Good Heart) community bank has three members: Noelia, José Alberto and Lesbia.  Noelia has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for more than two years and obtained it with a lot of sacrifice.  She is a very responsible woman and always pays attention to which different types of clothes her customers are requesting.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 28 years old and is still single. He is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. He has been growing rice for 5 years. He works hard to improve his business. He also wants to save for his future family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and fuel for the tractor. In the future, Rolly hopes to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes se definen como un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Lo principal del comité es la solidaridad y la cooperación.
La Señora Aurora es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, la cual es muy conocida en el barrio donde vive. Gracias a los años que tiene en este negocio, ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener una despensa más grande donde pueda exhibir más variedad de productos a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demás para el abastecimiento 
de su local. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues sabe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: The Mujeres Emprendedoras group formed when various neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso got together. All of the members consider the group to be very united and are able to carry out their activities jointly to strengthen the partnership. The group's principles are solidarity and cooperation. One of the group's members is Aurora, who has a small but well-stocked convenience store that is very well-known in her neighborhood. Thanks to the years she has put into the business, Aurora has a well-formed customer base. She dreams that one day she will be able to make her store bigger so she can offer her customers a wider variety of products. She is requesting the loan to purchase food, drinks, vegetables and other items to stock her store.

loans.use: Compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas para el abastecimiento del local.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Julie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles and coconut wine. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and breads.

Julie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and breads

loans.name: Jeannette De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Jeannette, vive con su papá, mamá y un hermano, es soltera, sastra, dicho negocio surgió por iniciativa propia y la ayuda de sus padres, quienes la apoyaron para que lo instalara en la vivienda, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser para aumentar la producción, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y sus ganancias.
El sueño de ella es que su negocio crezca con clientes para producir más y para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeannette lives with her father, mother and a brother. She is single and works as a seamstress. She started this business on her own initiative, with help from her parents. They supported her so that she could set up her business in their house. She does not have a fixed schedule for tending to her customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine in order to increase her productivity. This purchase will help her to improve her business and increase her profits.

Jeannette's dream is for her business to gain customers so that she can produce more and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old and married. She has three school-aged offspring to rear. Her husband is a good farmer. But not relying on the latter's income, Rosa engaged in a small-scale retailing activity. She is buying different sorts of raw and milled rice to sell profitably to the local community. She usually gets a total of PHP 20,000 a month from all income sources. She started on this three years ago and continues to the present time.

Rosa became a GDMPC member earlier this year. A loan of PHP 25,000 is requested to acquire several sacks of rice to sell retail. For Rosa, this is a good business to engage into because everyone is coerce to buy knowing that it is a basic commodity relevant in day to day survival.

Rosa plans to expand the business venture and work on additional farming to earn more income.

loans.use: To acquire several sacks of rice to sell retail.

loans.name: Jose Aristides

texts.es:
José,vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 18, 14 y 10 años de edad, administra una granja con pollos de engorde, lo inicio su padre, por el momento trabaja de lunes a domingo desde hace 13 años.
Él está nuevamente solicitando préstamo para la compra de pollos, concentrado y vacunas, estos préstamos le han ayudado para mantener la granja, ya que es su fuente de ingreso, para mantener a la familia.
Sus aspiraciones son construir una nueva galera para pollos,  ayudar a sus velando por las necesidades de alimentación, salud y educación.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and three children ages 18, 14 and 10. He runs a farm which his father started, where he fattens chickens. He works every day of the week, and has done so for 13 years.
He is requesting another loan for the purchase of chickens, chicken feed and vaccines. These loans have helped him to maintain his farm, as it is his source of income for supporting his family.
His goals are to build a new chicken coop and to help his family, ensuring their necessities: food, health, and education.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, chicken feed, and vaccines for his farm.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a hardworking businessman age 31. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last 10 years, he has been running a cafeteria to make a living. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to open other outlets of his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cooking fat, chicken and utensils. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, chicken and utensils

loans.name: Majaliwa

texts.en:
Majaliwa is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from door to door. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien was born in 1982. She lives in Luc Canh village. She has two children who are still small. She has a general store at home. She sells groceries for everybody in her village. She also raises chickens and grows rice. Her husband helps her with everything. She hasn’t got a lot of money but she feels happy. Her family has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She and her husband always try to earn money to have a better life. Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA to borrow money. The last time she borrowed 8.066.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy groceries for her general store (cake, candy, cigarettes.)

loans.use: to buy groceries for her general store (cake, candy, cigarettes.)

loans.name: April Veneth

texts.en:
April Veneth is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

April Veneth has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000  to buy fish to sell.

April Veneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, April Veneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a single lady who is 28 years old with two children aged one year old and nine years old. She wants to give her children a good education to the university level. She runs a grocery store in a busy shopping centre. She has been in this business for three years now. She has no other source of income. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the high cost of goods. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to increase her stock of onions. Her future hope is to own a bigger grocery store. She describes herself as very honest and outgoing.

loans.use: To buy more onions

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City. He is 50-years-old and has three children. 

Son has been earning a living by producing parts for polishing furniture for the past five years. Son would like to borrow money to buy more materials to expand his business and produce a larger quantity of parts. He hopes that this will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to produce parts for polishing furniture.

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en: Enhsaihan is a single mother and lives with her mother and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son is a student and her mother is a retired old woman. She started her business in 2009 by renting a café in two star hotel. Her café has tasty meals and good service. Her facility needs some repairing and she is lacking in the supplies needed to run her business. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "I am the only one with an income in the family. If i can't do the necessary repair, I will lose my business." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to repair her cafe.

loans.use: to repair her cafe.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en: Anitha is 36 years old with six children aged 2 to 16. She sells clothes such as skirts, blouses and sweaters.  The loan will be used to buy more skirts and sweaters to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in Uganda. She is single and has one child, who goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a niece).

Julia has a business of selling snacks (a restaurant). She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. Julia sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. 

Julia has requested a loan of 1,400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, beef, chicken and a jerycan of cooking oil. The main business challenges for Julia include transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get a permanent business premises and also to build her own house. Julia lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, beef, chicken and a jerycan of cooking oil

loans.name: Alonso Edison

texts.es:
Alonso Edison tiene 34 años vive es soltero, y vive con un vecino. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.

Alonso se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Desde hace tres  años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, líquidos, urea  para la siembra del maíz,   El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño  es poder comprar un terreno y así  tener estabilidad económica   para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta  jugar indor y pasar  con toda mi familia.
texts.en: Alonso Edison is 34 years old. He is single and lives with a neighbor. He lives in Recinto San Vicente Las Lomas in the Canton of Ventanas. The "El Recreo" Community Bank is located in Recinto San Vicente las Lomas that belongs to the Canton of Ventanas. This community bank is dedicated to short term agricultural work such as growing corn, rice, beans and soy beans. For the past three years Juan has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same location. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies, fertilizers, liquids and urea in order to grow corn. This loan will help him increase his earnings so that he can support his family. His dream is to buy a piece of land and have economic stability for his family. In his free time he likes to play volleyball and pass time with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Dina Raquel

texts.es: Dina, nuevamente solicita de nuevo otro préstamo debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución, para  invertirlo en su negocio y comprar mercadería como: manzanas, tomates, repollo, lechugas, zanahorias, remolachas, papas, vinagre y pescado, aprovechando esta época que es cuando más se vende.Los prestamos anteriores ayudaron a mejorar en sus ventas y a tener el negocio estable, una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is again applying for another new loan, because she likes the good service provided by our institution. This is to invest in her business and buy merchandise such as apples, tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce, carrots, beets, potatoes, vinegar, and fish. She is taking advantage of this season, which is when more is sold.

The previous loans helped improve her sales, and to have a stable business and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy apples, tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce, carrots, and beets.

loans.name: Patron Santiago - Chongos Bajo Group

texts.es:
La señora GLORIA años 49 de edad de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01hijos menores de edad. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Patrón Santiago - Chongos Bajo”.
Actualmente ella es Agricultora que se dedica a la Venta y Crianza de Animales cada tres meses vende animales como ovinos, vacunos, terneras, etc. Se dedica frecuentemente al engorde de animales y las vende en la feria de su localidad. El préstamo solicito para invertir en la compra de alimentos para sus animales, dándose la oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Ella está ubicada la primera persona lado izquierda viste con una un polo color azul oscuro.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria, who is 49 years old, is in a common-law marriage and has one minor child. She is a member of the communal bank "Patrón Santiago -- Chongos Bajo."

She is now a farmer who raises and sells animals. Every three months she sells animals such as sheep, cattle, calves, etc. She often fattens the animals and sells them in her local fair. She applied for the loan to invest in the purchase of feed for her animals. (In the photo) she is the first person on the left side and is wearing a dark blue shirt.

loans.use: to fatten and sell animals.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Rebecca is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling bread in Abura, a town near Cape Coast, and has been involved in this business for 10 years. Rebecca is married and the mother three children. Her husband is a driver, and she uses the proceeds from her business to help cover the family’s general expenses and pay her children’s school fees. Rebecca will use this loan to buy more baking ingredients so that she can make more items to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, she plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, because this will allow her to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1982 and he is married, he lives with his wife in the south of Jordan in a city called Aqaba, which ‎lies on the coast of the Red Sea, Mohammad has a diploma in English but he did not find a good work to suit with him ‎therefore he decided to start a business.‎

The nature of the city where he lives has given him an experience to work in boats field, so he buy a glass boat, then he ‎decided to develop his business to increase his income so he exchange his glass boat to speedboat and he rented to one ‎of the companies which work in the water games field. ‎
Now Mohammad requested a loan, to pay for maintenance of his speedboat and to continue his business with a high quality of ‎work, since it is his only source of income.‎

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of his speedboat and to continue his business with a high quality of ‎work

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. Sakina is 47 years old and has 3 children. She is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning hers business she rented a small cafe. Having borrowed the loan from Kiva she wants to buy the new chairs, tables and to expand the area of hers cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with the servant.
She applies for the loan $400 to buy the new chairs and to expand the area of hers cafe.

loans.use: To buy the new chairs and to expand the area of hers cafe

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is married with three children. She lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She has attended Business and entrepreneurship training offered by Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO). She owns a stall at Tandika market selling used clothes. She purchases these clothes from wholesalers and resell them in retail.

Using her savings, she managed to start keeping egg-laying hens as a supplementary business. She came to notice that the second business needs more capital than she anticipated.

To smoothly run her two businesses she needs USD 750 as capital. The money will be used to buy chicken feed, some medications and stock of clothes.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Nubia Veronica

texts.en:
My name is Nuvia O., and I have dedicated myself to selling popular goods at my convenience store, which I've had for one year. My costumers are good ones; there are only two convenience stores in my neighborhood and people come to me because I give them special service. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have a wider selection. With the earnings I'll be able to feed my family, especially my daughter, who is only 2 years old.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Nuvia O. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mi clientes son buenos ya que solo hay dos pulperias en mi localidad y la gente que me compra me prefiere ya que los atiendo de una forma especial, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de productos para tener mayor variedad y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia especialmente a mi hija que tiene 2 añitos de vida.

loans.use: Purchase supplies like bread, instant soup, eggs, lard, margarine, pastas, ham, shampoo, churros, beverages, juices, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina M. B. weaves the beautiful huipiles that Mayan women wear all over this part of Guatemala. Her huipiles command the highest prices, because they’re of the highest quality. Unlike women who weave and then have to take their work to a store for resale, Catarina has customers asking for her work and selecting the designs in advance. She gets about US$200 for a huipil, but of course has costs for the yarn; she uses the highest quality. It takes her about 15 days to complete a huipil as long as she can concentrate on it. She´ll use this loan to buy yarn; she normally buys about US$100 worth of yarn at a time. Before having access to the loans she gets through Friendship Bridge she couldn’t really weave much, because she never had the up-front money for the yarn, but now that’s easier to deal with.

Catarina is 30 and has just one child, an 8-year-old who is in first grade. Catarina never went to school and can’t read, write, or sign her name. She had an accident when she was very young and has only partial use of one of her legs. When she was little she didn’t want to go to school because she feared that the larger kids would pick on her.

Catarina´s family has pretty good health, except for the migraines she’s suffered ever since her Caesarian section when her son was born.

Catarina is a member of the women's group "Flor de Nebaj".

Written by Nancy Lews and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving huipiles

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Mr. Vusal is a 28-year-old farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 2001, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The income from this business is not enough to cover all the family and business expenditures. Vusal purchases calves, breeds them, then quarters them before selling them to the butcher who works in the big local market. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Vusal has to invest some money to make his small herd bigger. His application to Normicro Saatli for $500 loan is approved already.  He hopes eventually to expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Sootaiga

texts.en: Sootaiga is a 61-year-old lady who is married with four kids. Even though she is old, she is very driven to run her plantation with the help of her husband and sons. Her loan will be used to buy weed-killers, fertilizers, and gardening tools. She also is planning to build a house for her family on the plantation for living and for storage. She is very happy with the loan program and hopes to stay long in it.

loans.use: To buy tools and products for her plantation

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is a married mother and grandmother of 76 years of age. She is the oldest member of Lona Fagaloa Centre. Her children are supporting her business, however Epi is one of those mothers who has always believed in doing things on her own. With her loans she has improved her business and she has also improved many things in her home, including renovating her home and building a flushing toilet for her family. This loan will allow her to improve her grocery business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: Epifania would like to buy grocery inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Khanifa T. is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. The elder is graduating from school this year, the other children, aged 14 and 12, are still in school.

Khanifa sells confections such as spice cakes, pastries, and candies. She travels twice weekly to Khujand city and Tashkent (the capital of neighboring Uzbekistan) to purchase supplies. Her husband works as a mechanic, but Khanifa’s business is the main source of income for the family.

Over the past two years she has built up an impressive credit history with IMON. She is now asking for a loan of 2400.00 somoni (700.00 US dollars) to be repaid over 6 months. Khanifa is planning to expand her business and use the profits to buy a small store in which she and her husband will work. Having a stable source of income will make it possible for Khanifa to educate her children. Khanifa believes that education is more important than ever in today's world.

loans.use: To expand her confectionery business and buy a small store with the profits

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer M. is a taxi driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 30 years old and has been working as a taxi driver for the last 3 years. This will be Azer’s first loan cycle with Norwegian Microcredit. He is looking for funding so that he can make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab.

loans.name: Yormuhammad

texts.ru:
Yormuhammad Nuralievich Z. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 33 years old, married and has five children. He has a college education and is an economist by profession. He is also in the animal husbandry and agriculture business and breeds cattle for resale for meat. He buys the cattle on the market, feeds it for 40-45 days and then resells for a more profitable price and has been doing this for the past ten years. This business is the secondary source of income for his family. Additionally, the development of this type of business also allows to supply the markets with meat. Yormuhammad wants to use the loan to buy younger calves. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Зохиров Ермухаммад Нуралиевич проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей . Образование высшее . По профессии экономист. Занимается земледелием и животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 10 лет. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu sells plastic sandals and African printed cotton material  in the village of Makup Bana, a business she has been operating for more than 10 years.  Her business supplements the family's farming income, playing a vital role in meeting family expenses. Fatu would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $350 US.

loans.use: Expand her shoe and cloth business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca E.  is a hairdresser and is married with one child. She wants to improve the services she offers to her customers. Rebecca is requesting a loan to buy  hairdressing products for her salon.

loans.use: To buy additional hairdressing products.

loans.name: Balikuddembe Women's Group

texts.en:
Milly N. is the Treasurer and group leader of the Balikuddembe women’s group in Lugazi. She is married with 8 children, 5 of whom are still in school while the other 3 are married. In addition, she helps care for her grandchild who is in nursery section.

Since 2001, she has been operating a business of buying dried and smoked fish from Kiyindi and Masese landing sites and later selling such fish from the stall at her home in Buwoola. Before embarking upon this business, she was a farmer; though she is not complaining about her change of business, she is in need of additional capital to be able to buy more fish in a short period of time in order to generate more income. As such, she is seeking a loan to purchase additional fish and to continue to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Puanam

texts.en:
Punam M. has two daughters. Her daughters are studying in grade 9 and 6 respectively. Her husband's  name is Bharat M. and he works in a shoe shop. 
Punam M. opened her beauty parlor 3 years ago to earn something for herself. She took 3 month of training for this work from a training institute. She opened her beauty parlor in Koteshwor.  Her service is for ladies only. Now she is requesting a loan for $300 to buy various types of cosmetic goods for her work.  M. wants to use her income to increase the living standard of her family. She also wants to provide a good education for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr: Née le 05 Janvier 1965 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame A. Emilie est mariée. Elle est mère de six enfants dont cinq sont à leur charge. Elle est revendeuse d'escargot et autres produits divers tels que les chaussures, les bijoux et autres depuis trente ans. Actuellement, elle éprouve des difficultés financières liées à l'augmentation du nombre de clients qu'elle sert. Elle sollicite  ce prêt non seulement pour satisfaire la demande pressante de ses clients mais aussi pour élargir son champ d'activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilie A. was born on January 5, 1965 in Cotonou the economic capital of BENIN. She is married and the mother of six children, five of them are still dependent. For thirty years, she has been selling snails and other various products such as shoes, jewelery and more. She is currently facing financial difficulties related to an increase in the number of customers she is serving. She is requesting this loan, not only to fulfill the pressing demand of her clients but also to broaden her business field.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 snail baskets

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D., 48 ans, mariée, 6 enfants (qui vont tous à l’école) à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du sucre, du lait, du café, des clous de girofle, des petits pois, du niébé et de l’huile pour renforcer son activité de vente de petit déjeuner. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales.<b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Mariama D., 48, is married with 6 children (who are all enrolled in school) for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Place de Gao for one and a half years. She wants a loan to buy sugar, milk, coffee, cloves, green peas, niébé (cow peas), and oil to bolster her little business of selling breakfasts. Her income permits her to help support the family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling breakfasts

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Houn T., 34, sells groceries in the local market of Kampong Cham Province. She is married with three children, who are still living at home, and her husband works in construction. She typically makes about $3.30 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for $500 to purchase groceries in bulk to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
