Elmira is single (her brother is shown in the photo). She was born in 1966. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.

Four years ago Elmira, with her brother, started a sheep breeding business. Now they need a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) to buy ten sheep.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep

loans.name: Maritza Rosario

texts.es:
Maritza forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Maritza tiene 34 años de edad y 3 hijos junto a su conviviente que es profesor. Su logro más grande ha sido ser independiente y generar sus propios ingresos sin pedir a su conviviente. Comenta que su principal dificultad ha sido tener un hijo enfermo del oído y cuyo tratamiento es muy costoso, de tal manera que lo que su padre gana no alcanza para todos esos gastos, es por ello que empezó hace un año el negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas y el del servicio de fotocopiado e impresión. Ha logrado la licitación de un cafetín dentro de un colegio, en la institución educativa parroquial “Santa Rosa de Viterbo”. Comenta que empezó con S/. 50 y que ahora tiene invertido aproximadamente S/. 2,500 en todos sus productos. Le va bien y afortunadamente tiene la licitación por dos años para lo cual podrá postular nuevamente al concurso. Su dificultad es que los días de vacaciones no podrá trabajar en su negocio.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de una impresora y recordatorios para las promociones.
 
A Maritza le es importante trabajar para salir adelante y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the cooperative bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” (“Women of Great Challenges”), in the district and province of Huaraz, in the Ancash department. Maritza is 34 years old and has three children with her partner who is a teacher. Her greatest achievement is being independent and generating her own income. She tells us that her biggest difficulty has been having a child with an ear infirmity which requires costly treatment. For this reason, what the father earns is not enough for all the expenses, and she started to work a year ago selling food and beverages as well as providing photocopy and printing services. She has managed to bid on a cafeteria lease within a school, the parochial school Santa Rosa de Viterbo. She comments that she started with 0.50 soles, and has to date invested approximately 2,500.00 soles into her products. Things are going well and, fortunately, she holds the lease for two years at which time she will be able to renew the term. One problem is that, on vacation days, she won’t be able to work in her business. With this loan of 2,500.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will invest in the purchase of a printer and promotional commemorations. It is very important to Maritza to work to get ahead and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a printer and promotional commemorations.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que apoya económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró mercadería para venderla en su tienda. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más mercadería para ser vendida en su tienda de abarrotes.
Dora desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Community Bank “Wiñay” of the district, province and department of Puno. She is 58 years old; she is married and has 2 children that still need her financial support. With her first loan of $100 the purchased products to sell at her store. She has been working with the community bank for almost 3 years. With this $500 loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase more products to sell at her grocery shop. Dora would like to keep working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará mercadería.

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en:
Shamigul I. is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children. All her children are in school. Shamigul's husband is a taxi driver and his income is not enough to cover the family's expenses. That is why Shamigul decided to start her own business so that she could help her husband cover their living expenses. She is selling teenagers' clothing at the local market of Dushanbe city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods so as to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income.

Today Shamigul is requesting 1200 USD with the purpose of purchasing additional merchandise to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 7 months. Be an important part of the growth of Shamigul’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Beatriz Maria

texts.es:
Beatriz inició el negocio porque le gustan las ventas, siempre ha sido comerciante desde antes de casarse, y decidió seguir vendiendo para tener un ingreso extra antes de casarse, y decidió seguir vendiendo para tener un ingreso extra. Comenzó el negocio en forma en enero del 2000 ya que una hermana les vendía ropa, empezó con poca inversión, y vendiéndoles a sus vecinas y familiares, también a las maestras de la escuela de sus hijos, y poco a poco fue haciéndose de más clientes.
Gracias a que su negocio ha progresado con parte de la ganancia que tenía, ahora compra el triple de ropa y también empezó el negocio de hacer collares y aretes de cristal para expandir un poco su giro.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, con tu apoyo Beatriz continuara con su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz started her business because she likes sales. She has been a retailer, even before she got married. Before getting married, she sold goods in order to have extra income. She started forming her business in January of 2000, her sister was already selling clothes at this time. She started with a small investment, and she sold to her neighbors, friends and her children's school teachers. Little by little she gained more clients.

Thankfully, her business has made progress with the earnings that is has, now she is buying triple the amount of clothes and she also started a business making necklaces and crystal earrings in order to expand her business a little.

She needs a loan of MXN $4,000 (Mexican pesos) that she will pay in 6 months. The loan will be used to buy merchandise. With your help Beatriz will continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ramiro Arnulfo

texts.es: Don Ramiro tiene un carro que lo trabaja de taxi en la capital de Managua, tiene 43 años de edad, y reside en unidad de propósito, su esposa se desempeña como cajera, sus hijos están independientes, el tiene cinco años de trabajar el taxi, la dificultad es que abecés recorre varios kilómetros para obtener pasajero y solo gasta combustible por que son días malos donde la gente no aborda la unidad, pero otros días son buenos, con esta solicitud va invertir en el mantenimiento del vehiculo para seguir brindando su servicio a sus clientes. Sus metas es poder comprar otra unidad y poder invertir en una finca que tiene.
texts.en:
Don Ramiro has a car which he uses as a taxi in the capital city of Managua. He is 43 years old and lives in the Unidad de Proposito area. His wife works as a cashier and his children are on their own. He has been working as a taxi driver for five years. At times he drives several kilometers before he gets passengers and on bad days when people do not need rides, he only wastes gas. However, other days are good. He will use this loan to maintain his vehicle so that he can continue servicing his customers. His goals are to be able to acquire another car and be able to invest in the farm that he owns.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for the maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Delsy,

texts.es:
La mayor parte de su vida, Delsy la ha dedicado al cuidado de su hogar y a sus tres hijos que hoy tienen dieciocho, once y siete años. No fue sino hasta cuando una amiga le comento sobre los préstamos de EDAPROSPO que empezó a pensar que la idea de tener un negocio propio le seria menos difícil. Es así que empezó a vender gaseosas.

Poco a poco, en tres años, ha ido aumentando el negocio en la cantidad de mercadería. Hoy en día no solo vende gaseosas también cervezas y algunos dulces. Por otro lado, Delsy también es propietaria de un mototaxi, transporte que alquila para que sea trabajado.

Mas adelante, Delsy tiene planeado conseguir el capital suficiente para poder comprar un automóvil y alquilarlo como taxi. Ella y su esposo se encargan de mantener el hogar. Su esposo trabaja como soldador para una empresa.
texts.en:
Delsy has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her home and her 3 children, who are 18, 11, and 7 years old. It wasn’t until a friend told her about the EDAPROSPO loans that she began to think that having her own business might not be so difficult. That is how she began selling soft drinks. Over the past three years she has slowly increased the amount of merchandise she has. Today she not only sells soft drinks but also beer and some candy. Delsy also owns a mototaxi that she rents out to drivers as a form of transportation. In the future Delsy plans on obtaining enough capital to buy a car and rent it out as a taxi. She and her husband are both responsible for maintaining their home. Her husband works as a welder for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his arable lands and to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. SokH. H. is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Phearum Chea, is 30 years old. They were married in 2003 and have two young sons. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mr. Phearum Chea has been a fisherman since he was young. He fishes from the river and lake nearby his house and sells them in his village. Besides fishing, he is a farmer as well. SokH. stays at home to take care of her children and assists her husband in the farming business.

Phearum doesn’t have enough fishing materials so SokH. is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Tedoro Giovanni

texts.es: Teodoro Giovanni Q. D. tiene 42 años de edad, es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad económica es una pulpería la cual surge como una nueva fuente de ingreso para su familia. Este le ha permitido mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y brindarle un trabajo a su esposa en el mismo hogar lo que permite estar al cuidado de los niños el mayor tiempo posible ha  sufrido mucho con el alza de los precios en los productos y es por esto que solicita a Fundación León 2000 un financiamiento de manera que le permita comprar productos por mayor a un menor precio y asi ofrecerle a sus clientes un precio justo. Los de seos del son aumentar sus ventas y mantener el núcleo familiar estable en todos los ámbitos.
texts.en:
Teodoro Giovanni Q. D. is 42 years old, married, and has 2 small children. His economic activity is a general store that serves as a new source of income for his family, which has helped him improve their standard of living somewhat. It also provides work for his wife within the home, allowing her to care for their children. He has suffered the most because of high prices, which is why he requests financing from Fundación León 2000. He could then buy products at lower wholesale cost and, in turn, sell them to his customers at fair prices. His wishes are to increase sales and to maintain a stable family nucleus in all areas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Giovanna Andrea

texts.es: La señora  Giovanna  es un cliente antiguo, en su historial crediticio tiene cero dias de atraso, lo cual indica que es una persona responsable y cumplida.  La señora  Giovanna se dedica a la elaboracion de chompas y chamarras de tela corderoy, su mercado esta ubicado en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vende en la feria 16 de julio de El Alto, como tambien a la feria de desaguadero; el esposo  se dedica a la tapiceria de movilidades trabaja en su mismo domiclio, ella tiene un niño pequeño que tiene apenas un año ellos piensan trabajar fuerte para construir un patrimonio para su hijo, el destino del credito es la compra de mas tela para la produccion en linea en tiempo de demanda.
texts.en:
Giovanna is an old client, and in all her history of loan repayment, she has never been even a day late--a clear sign that she is a responsible and upstanding person. Giovanna makes jackets and sweaters out of corduroy, which she sells at different fairs in La Paz, such as the July 16th fair in El Alto, or the Desaguadero fair. Her husband works out of their home in automobile re-upholstery. They have a son who is barely a year old, and they plan to work hard to build an inheritance for him. This loan will be used for the purchase of more fabric for assembly-line style production during times of demand.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Fagbohun

texts.en: F. sells wine, drinks and juice in her shop. F. is 44 years old and she is married with three children. F. is requesting a loan of 140,000 nairas to purchase more wine, drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more wine, juice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge Alberto Guzmán, tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en el barrio Monimbo, ubicado en Masaya, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , de 18 y 16 años estudiantes universitarios ,los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ;  don Jorge desde hace 21 años se dedica a darle mantenimientos a Audio, el inicio este negocio con sus propios esfuerzos , Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales para la reparación de Parlantes. Y poder dar siempre una buena atención a los clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con el préstamo ya que a través de ellos ha logrado comprar los productos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto G. is 43 years old, lives in the Monimbo neighborhood in Masaya with his wife and two children. His wife helps with household expenses and his children, 18 and 16 years old, are university students. His goal is to improve his family's living conditions. For the past 21 years Jorge has worked repairing audio equipment, an enterprise he began on his own. With this loan, he intends to buy material used in repairing speakers in order to provide his customers with better service. He thanks Afodenic for the help it's given him through this loan since it has allowed him to purchase the materials needed for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase speakers and other equipment

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es: Dorotea del Carmen Gómez tiene 60 años. Su negocio es la venta de furtas y verduras, tiene 4 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con una hija de 22 anos. Hace más de 32 anos que se dedica a este negocio.es una mujer emprendedora que tomo ese negocio, como el medio para salir adelante siendo madre soltera de 4 niños. Ella necesita el financiamiento para poder comprar mercadería  porque todos los días tiene que levantarse muy temprano en busca de sus productos, lo que más le  gusta de trabajo es ofrecerles a sus clientes las frutas más frescas y obtener la satisfacción de sus clientes. El mayor sueño es poder terminar  de reparar su vivienda ya que será lo único que dejara a sus  hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Dorotea del Carmen Gómez is 60. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has four children, but she currently only lives with her 22 year old daughter. She has been is this business for over 32 years. She is an enterprising woman, who took this business as a means for a single mother of four children to get ahead. She needs the loan to be able to buy merchandise. Every day she has to get up very early to search for her products. What she likes most about her work is offering her customers the freshest fruit and obtaining customer satisfaction. Her biggest dream is to be able to finish repairs on her house. It is the only thing she can leave her children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena A. sells palm oil, 'kenkey', and other foodstuffs at Bronyinima near Elmina. Philomena has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a public servant.

Philomena has been selling palm oil, 'kenkey', foodstuffs and so on since 1998. She is responsible for the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more of her foodstuffs to sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more of her  foodstuffs to sell at the market

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es: La señora Nimia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes.Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Nimia, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y prepararse día a día a lo que la vida se le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children (1 is still a dependent). Her strength and desire for her children to succeed are what motivated her to start her own grocery store. She manages her business out of her home, which is well equipped for attending to her customers. The revenues generated from her business have enabled her to support her family. She has been gaining customers since she started her business and now she has a regular clientele who come to her store to shop because it has all the products a housewife would need. Nimia personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality.

With her loan of 1800 soles she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packaged noodles, milk, various brands of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products. This will help her continue providing good service to her customers.

Nimia has the strength to continue working and she prepares herself every day for what life presents. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to restock her store

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: A. Alice est née vers 1948 à Abomey. Alice est mère de quatre  enfants.  Alice vit à Fridjrossè  à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Alice survient à ses besoins.  C’est du charbon de bois que Alice vend chez elle à domicile. Alice achète ses produits auprès des camionneurs. Alice est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Alice a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle n’en possède pour augmenter la quantité de son stock de charbon de bois. C’est la raison pour laquelle Alice demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Alice A. was born around 1948 in Abomey. Alice is the mother of four children. Alice lives in Fridjrossè in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Thanks to the income from her business, Alice is able to provide for herself. Alice sells charcoal at her house. Alice buys her products from haulers. Alice is a client of ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) who has always repaid her loans without incident. Alice needs greater financial means than what she possesses in order to increase her stock of charcoal. It is for this reason that Alice is seeking a loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov P., 37, is married and lives with her husband and two of her children in Takeo Province. She and her husband sell palm sugar to earn a living and are able to make US $10 each day in profits. To earn more money, this couple is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a stock of palm sugar.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of palm sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria W. is from the village of  Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 46 years old and married, with 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling fruits like mangoes. Maria has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery items

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie B. is from the village of Tru-cut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Tessie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a 39-year-old single mother of four children between the ages of 11 and 17. All her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. Kasifa takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and gets three meals a day, but has no piped water. She incurs transportation costs to and from shopping in Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city.

Kasifa has a retail shop in Natete and sells all types of goods like salt, sugar, flour and soap. She pays rent of about $27 a month for her business premises and about $16 a month for her residence. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of twenty customers a day and sells to all categories of people.

Her largest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children and monthly rent for her business and her residence. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her.

Kasifa has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her 10th loan and working with the same group mates. Kasifa joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She wants to see her business grow bigger and would like to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of salt, bags of sugar and boxes of soap

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly L. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental. Beverly is 29 years old and married with 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling bananas in her local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is fifty-two years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Abena works very hard to provide for her children. She is a baker, procuring bags of flour from nearby communities. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers in her community. She also deals in pastries.

Abena has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: Née en 1975, T. Marie Claire est mariée à YOVO G. Raoufou un cuisinier. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont à sa charge. La famille vit ensemble depuis trois ans à Djèrègbé Gbokpa, sur la route de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. N'ayant jamais fréquenté l'école, Marie Claire mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (riz, accompagné de poissons frits et de sauce) à l'école primaire publique d'Agonkanmè à Porto-Novo. Marie Claire s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Marie Claire mène cette activité depuis 5 ans, mais n'a encore jamais bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de ses élèves, Marie Claire ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Marie Claire sollicite un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Marie Claire T. is married to G. Raoufou YOVO, a cook. The couple have six children, all educated, of which four are under her care. The whole family has been living for the past three years in Djèrègbé Gbokpa, on the road to Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Benin. The couple share household expenses. As she never attended school, Marie Claire’s activity is selling food (rice, accompanied by fried fish and sauce) at the public primary school of Agonkanmé in Porto-Novo. Marie Claire has been doing this for five years, but has never requested a loan from ALIDé before. Facing an escalating demand from the pupils, Marie Claire wishes to expand her activity and improve the satisfaction of her customers. For this reason she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sauce condiments (tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Brigid

texts.en: Brigid K. K. is 48 years old and married with two children, 27 and 30 years old. His business is located at Makongeni, a busy market in Thika, the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. He has been selling watermelon for the last two years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is an unsteady supply. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy more watermelon to expand his business. He hopes to have many business outlets and supply his cereals to different parts of the country in future. He is very innovative and wants to be a market leader in this business.

loans.use: to buy watermelon

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mr. Phorn P., 38, is a hardworking man who resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Phorn P. was married many years ago and has three kids who attend school and depend on his income. To earn a daily income, Phorn P. always leaves home to go to rural areas where he buys oxen at reasonable prices from farmers so that he can fatten them for a while and then resell them. He is able to earn around $5 each day to manage his family’s daily requirements. He has a life partner in his wife, who sells a few vegetables in the market. Phorn P. desires to improve his business and is requesting a loan of $500 from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. He will buy more animals to sell for extra income.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Julia M. se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado Mayoreo donde a diario vende las frutas como mandarinas, naranjas, limones y otros.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas para llenar sus canastos y así ofrecer dichos perecederos a los clientes que a diario le visitan y así lograr su satisfacción. Espera que el crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente por la institución.
texts.en:
Ana sells fruit, such as mandarin oranges, oranges, limes, etc at the Mayoreo market daily. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fruit to fill her baskets and be able to offer perishables to satisfy her customers who visit her daily. She hopes that the institution will be able to grant this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit for resale

loans.name: Alexander Rojas Molina

texts.es:
Alexander R. M. es  un señor  de 33 años de edad quien vive con su madre  en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Don Alexander se dedica a la agricultura, en estos momentos el se dedica a la siembra de yuca, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente Don Alexander está solicitando un préstamo de ¢400000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para ampliar su siembra y así ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame. 
Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Con esto desea iniciar un proyecto exitoso que le permita ayudar a su madre la cual depende solo de el y se encuentra muy enferma. 


El es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Alexander R. M. is a 33 year old gentleman who lives with his mother in the small community of La Trinchera de Pital in Alajuela Province. The main activities of the region are livestock production and agriculture, with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapples that are sold primarily to international markets. For this reason, community development has increased in recent years and has generated more demand for goods and services by providing more job opportunities.

Don Alexander is a farmer. At the moment he is devoted to growing cassava, a tuber that has a pleasant flavor and is rich in nutrients. Agro-industrial processing of this crop has increased because demand is great in Costa Rica and in other countries.

Don Alexander is currently requesting a loan of 400,000 CRC to increase his harvest. This will help with preparing the land for planting by purchasing seeds, fertilizers, composts, and other supplies that are necessary to ensure an optimum output. With this investment, he hopes for a good harvest that produces a product with the appropriate features that will command a higher sales price. The start of a successful project will allow him to help his mother because she is solely dependent on him and very ill.

Don Alexander is a member of the Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He also actively participates in his local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his farmland for growing cassava

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Florida” esta representado por la señora Luisa y conformado por 11miuembros, D. las cuales 7 son mujeres y 4 son varones,  este grupo se caracteriza ya que ser gente muy trabajadora y dinámica, todos se conocen entre si gracias a que la mayoría resiD. ene la misma zona. La señora Maria Luisa tiene un hijo y actualmente es propietaria D. su propia vivienda ella tiene su concubino con el que vive ya 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en la puerta D. un colegio y desea poder ampliar su negocio y poder tener un kiosco en la cual pueda vender comida a demás D. golosinas para poder generar un mayor ingreso para poder darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su hijo y poder formar una familia con su compañero. El resto del grupo tiene diferentes actividades ya que la mayoría venden golosinas y emparedados en las puertas D. los colegios y otros son porteros D. los colegios donD. viven junto a sus familias, otros se dedican a la albañilea, zapatería, y como empleadas domesticas y el servicio D. lavado D. ropa a domicilio. La competencia en los negocios es bastante amplia pero ellos siguen adelante ya que cuentan con bastante experiencia en sus negocios. El crédito actual es para capital D. operaciones, las cuales las socias invierten en compra D. mercadería o herramientas para sus trabajos. El banco tiene bastante experiencia ya que se encuentran cumpliendo un ciclo mas dentro D. la institución siempre demostrando unidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias dándoles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group "La Florida" is represented by Luisa and is comprised of 11 members, including 7 women and 4 men. This group is characterized as having very dynamic and hardworking people. They all know each other since they live in the same neighborhood. Maria Luisa has a son and now owns her own home. She has a partner who she has lived with for 2 years. She sells snacks at the entrance gate of a school, and she wants to be able to expand her business. She wants to have a kiosk where she can sell food in addition to snacks in order to generate a better income so that she can proviD. a better quality of life for her son and can form a family with her partner. The rest of the group has a variety of activities: the majority sell snacks and sandwiches at the gates of schools, others are caretakers of the schools where they live with their families, others are bricklayers, shoemakers and domestic employees, and others proviD. laundry services from their home. The competition in these businesses is strong, but they continue to forge ahead, since they all have quite a bit of experience in their businesses. This loan will be used for working capital; it will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and tools for their work. This communal bank has experience, as they are carrying out another loan cycle with the institution, always demonstrating unity, honesty and the desire to work hard to get ahead and proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy merchandise and tools

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia P. is a devoted mother to her two children. She lives in the beautiful province of Binangonan, Rizal with her family. She owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store in their village. Despite many challenges in their life, they never gave up fighting against poverty.

She plans to utilize this loan of Php 19,000 to expand and support the maintenance of her general store,  the primary source of daily income. This loan will be used for additional capital to buy groceries for her general store.

During her 2 years at ASHI, she has shown very good performance as a member, and she is trusted by ASHI for her solid record. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in her credit rating (basis of loans) in ASHI, Letecia has also cared for the needs of her family at home.

This loan will enable her to finally reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business,a  good life, and a happy family as well. 

Letecia believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, as well as provide for the needs of her family. She is very grateful to ASHI and KIVA for the continuous love and support of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy groceries of her store.

loans.name: Chok

texts.en: Chok L., 52, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She stays at home to raise piglets while her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses.  L. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to buy a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa P. es socia del bankito Santa Ana, vive en la parroquia que lleva el mismo nombre, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su gente ya que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, y muchos de su habitantes sale a la ciudad para realizar varias actividades, su iglesia es el principal centro turístico de la parroquia.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a lo quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría de chanchos, pollos, vacas vendiendo su leche y también lo utiliza para su consumo.

Doña Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 15, 11 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su segundo hijo no le gusta el estudio y trabaja en la construcción, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, nos comenta que era socia hace tiempo en el banco comunal y se alejo por cuestiones ajenas a su voluntad pero ahora de nuevo regresa, con su crédito lo va  a invertir para la compra de chanchos y así mantener su negocio, su meta es de llegar a criar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa P. is a member of the Santa Ana bank. She lives in the parish which bears the same name. The community is known for its farmers who work in both agriculture and cattle-raising. Many of the local people work in the city too; its church is the parish’s main tourist attraction. As well as her household chores, Rosa also raises pigs, chickens, and cows. She first sells the milk from the cows, and then eats the meat. Rosa is 37 years old, married, and has four children aged 17, 15, 11, and 6. Her oldest son is a high school student, her second son doesn’t like studying and works in construction. The youngest two attend the local school. Rosa notes that she was a member of the community bank a number of years ago, then withdraw for reasons beyond her control, but is now back again. She is going to use her loan to buy pigs and keep up her business. Her goal is increase the amount of livestock she raises.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Maria Annie

texts.en:
Maria Annie M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Maria Annie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Annie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Annie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Annie is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Maria Annie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Lang Huot Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fifteen people who live in Sdau Kanleng village, located in Kandal province. Mrs. Lang H. is 30 years old and was selected as the village bank president. Each of the group members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Lang H. owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money to support her famiL. along with her husband, Mr. Chhit Khley, who is a fisherman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  To improve her business, Mrs. Lang H. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. She is a mother of four children; three of whom are attending the local public school, while the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana Y. is a widow taking care of seven dependants. Nana smokes fish to sell in Elmina. She has been in this business for 30 years. She has not received any formal education. She is able to manage her home with the income she makes from her sales. Nana will use this loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke for sale
